job_description:
Job Posting # 914304

Position: Financial Analyst II

Site: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre

Department: Cancer Clinical Research Unit

Reports to: Senior Business Analyst, CCRU

Salary Grade: N6

Status:
Permanent
Full Time


University Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of
Financial Analyst II
in our
Cancer Clinical Research Unit.

Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning. The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.

University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's five research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.

Position:

The Cancer Clinical Research Unit has a mandate to lead and promote clinical research within the PMH Cancer Program through standardization of processes and encouraging a culture of responsibility and accountability in clinical trials. The Financial Analyst III performs a wide range of professional accounting activities requiring application of an advanced professional and competent knowledge of accounting concepts, principles and practices. The Financial Analyst II will be a key support to the Senior Business Analyst, and principal investigators with the Princess Margaret Cancer Program in the analysis, reporting, reconciliation of the financial activities related to clinical trials. This Analyst position requires an action-oriented individual, with an accounting background, strong technical skills, good business acumen, demonstrated problem solving capabilities and a good understanding of accounting principles. The ideal candidate possesses the ability to work with individuals from other areas to achieve objectives combined with analytical and problem solving skills, an eye for detail, the ability to and initiative to follow up on items, or determine appropriate steps for timely resolution.

Working under the direction of the Director, the
Financial Analyst II
, will conduct key tasks including


General ledger and account reconciliation

Generating invoices to sponsors

monitoring interdepartmental cost recoveries

Assisting with budgeting of clinical trials

Coordinating the preparation and analysis schedules, statements and reports for internal and external stakeholders

Other tasks as assigned and adhoc requests, which may include, but are not limited to, developing accounting system for clinical trials, contributing to business cases for program expansion/consolidation ect., or participating on special committees



QUALIFICATIONS:


University degree in Business Administration or equivalent program, required

Working towards completion of a professional accounting program (e.g.,
CPA
), or relevant combination of education and experience

Previous experience in a healthcare setting, and or research funding an

Expert knowledge of Excel; strong knowledge of Access and PowerPoint

3 years’ relevant experience

Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Ability to prioritize

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Ability to work independently and as a team player

Experience with financial modeling, financial and cost accounting and with analyzing and interpreting large quantities of financial and statistical data; systems thinker

Client service oriented, with the ability to effectively work with diversity and appreciate that people with different opinions, backgrounds and characteristics bring richness to the challenge or situation at hand



Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code

If you are interested in making your contribution at UHN, please apply on-line. You will be asked to copy and paste as well as attach your resume and covering letter. You will also be required to complete some initial screening questions.

POSTED DATE: February 8, 2023 CLOSING DATE: March 09, 2023

For current UHN employees, only those who have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, and possess all the required experience and qualifications should apply.

UHN thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Who we areYou know those big cities that still feel like small towns? Where everyone's friendly and helps each other out? That's like Grant Thornton. Except here we're all professionals and there isn't a mayor or a general store. What we're trying to say is that we're a large and growing professional services firm that still feels like a community. We employ over 2500 people across Canada, and we truly care about our colleagues, our clients and the communities where we work and live. That's what's most important to us. We're building a thriving organization that's purpose driven and still want to remember what your favourite milkshake flavour is.As a Manager, Domestic Tax your responsibilities will include:• Review of income tax returns for high net worth individuals, corporations, estates and trusts.• Analysis, planning and implementation of reorganizations of private companies and other assets, including sale of privately-held business• Estate and succession planning for high net worth clients• Post-mortem estate planning• Overseeing multiple client engagements across various industries• Providing significant input into broader innovations for the service line to anticipate clients' requirements• Assisting business development management for target industries and sectors and supporting client business requirements in new and innovative ways• Participating in the overall development of the Grant Thornton brand through internal and external activities and knowledge of industry• Coaching more junior advisory team members and ensuring a meaningful performance review process • Leveraging technical proficiency to advise and guide team members at lower levels• Attending client and stakeholder meetings with the Tax team• Assisting the Partners and Managers with strategy and implementation of strategy• Preparing and review files for Partner • Help identify and generate new business opportunitiesBe Grant ThorntonIf you're a bit like us, you're driven to connect with how others are feeling and thinking. Here we walk in others shoes before taking action. Just imagine being part of a team that puts "we before me", where flexAbility is a mindset, and where you trust your colleagues to have your back. At Grant Thornton, you'll work with inspiring leaders who support your development, both personally and professionally. This is a place where your insatiable curiosity enables you to think, see and hear from a variety of perspectives, a place where every day is different and having the courage to grow is part of who you are. And when all this comes together, well that's when the magic happens!Want to learn more about who we are and how we live our purple every day? Read our colleagues' stories at www.discoveryourpurple.ca Think you've got what it takes to be a Manager, Domestic Tax? Like the colour purple? Great. Here's a few more boxes we're also hoping you can tick:• CPA, CGA, CMA designation• Completion of CICA In-depth tax program• 3 years minimum public practice experience in Canadian income tax• Strong organizational, oral and written communication skills• Proactively growing the firm through differentiating the Grant Thornton brand in the marketplace, supporting and driving business development• A commitment to exceptional client service• Desire to learn and grow, and be an integral part of a high-performing teamAt Grant Thornton we're focused on making a difference in the lives of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. That's our purpose. Or, as we like to say, living our purple. Are you ready to Discover Your Purple? #LI-HYBRIDGrant Thornton LLP is committed to employment equity, human rights and respectful workplace principles throughout the life cycle of employment, including at the recruitment and hiring stages. We welcome applications from members of all equity deserving groups, including persons with disabilities, women, racialized and/or Indigenous applicants. Should you require accommodation in relation to the recruitment process, please notify us by emailing careers@ca.gt.com and we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs. BackShareApply Now

job_title_name: SaaS/Apps Technical Analyst for Online Due Diligence Provider CA
job_description:
Hello Tech Analysts!

My name is Nate Ginsburg and I am a serial entrepreneur. I'm the owner of Centurica, founder of SellerPlex, and partner in a handful of other online businesses. To learn more about me (and get an idea about my values and whether we synergize with each other), please have a look at my personal website and social media channels.


Centurica is the premier provider of Due Diligence services for online business acquisitions. This means our clients hire us to review their acquisitions to ensure the business is what the seller says it is, uncover any risks, as well as identify growth opportunities.

About the role:

We are looking for an experienced Technical analyst, whose main responsibilities would be to cover Technical Due Diligence scope for Saas products & Apps. Ideally you would have a strong technical / product development background. Additional growth/marketer background would be beneficial as well.

We are looking to hire a Tech Analyst who can analyze tech for Saas & Apps businesses as a part of the due diligence process. Basically, you'll need to do an audit of their tech and provide a report that we can share with our client that typically are Business Investors/Buyers looking to acquire Saas and/or Apps. We will work together with you on the scope of the audit. But you will be the one to perform it and prepare the findings.

Our ideal candidate is someone with a strong track record working on different SaaS projects, who is a great communicator, is hungry, takes initiative, is creative, and invests in continuous learning and growth. To ensure success as a SaaS Analyst you should be adept at data mining, business intelligence, report writing, and process optimization.

This will start as an remote hourly or project based role, but if it goes well there will be a lot of opportunities for similar projects. WIth the potential to full time.

We are looking for someone in North America/South America time zones as most of our team and clients are in these time zones. If the right fit, we could consider candidates from Europe as well.

Responsibilities (but are not limited to):


Tech Stack assessment (How stable is the technology?; How easy is it to transfer to a new owner and maintain?

Organization & Processes assessment (IT Strategy; Product/Software Development Processes; Efficiency of Service Ticket Resolution etc)

Operations, Infrastructure & Security assessment (Architecture & Hosting; Data Security & Protection; API/Third-party Connections; Scalability)

Competition Analysis (including Risk & Threats assessment)

Quality Assessment

Summary of the findings to Include Risk Assessment and/or Actionable strategic recommendations for the new owner.


Equally important to skillset fit is culture fit, so please review some of my social posts to get a sense of me as a person and if you think you'd enjoy working with me and if we have aligned values.
Please note that you'll be joining a fast pace and high achieving team. You'll be held to high expectations and challenged. And you'll also be supported in your growth in this role professionally as well as personally.

If this sounds interesting to you please proceed with your application.

Requirements


Strong SaaS Products and Apps Analysis experience

Wide range of technical skills and experience

Detail-oriented and analytical thinker

Great command of English

Very strong communication skills both in writing and speaking

Hard-working and ambitious

Values being a part of a fast-paced, growth mindset team

Values delivering great work to support our growth

Takes initiative to solve problems BEFORE asked


Benefits


Work with a fully remote team

Completely remote and flexible schedule

Location independence

You'll be joining a high-level and fast-paced team, working with exciting businesses and projects

Ability to make an impact on a business with huge potential

Join the Johnvince Foods team!
Johnvince Foods is a family owned and operated Canadian business, with more than 45 years of experience processing, manufacturing and distributing bulk and packaged products across North America. Our nut products, confections and other food products include many of the most recognizable brands enjoyed in households every day, including Planters Peanuts. Our proud team is 800+ strong and growing every day.
Johnvince Foods is proud to be recognized as a Platinum member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies for over 10 years.
We are currently seeking an energetic self-starter to join our team as a full-time
Bookkeeper
.
About this opportunity:
Reporting to the Chief Investment Officer (CIO), this is a unique opportunity for the ideal candidate to utilize their education and experience to provide accounting support to the process of sourcing, qualifying, investing and managing a large and varied number of investments in real estate, limited partnerships and equities. In addition, the incumbent will provide administrative support to the CIO.
The Bookkeeper is responsible for overseeing, coordinating and administering the financial records, systems and processes of the Society, including accounting, bookkeeping, payroll and benefits, record keeping, banking, insurance and all related financial and office administration. Addressing day-to-day issues arising within the portfolio.
Your work experience, combined with a strong work ethic, attention to detail and the ability to work independently and collaboratively in our fast-paced environment will make you the successful candidate and a valuable member of the Johnvince team.
Your responsibilities:


Manage the company’s paper and electronic data records, ensuring their completeness and integrity.

Record detailed transactions for individual investments under assigned portfolio.

Collect, allocate and post transactions. Post general ledger entries using Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, reconcile accounts, prepare trial balance.

Prepare internal financial statements, investigating any discrepancies and prepare various other financial reports.

Record detailed foreign exchange transactions and contracts, verifying the accuracy and completeness of information.

Provides administrative support to the CIO including maintaining appointment schedule, preparing correspondence and respond to phone and email enquiries, etc.

Work safely, following legislation and established safe work procedures and practices.

Other duties as assigned.


Your qualifications:


Post Secondary degree or diploma in an accounting related program.

Minimum three years relevant work experience.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills.

Strong attention to detail and accuracy.

Proficiency with Microsoft Office and accounting software (such as Simply Accounting or AS400).


We offer:


Competitive compensation and health and benefits package.

Employee discount in our retail store.

Work / life balance.

Career growth.

Our office is conveniently located at Dufferin & Finch and easily accessible by public transit.


If you are looking for an opportunity in a fast paced, team-oriented environment, please submit your resume electronically.
Johnvince embraces diversity and encourages all qualified applicants to apply. Please inform us if you will require any accommodation during the recruitment process. Please note that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Work might involve exposure to nuts and/or nut-based products.

About Us



We are looking for a Property Adjuster to join our team!





Who we are



As Canada's largest automobile association, we are passionate about keeping our Members safe- whether they are on the road, at home, or travelling abroad. Meeting the diverse needs of our two-million Members requires high performing, forward thinking, and innovative people who work collaboratively to keep propelling our business forward. Life at CAA Club Group is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development- and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results. CAA Club Group (CCG) is known for providing stellar emergency roadside assistance to our motoring Members and non-Members. We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it.





Position Details



Our claims team is looking for a Property Adjuster who will be responsible for:


Investigate, evaluate, analyze, negotiate and settle property claims (low to moderate severity in nature)

Interpret policy conditions, legislation and confirm coverage for policy holders

Conduct investigations, which include taking phone statements, coordinating services with service providers, consulting with contractors and vendors, etc.

Evaluate liability, salvage and subrogation exposure and potential

Contact and coordinate all parties involved in all stages of the claims process

Review and analyze initial losses to ensure file meets assignment criteria

Respond to client complaints and appeals

Determine proper kind of loss (KOL) reserves based on exposure and authority level

Examine claims files handled by Independent Adjusters when required

Prepare and maintain various reports on property claims

General support of claims area and special projects as required



Requirements:


2-3 years business experience, preferably in Property and Casualty insurance

An educational background including relevant post-secondary education

CIP designation or working towards a CIP designation

Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills

Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

Excellent organizational skills are essential

Career minded individuals whom have demonstrated a career path



As an organization we are focused on Member safety, which includes the safety and well-being of our Associates. Therefore, you must be and remain fully vaccinated as a condition of employment.





Our Commitment



We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). CAA CCG will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

job_description:

Permanent

Our Purpose


At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.


Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.

Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems.

Experience MyFlex and an agile work environment where work is what you do not where you do it.







Are you an actuary looking for a new challenging and rewarding career opportunity? Do you want to work for Canada’s largest professional services firm? Then look no further! Deloitte is looking for future opportunities by August 2021.






What will your typical day look like?



As a Manager in the Actuarial practice, you will be leading teams and engagements and contributing to market initiatives. You will:


Support practice leaders by delivering Life work on a wide range of consulting projects within actuarial, underwriting / claims and advanced analytics domains

Lead engagement teams on projects including IFRS 17, advanced analytics, Robotics Process Automation (RPA), and actuarial transformation.

Drive developments of new market offerings by contributing with innovative approaches

Be expected to stay abreast of technical Life industry developments like IFRS 17 and LICAT, etc. as well as broader industry developments in the fields such as InsurTech, Advanced Analytics, and Blockchain

Understand our purpose and values; explore opportunities for impact

Authentically engage with our team of dynamic professional to develop, motivate and coach them to meet their goals

Demonstrate a strong commitment to personal learning and development; act as a brand ambassador to help attract top-talent

Work with high profile clients operating in the North American Life Insurance (Life) space as well as within the broader insurance space. Opportunities to work on projects in Europe, Asia and Latin America.






About the team



Work in a fast growing, challenging and rewarding environment with practitioners who are eminent in their respective areas of expertise. Engage with clients by developing innovative solutions through R&D and discussion, both within our teams as well as with our clients. Work with high profile clients operating in the North American Life Insurance (Life) space as well as within the broader insurance space.
Our Canadian Actuarial team is over 70 strong, and has tripled in size over 5 years. We are part of Deloitte’s worldwide actuarial network, which includes over 1000 actuarial professionals working in 43 countries. AIS is part of Deloitte’s Assurance & Advisory practice and provides a wide range of consulting services.





Enough about us, let’s talk about you #deloitteA&A



You are someone with:


A Masters / Bachelor’s degree from a leading University in the fields Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science or Data Science

A Fellow of the Canadian Institute of Actuaries (FCIA) or equivalent. Relevant post-fellowship experience coupled with post-actuarial credentials like an MBA, CERA or CFA

5 plus years Life working experience in the industry within an insurance company, reinsurer, insurance broker or accounting / consulting firm

Technical experience with IFRS17 topics including PAA and GMA, assumptions, data requirements and financial statement/position presentation would be considered a strong asset

(Advanced) Knowledge of actuarial software packages like AXIS, PathWise, or MATLAB

Programming skills (Visual Basic, R, Python, etc.) and visualization tools like Tableau an asset



PLEASE NOTE: We excpect to actively recruit for this role in September.





Our promise to our people: Deloitte is where potential comes to life.


Be yourself, and more.

We are a group of talented people who want to learn, gain experience, and develop skills. Wherever you are in your career, we want you to advance.

You shape how we make impact.

Diverse perspectives and life experiences make us better. Whoever you are and wherever you’re from, we want you to feel like you belong here. We provide flexible working options to support you and how you can contribute. Be the leader you want to be.

Be the leader you want to be

Some guide teams, some change culture, some build essential expertise. We offer opportunities and experiences that support your continuing growth as a leader.

Have as many careers as you want.

We are uniquely able to offer you new challenges and roles – and prepare you for them. We bring together people with unique experiences and talents, and we are the place to develop a lasting network of friends, peers, and mentors. Our TVP is about relationships – between leaders and their people, the firm and its people, peers, and within in our communities.


The next step is yours


At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.






































































































Job Title





































Business Banking Advisor, RBC Advice Centre | Conseiller, Services aux entreprises, , Centre de conseils RBC






































Job Description






































What is the opportunity?

The Business Banking Advisor within the Advice Center is responsible for providing professional, attentive, and accurate banking services to our clients in a contact center environment. You will be responding to clients proactively offering value added service including digital advice, opportunity spotting, and taking accountability for the resolution of their concerns. Keeping client experience in mind, you will ensure that clients receive an optimal service at a level that meets their needs. This is a full-time and shift oriented role with an opportunity to potentially work from home.


What will you do?


Provide professional financial advice to new and existing business clients

Recommend products, services, and/or share information with clients to meet their unique immediate and future financial needs

Support business & personal product and service recommendations with details that are easily understood and convert value towards the clients’ stated needs

Manage risk and compliance routines when carrying out transactions

Achieve higher levels of proficiency by providing effective advice to clients regarding deposit, cash management and payment processing needs

Demonstrates commitment to First Call Resolution by taking ownership & accountability of client problems at first point of contact

Proven customer service and sales skills, preferably in the financial or service industry, and a track record of success in a client-focused, target-driven performance culture

An aptitude for listening, establishing rapport and finding the right solutions for customers

Excellent telephone manner, IT literacy, and digital knowledge, as well as multi-tasking and problem-solving skills

An interest in mobile and digital devices and an ability to help clients navigate through self-serve applications

Strong English oral and written communication skills (bilingualism in French is an asset)

Flexibility to work various shifts that meet our clients’ needs between Monday to Friday 7 AM to 11 PM (EST), Saturday 7am – 10pm EST & Sunday 8 AM – 10 PM (EST)

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference in our client’s lives and to our communities.

Regularly complete audit checklists to ensure compliance with underwriting rules, guidelines and practices

job_title_name: Unit Business Risk and Compliance Co-Worker
job_description:
What you'll need to have



You have previous experience in the Health and Safety and Security sector and/or Safety and Security experience within a Retail environment.

You’re knowledgeable of relevant safety standards and regulations, security processes, tools and working methods.

You’re energized by the implementation of safeguards that bring value to the business and protect the financial and moral position; you can ensure the integrity of safety and security systems, guidelines and documentation.

You know how to conduct a risk assessment and implement the hierarchy of controls.

You have good communication and documentation skills in dealings with various levels of management.

You think and work in a risk-based way (i.e. Evaluate trade-offs between potential costs and benefits and acts accordingly).

You have good analytical and numerical skills.


A day in your life with us



Promote risk management in the unit, informing and sharing expertise in order to develop risk-aware decision taking in relation to unit goals and unit business plan.

Support co-workers, by providing expertise, in acting in accordance with Ingka Risk & Compliance Rules and Local legislation on Health Safety and Security to secure a safe environment for customers and co-workers.

Promote and ensure completion of trainings needed and facilitate for unit employees.

Support a Risk & Compliance culture by utilizing systems to detect, analyze and reduce business loss and financial impact.

Ensure the reporting of relevant figures for co-workers, customer and visitor incidents to establish progress and areas for improvement.


Together as a team

You could think that we have supernatural powers, but the truth is that our team is really great at putting our insights together to detect potential risks early on. We’re a diverse group of people who work together to protect and strengthen the IKEA brand through our laser focus on risk management, data protection, compliance, business operations, health and safety. Thanks to us our assets, co-workers, visitors and customers can feel safe. At least we think that’s pretty cool!

JUST SO YOU KNOW

In the IKEA world, this position is officially referred to as Unit Business Risk & Compliance Co-worker.

The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) is North America's third largest transit system and has been recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA. Guided by a forward-thinking strategic plan, the TTC's vision is to be a transit system that makes Toronto proud. The TTC's recruitment efforts are directly aligned to its mission of providing "a reliable, efficient, and integrated bus, streetcar and subway system that draws its high standards of customer care from our rich traditions of safety, service and courtesy."




General Accountability




Reporting to the Executive Director – Finance, the Head, FP&A – Capital is accountable and responsible for providing strategic leadership, effective management, oversight and delivery of financial planning, management, control and reporting services that ensure fiscal accountability and transparency, and that advance the fiscal sustainability of TTC’s 10-year Capital Budget & Plan and 15-year Capital Investment Plan.



The Head is accountable for planning, directing and overseeing all activities of the Department as well as working in partnership with the CEO’s Office and with the City of Toronto in inter-governmental and third-party capital funding advocacy; ensuring related audits and reporting is in compliance with all applicable funding agreements; ensuring corporate oversight and field audits of major capital contracts; and, leading and/or supporting numerous transformational programs, including the TTC’s Finance Transformation and SAP Implementation programs to ensure best and leading practices are employed at the TTC.




Key Job Functions



The Head will lead the development of corporate financial strategies, policies, processes, and reports for TTC’s capital planning and budgeting of the TTC’s 10-year Capital Budget and Plan and annual update for the 15-year Capital Investment Plan from initiation to approval. Once approved, the Head will lead the financial management monitoring and reporting processes and activities. This includes overseeing the development, planning, evaluation, monitoring and reporting of multi-year financial plans, budgets and performance results related to capital planning and budgeting for the delivery of state of good repair and major capital programs in TTC’s 10-year Capital Budget & Plan and 15-year Capital Investment Plan, as well as recommending the most efficient and effective use of resources that meet the strategic priorities of the TTC, the Board and the City of Toronto.

Working in collaboration with other senior management, this role will also support the integration of business planning, capital planning & budgeting, and enterprise asset management to enable end-to-end lifecycle management of TTC’s capital asset portfolio and reporting as required.

Oversee staff providing all multi-year capital planning, budgeting, analysis, advice, management, monitoring and reporting services provided directly to business partners across the organization and in support of TTC’s Senior Management Team, Executive and CEO.

Lead the development and implementation of financial strategies, processes, activities, and reports to support the delivery of capital plans, programs and projects across the organization and maximize TTC’s capital funding by ensuring annual capital budgets are spent, including overseeing root cause analysis and monitoring to ensure implemented solutions are meeting intended outcomes.

Accountable for establishing this Department as a trusted business partner that delivers the highest level of performance, quality and customer service, through relationship-building with senior management, leading through influence, and applying change management approaches and techniques to foster the partnerships needed to fulfill the Department’s vision and meet business partner needs.

Promotes a respectful work and service environment that supports diversity, inclusion, and is free from harassment and discrimination. Provides leadership in the development and implementation of inclusive and accessible policies, programs and/or services for employees and customers in accordance with TTC’s commitments and obligations under the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC) and Related Orders, the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and TTC’s policies.






Education & Experience




Completion of a post-secondary degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, Accounting or a discipline related to the assigned areas of responsibility OR a combination of education, training and experience deemed to be equivalent

A professional accounting designation or graduate degree in a related discipline is preferred

A designation or equivalent knowledge and experience in project cost management, project management or asset management would be considered an asset

Senior level experience gained through progressively more responsible positions in the key functional areas of this position and an in-depth understanding of the service and financial issues facing the TTC, including service delivery, policy development, strategic and service planning, financial and project management, performance measurement and the implementation of best practices

Extensive financial planning and management experience including: applying the principles of multi-year financial planning, forecasting, budgeting and performance management; capital planning and budget formulation, analysis and related processes, including business case development and analysis; evaluation and monitoring; reporting and control, preferably for a comparable public or quasi-public sector organization

In-depth experience with relevant government legislation in the area of governance, municipal finance, authorities, budgeting, funding, financial reporting and service delivery Extensive experience and proven ability as a strong leader, including leading, coaching and motivating diverse, multi-discipline management teams with the ability to effectively plan work, advise on priorities and deadlines, operating as a fully accountable leader

Experience as a transformational leader of complex enterprise-wide modernization programs/projects; knowledge of change management principles, with the ability to lead change management activities and meet transformation objectives and outcomes

Experience with enterprise capital budgeting/financial, asset management and work order systems that manage and report on the end-to-end lifecycle of a capital asset portfolio including leading their implementation, sustainment and the continuous improvement of their functionality

Considerable experience in the design, development and implementation of policies and procedures to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of the capital fiscal program and performance

Extensive experience preparing comprehensive reports and presentations, and analyzing, interpreting and summarizing information for the purpose of presenting and supporting strategic, service and financial decision making.






Additional Requirements





In-depth understanding and application of leading practices, policies, processes and controls regarding asset, financial, project, procurement, commercial, and contract management to ensure an integrated approach to effective capital financial planning and management.

In-depth understanding of interdependencies between operating budgets and capital planning, budgeting and project delivery, including benefits realization, return on investment

Proven ability to apply strategic, analytical and conceptual thinking skills and understand complex service, operating and policy issues, evaluation frameworks, program interrelationships and the potential results and outcomes of policy actions

In-depth understanding of governance and accountability frameworks, principles, and application, preferably in a large public sector organization

Ability to exercise superior problem solving and analytical abilities in order to effectively oversee all activities of the assigned portfolio. Must interpret information from a variety of sources and channels to strategically plan the work, motivate and influence teams engaged in varied activities. Must be able to resolve complex problems and effectively manage departmental functions in the face of rapidly changing conditions, competing priorities and demands and often difficult to achieve deadlines.

Superior communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to facilitate, negotiate, resolve conflict, problem solve and interact with all levels of the organization to forge effective internal and external relationships with the City, outside agencies, partners and/or elected officials

In-depth knowledge and application of strategic, fiscal and human relations and business management and performance practices combined with a thorough knowledge and understanding of applicable human resources policies, collective agreements and legislation/regulations regarding safety, employment, human rights

We’re Northbridge Financial. We’re proud to be 100% Canadian and owned by Fairfax Financial. We serve through our Northbridge Insurance, Federated Insurance, and TruShield Insurance brands. We have a reputation for being one of Canada’s leading commercial property and casualty insurance company. Our employees are dedicated to understanding the needs of our customers and we go above and beyond to help Canadian businesses have a safer and brighter future. We’re a company of passionate people who put people first. Do you want to join a team that believes in working hard – and having fun at work – all while making a difference? Look no further than Northbridge.


Program Overview – New Graduate Claims Training Program


Calling on all recent Grads! Join Northbridge’s Award-Winning culture!


Grads who join our New Grad Program can learn about the three largest departments within our organization; Underwriting, Claims, and Risk Services, as well as some of the Shared Services who support our operations.


The Northbridge New Claims Grad Program is a comprehensive two (2) month educational program that jump-starts your career as a Claims Professional in the insurance industry.


Upon successful completion of the Claims Graduate Program, Grads assume the role of Claims Adjusters within Northbridge’s industry leading Claims Team.


Did we mention that this is program is paid as well?


What Do Claims Professionals Do?


Claims is where the “rubber hits the road”. Until a loss occurs, our customers hold the promise that in the event of a loss we will be there in their time of need. When a claim is reported, our Northbridge Claims Professionals spring into action to ensure the promise we made is fulfilled.


As an adjuster you will lead the investigation, evaluation, and settlement of claims with our customers. You will interpret policies, ensure the loss falls within coverage, and finalize the claim by following the established steps in the claims process. Your keen attention to detail will recognize claims with irregularities and refer them for additional investigation. The Role:
Research Assistant, Corporate Ratings - Credit Estimates


Grade/Level ( relevant for internal applicants only ):
08


The Location:
Toronto, CAN


The Team:

The Credit Estimates team is a close knit team of analysts predominantly based out of Toronto and New York but also with analysts in Latin America, Europe and Asia. The team works very closely to serve the critical middle market CLO constituency and other smaller leveraged loan issuers. Our global team has a fast-paced work flow and we need to communicate seamlessly and collegially across groups. The interactions are largely internal, though there are several opportunities to speak with CLO Managers explaining our CE rationale and our methodology Our team serves as one of the best training grounds for learning credit analysis and how S&P performs its analytical function


The Impact:

The analyses you produce will be used by other S&P teams to rate Collateralized Loan Obligations, and by our clients to evaluate the credit quality of their overall loan portfolios.
CLO Investors and Managers rely on our evaluation of middle market companies. Although our credit opinions are not publicly disclosed, they have a tremendous impact not only on the credit quality of the CLOs we rate but also on the ability of small businesses to borrow from an important segment of the financial markets.
As a Credit Estimate Research assistant you will analyze companies across a variety of sectors and you will learn the most important determinants of credit quality for small and medium sized companies.


What’s in it for you:

Our most successful Credit Estimate Research assistants move up within our team or into the other analytical teams that focus specifically on individual sectors.
Opportunities to work with a global team and hands on high impact credit experience


Responsibilities:

As a Credit Estimates Research assistant, you will analyze company financials and prepare daily company evaluations for review by senior analysts.
You will also assist with detailed financial analysis for use in reports and related materials for S&P Global Ratings publications.
You will work within a global team of analysts to analyze pertinent financial, operational and industry data to determine Credit Estimates.
You will initially spend most of your time learning the methodology by which S&P performs credit analysis and getting familiar with our analytical tools and processes. You will focus on analyzing a number of diverse companies and learn how to evaluate credit quality as efficiently as possible.
As you gain experience, you may deal with investors directly and work on research projects
Over time, strong performers are expected to move into one of the Canadian or US corporate teams as a primary analyst covering their own list of credits


What We’re Looking For:

Strong analytical skills, especially financial statement and quantitative analysis
Some commercial credit or financial services analytical experience
A Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Commerce, Business or Mathematics
Strong Excel skills
Excellent writing and oral communication skills
Strong attention to detail
Preferably progress towards CFA/MBA

Return to Work
Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative, we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.

In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan.

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires .

S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.

S&P Global Ratings offers critical insights for credit, risk and sustainable finance solutions that are essential to translating complexity into clarity, so market participants can uncover opportunities.

job_description:
Our Banking client in
Toronto, Ontario

What you will be doing…


As the Manager in Innovative Analytics Team, you will play a key role in contributing to continuous research, design, and delivery of an advanced multi-disciplined risk analytic platform within the RBC Capital Markets Counterparty Credit Risk Management Team.

Nurturing culture and facilitating learning and knowledge sharing will be second nature to you as well as applying your technical know-how to ensure that the Innovative Analytic team is on the leading edge of technical delivery practices. You’ll have the tools and support needed to achieve extraordinary results that make a significant impact extending beyond the boundaries of traditional technology roles. Ideas start here – and you will build great technology.

If you’re a hands-on technical expert with proven experience operating within high-performing teams, are continuously learning, and excited to collaborate with those around you—we have a spot for you on our team.

Develop a thorough understanding of the current state of CCR analytic frameworks, end-to-end CCR metric generation processes and their connection with various upstream source systems.

Contribute to the research, development, and implementation of new mathematical models for calculating various CCR measures. Considerable amount of creative, innovative & analytical thinking and problem solving is required.

Demonstrate exceptional communication skills (written and oral) by synthesizing key messages across distinct domains into a coherent action plan.

Leverage data analysis, querying and data exploration knowledge on CCR’s diverse number of data sources to perform statistical analysis, build machine learning models and deploy production-grade solutions for identifying insights and opportunities.

Become an expert in understanding CCR Innovative Analytics Team’s exiting libraries, leverage them to support delivery of new initiatives in collaboration with various CCR teams and lead KT sessions when required.

Partner with and support other teams as required; there are many teams, yet we are one team.



What you will need to succeed…

Must Have Skills:


Graduate degree in STEM fields; double-major in Economics/Finance/Business and STEM. Strong grasp of fundamentals in statistics (hypothesis testing, regression, inference, and time series) and one of the key risk pillars (market, credit, or liquidity).

Exceptional development expertise in Python programming writing production-grade code. Expertise with object-oriented and event-driven architecture (OOAD & SOLID principles) and Spark frameworks.

Strong data profiling, cleaning, engineering, mining, and technical documentation skills; SQL/Data Stores: SQL, PostgreSQL, S3, HDFS and SparkQL.

Hands on experience with system configuration and DevOps tools (Jira, Git, GitHub, and Confluence).

Self-starter with excellent communication skills, with proven ability to grow and mentor more junior technical professionals.

Strong quant data background.



Nice-To-Have Skills:


Experience developing interactive and sophisticated dashboards that communicate complex data insights to a diverse set business stakeholder.

Familiarity with building dashboards using Plotly and Dash in Python is an asset.

Experience with Airflow, graph databases, Jupyter Notebooks, other ML-related technologies.

Familiarity running distributed ML workloads in cluster orchestrated environments.

Experience with HTML, CSS and Web Development would be an asset.

What’s it like working as a Financial Analyst, Business Reporting at Community Trust Company?
Community Trust Company (CTC) is a member of the Questrade Group of Companies, currently includes Questrade Inc., Questrade Wealth Management Inc., QuestEnterprise and CTC.

Reporting into the Manager, Reporting, the Financial Analyst, Business Reporting will play a key role in preparing the budgets/forecasts and be an active partner in management reporting. Responsibilities of this role include maintaining a robust forecasting and budgeting process and ensure quality and timeliness of corporate and business unit reporting.

This position requires a critical eye, solid analytical skills, advanced skills in Excel, and excellent attention to detail.

Need more details? Keep reading...
In this role, you will prepare annual budget and monthly rolling forecasts. You will perform detailed variance analysis and provide explanations against board approved budgets/previous forecasts. You will analyze KPIs viz. Leverage ratios, Capital ratios, Net interest margin, RoE etc. on a regular basis. You will prepare presentations for audit committee and board meetings highlighting the most relevant findings. You will work with various business unit heads to obtain inputs for the budgeting and forecasting process. You will prepare 5-year projections as well as perform scenario & sensitivity analysis to assist the leadership with valuable insights for long term strategy formulation. You will assist in preparation of various management reports. You will prepare Monthly Business Unit Statements. You will analyze and report actual results compared to budget and forecast estimates, reviewing appropriate variance explanations, bridge analyses and key financial metrics as part of the month end and quarter end packages. And you will perform various ad-hoc analysis for the executive management team.

So are YOU our next Financial Analyst, Business Reporting? You are if you…

✔ Are a University graduate, business/accounting specialization.

job_title_name: First Nations, Metis, Inuit Candidates- Manager, Quality Assurance
job_description:
The following job posting and assessment questions were crafted by Kiinago Biinoogi Muskiiki (‘Our Children’s Medicine’ in English) in consultation with Indigenous Elders, Knowledge Keepers and other members of the community. Applications housed on this platform provide a unique opportunity for First Nations, Métis and Inuit job seekers to have the option of sharing their whole selves with potential employers, including their lived experience and transferable skills. For more information, visit ourchildrensmedicine.ca


What You’ll Be Doing

As part of Enterprise Digital QA and Publishing team, , you will be responsible for managing a team of testers and publishers. You will be required to oversee and ensure all QA and build activities are completed accurately and on time in support of all digital assets and platforms including but not limited to online, ATM, and mobile platforms. You will guide the team to meet client expectations and SLAs, and adhere to CIBC defined standards and compliance rules, including Accessibility.


How You’ll Succeed


People Management
- Provide Leadership and effective management of business unit staff to influence employee commitment to the organization, to the team and to their job by setting appropriate context when assigning work to ensure that individuals roles support the achievement of the business units priorities and CIBC’s overall goals. Managing performance by providing fair and accurate formal and informal feedback, identifying and removing obstacles to performance and by explaining how performance expectations align with business priorities. Creating a positive work environment and being an effective role model by championing CIBC’s mission, vision and values.

Continuous Improvement & Best Practices
: Improve QA processes through continuous innovation and business shrewdness; providing recommendations/solutions as needed. Consistently encourage industry best practices and recommend sound delivery methodologies.

Business Acumen
- You will be responsible for managing all aspects of the QA function for this team and provide operational expertise. You will also be required to effectively communicate with all functional groups and take advantage of opportunities to build, grow and expand our reach/vision.

Communication Skills –
Strong written and verbal communication with ability to collaborate and work closely with partners and stakeholders. Monitor quality assurance activities to ensure adherence to Audit and Compliance standards, and implement appropriate corrective actions where necessary. Provide regular reports on team deliverables to Sr. QA Manager, as well as recommendations for improved hardware, software and resource allocation.



What CIBC Offers


At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:


Thrive
: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

Connect
: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

Develop
: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning.

Prosper
: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan


REQUIREMENTS


You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

You can demonstrate experience in Quality Assurance (5+ years). A Degree in Computer Science or related discipline is preferred, and ISTQB Foundation Level certification is required. Applicable work experience at a financial institution is preferred.

You have strong knowledge of defect-tracking software (HP Quality Center or JIRA), Content Management Systems (CMS), W3C standards, Windows and MacOS interface standards, and Accessibility requirements testing (WCAG2.0).

Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.


At CIBC, we are in business to help our clients, employees and shareholders achieve what is important to them. Our ability to create value for all CIBC stakeholders is driven by a business culture based on common values: Trust, Teamwork and Accountability. Working with CIBC makes you a part of a work environment committed to our clients, employees and communities - a place where you can excel.

company_name: RFA Bank of Canada, RFA Mortgages Corp.
job_description:
RFA’s residential mortgage lending business is operated by RFA Mortgage Corporation and RFA Bank of Canada, a federally regulated Schedule I Bank. RFA Mortgage Corporation specializes in Prime lending (Insured, Insurable, Uninsurable), while RFA Bank of Canada is a balance sheet based Alternative mortgage lender (Alt-A and B lending). Combined, RFA offers mortgage brokers a one-stop shop with our full suite of competitive Prime and Alternative mortgages.

RFA’s strategic vision is to be a long-term leader in the residential lending segment by offering a value proposition beyond just rate and compensation. Through building a competitive broker experience and solutions-oriented product suite, RFA’s goal is to be recognized and recommended by our mortgage broker partners, mortgagors, and other strategic partners, for our financing solutions and broker/client experience.

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Director, Funding and Instruction, the Funder is accountable for the day to day fulfillment of RFA Mortgage Corporation’s back office operational activities including the prioritizing and processing of mortgage files for timely and accurate instruction and closing.

Operations



Analyze data from various sources to prepare file for instruction

Monitor and prioritize requests for instructions, documentation, and funds advance.

Prepare mortgage documentation for inclusion in Instructions to Solicitor

Review and approve all Solicitor Documentation

Manage team(s) daily funding pipelines

Monitor and prioritizing requests received by email

Respond to internal requests regarding general file status or issues

Correct data entry errors as they appear on exception reporting

Follow up with solicitors for all Final reports that fall outside our 120-closing mark

Monitor and respond to inquiries and concerns received from Treasury, Underwriters, clients and their mortgage brokers and solicitors regarding file status or issues.

Assist with any other Funding department activities as required

Other general administrative duties or special projects as assigned

Maximize the efficiency and effectiveness of the funding function by maintaining an environment of continuous improvement and recommend process and procedures to streamline activities.

Investigate internal and external customer complaints and track complaints until resolved or escalated to the Designated Officer.

Performing other duties and assist with special projects, as required

Customer Experience



Provide exceptional customer satisfaction to clients.

Ensure all inquiries are effectively and accurately investigated, responded to, and resolved to the satisfaction of clients.

Financial Responsibilities



Ensure Mortgage advancements are accurate and sent in a timely manner.

Work in liaison with our servicers


What you can bring to RFA:



A high level of proficiency with Microsoft Office products.

General Knowledge of basic accounting principles would be helpful.

Previous experience with mortgage products, specifically in relation to customer service, administration processes, funding, and legal documentation an asset.


Benefits of Working at RFA:



Health & Dental Care

Vision Care

RRSP Match

Vacation & Personal Days

Hybrid working environment

Are you the Right Candidate?



Strong attention to detail.

Strong PC skills, including the ability to learn new systems quickly.

Positive and enthusiastic attitude.

Excellent interpersonal, communication and customer service and support skills.

Manage multiple priorities while maintaining a high level of quality on all deliverables

Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.






































































































Job Title





































Analyst, Institutional Client Credit Management






































Job Description







































What is the opportunity?

You will support business units to fulfil their specific targets and objectives through the application of disciplined risk management processes.


This is a platform for you to gain an understanding of risk management and credit coverage management within RBC.


What will you do?

Risk identification


Gain working knowledge on how to analyze risk and collaborate with team members and risk partners to produce:


Risk assessment reviews (“RAFs”) which recommend the appropriate borrower risk rating (BRR)

Supporting documentation including peer group comparisons


Participation in the continuous monitoring process of counterparty and portfolio risks and building expertise in regard to:


RBC policies and guidelines

Operational risks/controls identification




Transaction support


Participate in the management of trading and non-trading credit risks (from a First line of Defense perspective) within a portfolio of internationally-based clients

Participate in discussions with business units and team members to develop transaction solutions that support business requirements and in alignment with RBC policy and risk appetite

Participate in day-to-day management of client credit issues including excesses, urgent requests and reallocations

Participate in the end-to-end on-boarding process to ensure counterparties have fulfilled all regulatory and legal requirements needed to support credit activities



Portfolio Management


Contribute to the production of portfolio statistics and management information reports in a timely and accurate manners (ad hoc and regularly scheduled) such as quarterly reporting, country exposure updates, peer reviews, stress testing)

Proactively contribute to efforts to innovate and improve efficiency



What you need to succeed?

Must-haves


University degree or equivalent relevant experience in Finance, Engineering, Science or Math desirable

Minimum 1 year financial institution / banking industry experience

Work experience in a Back Office or Middle Office considered an asset

Advanced data management skills including proficiency with MS Office

Ability to establish priorities and manage tasks with accompanying attention to detail

Ability to interpret, explain and communicate opinions and recommendations using strong verbal and written skills


Nice-to-have


Familiarity and basic understanding of trading products including FX, swaps and securities finance and non-trading products such as trade finance letters of credit and nostro limits (Training will be provided)



What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Opportunities to do challenging work

Flexible work/life balance options
