job_title_name: Manager, Group Benefits, Sponsor Risk Management
job_description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.
















Working Arrangement














Hybrid

Job Description


The opportunity


At the core of our Canadian strategy, we put the customer at the center of everything we do. Our Group Benefits business supports over 25,000 employers and their employees across Canada. This role is an incredible opportunity to have a significant impact on our Plan Sponsor journey, specifically for a core group of corporate Plan Sponsors.


As a key member of the Plan Sponsor Services team, the
Manager, Plan Sponsor Risk Management
will partner closely with other areas Group Benefit and functional areas. The successful incumbent is accountable to implement/manage a risk model customized to a very small subgroup of our core Plan Sponsors. It must balance our Plan Sponsors requirements and our Risk tolerance and service model.


This role requires complex problem-solving skills and a highly collaborative person with proven capability in removing barriers and the ability to influence internal and external stakeholders, to ensure resolution is attained. This individual will also anticipate, monitor, and proactively pivot their approach to developing changes and trends that affect our business. This includes awareness of technology, third-party providers, regulatory developments, and competitor actions.

Responsibilities


Manage the complex contracting process with core strategic clients, including the negotiation of:

Plan Sponsor master services and IT/privacy/data agreements.

Plan Sponsor IT and claims audits; and

Plan Sponsor third party vendor requirements.


Building and managing a customized commitment inventory and framework,

Strategize, develop, and implement processes and procedures that support our Plan Sponsors complex contracting and third - party diligence/auditing requirements


Expert problem solver in a matrix environment balancing the Plan Sponsors needs as well as our own risk tolerance and need to provide exceptional customer service.

Provide regular updates to Group Benefits leadership team on the emerging risks within the GB landscape, as well as internal service delivery vs. client commitments



What motivates you?


You obsess about customers, listen, engage, and act for their benefit.

You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile approach and enable business outcomes.

You thrive in teams and enjoy getting things done together.

You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters.

You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up.

You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone.

You are a highly effective change agent who can thrive in an ambiguous and dynamic environment.



What we are looking for


Ability to collaborate, partner, initiate and maintain cross-departmental and intra-divisional relationships

IT knowledge to be able to speak with technical resources as well as assess risk of IT commitments

Full understanding of Group Benefits products/financial arrangements including underwriting practices, compliance, and vendor management, is considered an asset

Previous experience in a risk-based role

Experience in dealing with complex legal or contractual issues

Strong Customer Experience background. Both internal and external customer focus with the ability to speak with external parties including Plan Sponsor representatives

Excellent negotiation and influencing skills at various levels of the organizations

Relationship building in a matrix environment

Ability to handle complex issues with a proven ability to adapt to changes quickly and easily within the business and organization

Ability to balance competing demands with little management direction/support

Ability to manage high visibility and high-risk consequences


What can we offer you?


A competitive salary and benefits packages.

A growth trajectory that extends upward and outward, encouraging you to follow your passions and learn new skills.

A focus on growing your career path with us.

Flexible work policies and strong work-life balance.

Professional development and leadership opportunities.


Our commitment to you


Values-first culture

We lead with our Values every day and bring them to life together.

Boundless opportunity

We create opportunities to learn and grow at every stage of your career.

Continuous innovation

We invite you to help redefine the future of financial services.

Delivering the promise of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

We foster an inclusive workplace where everyone thrives.

Championing Corporate Citizenship

We build a business that benefits all stakeholders and has a positive social and environmental impact.

Toronto, Ontario
is looking to hire a

for
an 8-months contract role.


What you will be doing…


As the Senior Manager, Privacy Oversight (Monitoring & Testing) you will support RBC’s Privacy Office in fulfilling its responsibilities under the Regulatory Compliance Management (RCM) Framework, by monitoring & testing of first line of defence (1LOD) controls designed to manage privacy risk, across our Canadian and Caribbean operations. In this role, you will:

Lead the completion of a risk-based annual monitoring & testing plan, to deliver timely and accurate testing reviews that opine on the adequacy of 1LOD systems, controls, and processes to manage privacy risk in Canada and the Caribbean.

Provide an opinion on the effectiveness of the 1LOD Privacy controls in achieving compliance with applicable regulatory requirements.

Assist in the execution of Quality Assurance reviews of 2LOD privacy controls, processes, and procedures.

Drive the continual enhancement of the Privacy monitoring & testing program, including enhancing governance procedures, use of data analytics, and methodology improvements.

Assist in strategic or ad hoc initiatives as required (including global initiatives).





What you will need to succeed…

Must Have Skills:


Expertise in privacy, RCM, or regulatory risk management practices.

Experience in financial services organizations or regulatory bodies.

Ability to work effectively with competing deadlines.

Proven effective stakeholdering and communication skills.

University degree in law, business, finance, or a related field.



Nice to have skills:


Privacy Accreditation (IAPP).

Experience executing control testing programs.

En tant que membre d’une équipe commerciale dynamique et en pleine croissance, le souscripteur de prêts hypothécaires commerciaux est responsable de la souscription des prêts hypothécaires commerciaux traditionnels et assurés par la SCHL. Le souscripteur doit respecter les politiques et les normes de souscription établies, respecter les exigences de conformité et de contrôle, tout en trouvant des solutions créatives rapidement afin d’atteindre les objectifs de service et les volumes cibles annuels. D’autres tâches administratives et liées au crédit sont également requises, comme la production de rapports et la gestion des dossiers, ainsi que le réseautage avec des partenaires commerciaux externes et divers membres du personnel du service Financement commercial et d’autres services internes.

The Work ! Le Travail !


On a daily basis, the incumbent will analyze and underwrite commercial credit facilities together with additional credit related and administrative duties, for all mortgage product types. Attention must be made to ensure that compliance with the company’s established lending guidelines and procedures are followed with recommendations submitted for approval to management. The incumbent is responsible to ensure all lending criteria have been satisfied on deals underwritten and outstanding documentation/conditions, if any, are being met in a timely manner (60%).

On a daily basis, the incumbent will communicate with external contacts (origination partners) and internal contacts (funders, managers, administrators, and commercial mortgage sales staff) to ensure transactions are processed in a timely and efficient manner in order to deliver superior customer service and funding deadlines. (20%).

On a daily basis, the incumbent is responsible for time management of their deal flow in order to meet prescribed deadlines (10%).

On a monthly basis, the incumbent will be responsible for various administrative and reporting duties required for the department/Company which will be relied upon by Senior Management (10%).




Chaque jour, le titulaire analyse et souscrit des facilités de crédit commerciales. Il s’acquitte aussi des tâches administratives et liées au crédit pour tous les types de produits hypothécaires. Il veille à ce que les lignes directrices et les procédures établies de la Société en matière de prêt soient respectées et à ce que les recommandations soient soumises à l’approbation de la direction. Le titulaire est chargé de s’assurer que tous les critères de prêt ont été satisfaits pour les transactions souscrites et que les documents/conditions en suspens, le cas échéant, sont respectés en temps opportun (60 %).

Chaque jour, le titulaire communique avec des contacts externes (partenaires à l’émission) et internes (bailleurs de fonds, gestionnaires, administrateurs et personnel de vente de prêts hypothécaires commerciaux) pour que les transactions soient traitées rapidement et efficacement afin d’offrir un service à la clientèle supérieur et de respecter les échéances de financement. (20 %).

Chaque jour, le titulaire est responsable de la gestion du temps de son flux de transactions afin de respecter les délais prescrits (10 %).

Chaque mois, le titulaire est responsable de diverses tâches administratives et d’établissement de rapports requises pour le service ou la Société, sur lesquelles compte la haute direction (10 %).

We can’t wait to get to know you!

Aftermarket controller

The role of Aftermarket controller is to support the Business Controller and Business Line Managers with accurate, relevant and timely analysis of profitability, variances, productivity and analytical reviews of aftermarket operation for parts, service and consumables. You will strive to maintain the highest quality of service accounting and reporting, as well as identifying variances in financial statements and corrective steps.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Ensure accounting and reporting processes are organized to deliver accurate data for evaluation of aftermarket business and enabling correct business decision

· Perform analytical reviews of income statement and balance sheet, investigate variances and take measures to eliminate the variation

· Gross profit analysis, product and contracts profitability analysis

· Purchase Price variance analysis, Service variances per operation (costs and recovery), inventory revaluation

· service center P&L responsibility

· Close follow up of work in progress, closing of work orders, goods in transit, deferred revenue and advance payments.

· Assist with planning and expectancies and follow up of plan vs actual results

· Review and update of labor standard cost pricing

EXPERIENCE:

· Minimum of three years’ of service accounting, reporting and analytical experience

· Experience working in B2B aftermarket is an advantage

À la SCHL, nous vous faisons confiance pour faire votre travail. Nous donnons à nos employés les moyens d'être autonomes et responsables de l'atteinte de leurs résultats. Les employés se concentrent sur la façon dont ils obtiennent des résultats, plutôt que sur le moment et le lieu où ils choisissent de travailler.





Voici quelques-unes des raisons pour lesquelles nous avons été choisis comme l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada :


Cinq semaines de vacances.

Une prime de rendement individuelle annuelle.

Un régime de retraite à prestations déterminées.

Une assurance collective complète pour favoriser votre bien-être dès le premier jour.

L'accès à un catalogue de cours pour l'apprentissage individuel.

Une culture et un environnement de travail inclusifs, plusieurs groupes-ressources d'employés et bien plus encore!





Aidez à faire une différence dans la vie des Canadiens.
L’aspiration de la SCHL est de faire en sorte que, d’ici 2030, tout le monde au Canada puisse se payer un logement qui répond à ses besoins. Tous nos programmes et toutes nos activités appuient cet objectif unique.



Faites partie d’un milieu de travail inclusif.
La diversité et l’inclusion guident tout ce que nous faisons à la SCHL. Nous prenons des mesures concrètes pour éliminer le racisme et faire progresser l’équité au sein de la SCHL et du système de logement.




Joignez-vous à l’équipe des Services d’entreprise où nos partenaires voient dans la SCHL un catalyseur pour relever les défis en matière d’abordabilité du logement.




Responsabilités :





Posséder une expertise avancée et spécialisée en actuariat pour les besoins de la SCHL, notamment en évaluation actuarielle, en évaluation de la suffisance du capital, en projection financière et en analyse d’états financiers;

Élaborer ou valider de nouveaux modèles et processus pour l’évaluation actuarielle et la comptabilisation des contrats d’assurance pour la conformité à l’IFRS 17;

Veiller à ce que les processus, analyses et modèles actuariels soient documentés et tenus de manière appropriée;

S’assurer que les résultats des modèles et les analyses actuarielles sont fournis au moment opportun selon les exigences de présentation de l’information financière de la Société;

Répondre aux demandes ponctuelles en finance ou en actuariat provenant de parties prenantes internes ou externes, comme des membres du Comité de gestion ou du Conseil d’administration ou des représentants du Bureau du surintendant des institutions financières ou du ministère des Finances. Pour ce faire, produire des résultats exacts et faire preuve d’excellentes aptitudes pour la communication afin de bien expliquer les enjeux et de fournir des interprétations et des informations adéquates;

Demeurer au courant des pratiques exemplaires et des progrès récents dans les méthodes et techniques actuarielles ou quantitatives pertinentes en participant à des activités de formation et de perfectionnement;

Demeurer au courant des exigences réglementaires concernant l’évaluation du passif d’assurance et d’autres sujets pertinents en actuariat.






Qualifications essentielles:





Baccalauréat ou maîtrise dans une discipline quantitative, comme l’actuariat, la finance quantitative, les mathématiques, l’économie ou la statistique;

Un minimum de trois (3) années d’expérience dans un poste en modélisation;

Expérience confirmée dans un poste semblable dans le secteur financier, notamment dans une banque, une société d’assurance, une caisse de retraite, etc;

Compréhension et expérience confirmée des méthodes d’évaluation actuarielle, des mathématiques financières et de l’analyse des risques;

Capacité à travailler de manière autonome avec un minimum de supervision pour le travail technique ou analytique;

Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication, la présentation d’exposés et la collaboration à tous les niveaux de l’organisation;

Capacité de se focaliser sur les résultats, de rendre des comptes sur le rendement obtenu et de prendre des projets entièrement à sa charge;

Connaissance des exigences réglementaires et des pratiques exemplaires concernant l’évaluation du passif d’assurance et d’autres sujets pertinents en actuariat;

Connaissance approfondie des langages de programmation SAS, R et Python.






Qualifications privilégiées :





Candidat en voie d’obtention du titre d’Associé ou de Fellow de l’Institut canadien des actuaires, de la Casualty Actuarial Society ou de la Society of Actuaires (ACAS, ASA).






Date de fermeture :
Ce poste sera affiché jusqu’à ce qu’une candidature soit retenue.




AVIS IMPORTANT – EXIGENCES DE VACCINATION OBLIGATOIRE CONTRE LA COVID-19


La SCHL a établi des exigences en matière de vaccination afin de s’aligner sur les mesures de vaccination obligatoire du gouvernement du Canada pour la fonction publique fédérale.

La vaccination contre la COVID-19 est obligatoire pour tout le personnel de la SCHL, peu importe le lieu de travail (travail à domicile, à distance ou sur place). Les mesures de vaccination de la SCHL, mises à jour au besoin, font partie des conditions d’emploi.



De ce fait, pour le moment, la SCHL n’impose pas de condition d’emploi qui nécessite la vaccination complète pour les membres du personnel. Elle continuera de surveiller la situation relative à la santé publique et peut, en tout temps, apporter des ajustements et adopter ou rétablir des mesures, y compris des exigences obligatoires en matière de vaccination, d’attestation et de vérification. De telles mesures de vaccination, mises à jour au besoin, feront partie intégrante des conditions de votre emploi à la SCHL.



La SCHL est un milieu de travail inclusif où la diversité de pensée — et des personnes — est reconnue, valorisée et jugée essentielle à la réalisation de notre aspiration.




Nous sommes déterminés à assurer l’équité en matière d’emploi et encourageons activement les femmes, les Autochtones, les personnes handicapées, les anciens combattants et les personnes de toutes les races, ethnicités, religions, capacités, orientations sexuelles et identités et expressions de genre à poser leur candidature. Nous acceptons également les candidatures de personnes qui ne sont pas canadiennes et qui ont le droit de travailler au Canada.




Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt toutefois seuls les candidats retenus seront contactés. Veuillez noter que nous communiquerons seulement avec les personnes sélectionnées pour la suite du processus. Veuillez nous indiquer si vous avez des besoins spéciaux dont nous devrons tenir compte si vous êtes l’une des personnes convoquées à une entrevue ou appelées à passer un test.

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.


Purpose

Contributes to the overall success of the Fraud Detection Unit in Canada ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

The Fraud Detection Analyst is responsible for preventing and minimizing losses to the Bank resulting from fraudulent activity on Payment cards. This is achieved by working alerts generated by fraud monitoring systems and/or batch reports, analyzing activity/trends, reviewing previous activity and contacting customers to determine if the account has been compromised and if proactive measures are necessary to block the account from further use.


Accountabilities


Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.

Detect and prevent fraudulent activity with respect to the Bank’s credit cards, debit cards, ScotiaOnline, Email Money Transfers, Western Union and Visa debit by:

Analyzing alerts generated by various fraud detection tools and assessing the probability that fraud is occurring based on the neural network score for the transaction, the cardholder’s normal spending patterns, the location of the transaction, the value of the transaction as well as what alerts are being generated for other cardholders at the same time.

Making a decision, based on the analysis completed, to block the account or reduce the limit on the card or to contact the cardholder and/or branch to discuss the activity. With respect to Western Union and Email Money Transfer transactions, contact the applicable third party service provider to ensure the transactions are blocked and/or released if they are confirmed legitimate. Good judgment is required to maintain an acceptable balance between fraud control and customer service.

Working closely and effectively with the rest of the Detection Analysts in sharing information and trends to ensure large scale fraud trends are identified and actioned quickly.

In the event of a large scale fraud attack, working effectively with the team to identify the potential points of compromise as quickly as possible and getting other Scotiabank cards at risk identified and statused before fraudulent activity occurs.

Escalating new/emerging fraud trends to management so that new fraud detection rules can be implemented to counteract this activity.

Reviewing frauds caught and missed on a daily basis to ensure continuous improvement in fraud detection effectiveness.

Working knowledge with respect to inherent controls within key processes surrounding account maintenance, issuance of replacement cards, dispatch of cards, customer PIN/password selection, customer authentication procedures is essential in order to recognize breaches of controls or procedures that contributed to the fraud.



Achieve and maintain required service level standards by:


Operating at optimal efficiency of the department by ensuring productivity goals are attained;

Occasionally responding to incoming telephone and written inquiries from customers,

Communicating with branches and other Bank departments to resolve inquiries relative to fraud issues and/or complaints

Minimizing Fraud risk and losses by adhering to Scotiabank’s policy, procedures and key controls;

Adhering to all company/department policies, procedures and audit requirements;

Prioritizing and processing customer requests (i.e. inquiries, transactions, case work) in a timely and efficient manner; and

Strictly adhering to schedules thereby ensuring prompt customer service and response time.

Accurately completing fraud reports with all required information to facilitate the expeditious adjudication of fraud file.



Contribute to the ongoing success and continuous improvement the of Bank Card Security department by:


Collaborating with team members and management as required with respect to current/emerging fraud trends and possible fraud mitigation strategies.

Providing feedback with respect to effectiveness of the department’s fraud mitigation strategies (rules).

iGO is seeking a Team Lead, Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Risk to join its growing and dynamic team.
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Anti-Money Laundering, this position is responsible for the execution of the Enterprise Risk Assessment Program. This includes supporting the creation and implementation of the risk assessment methodology, related systems and procedural and guidance documentation.


Key responsibilities will include but not limited to:



Develop and reassess requirements to assist with the creation, implementation and maintenance of the risk assessment framework.

Lead the execution of the risk assessment framework to ensure Operators and iGaming Ontario comply with regulatory requirements.

Provide recommendations, insight, and best practices on AML/Anti-Terrorist Financing (ATF) requirements and risk assessment guidelines.

Support the iGaming Ontario’s AML team with the documentation and maintenance of the enterprise AML risk assessment methodology, related tools, procedural and guidance documentation under the direction of the Senior Manager, AML.

Lead the development and maintenance of a system to analyze data, identify trends, track/monitor player and operator risk assessments and provide accurate reporting.

Liaise with information technology experts and other internal/external stakeholders (e.g., consultants, vendors) to identify project and program requirements relating to data systems.

Communicate results and findings of system testing activities to all relevant stakeholders, including project and program management.

Provide direction and oversee implementation of system functionality adjustments and data remediation activities.

Collect and analyze data to detect potential threats and vulnerabilities and to detect instances of suspicious transactions relating to money laundering or terrorist financing.

Lead a team of analysts to ensure iGaming Ontario and the igaming Operators comply with AML/ATF regulatory requirements applicable to Casinos.

Post-secondary degree in a related field (analytics, law, finance, criminology, data mining, statistics, audit), or equivalent with 5+ years of experience in an anti-money laundering or compliance environment.

ACAMS designation an asset.

Understanding of money laundering techniques and, in particular, how they can be used in the gaming industry and strategies for detecting and addressing money laundering.

Practical knowledge in developing analytical rules, policies and operational plans.

Research and analytical skills to gather and analyze information, tactical analytical methods to organize, clarify and simplify data.

Exposure to enterprise level, transactional data systems including data extraction, providing business requirements and testing.

Ability to communicate effectively with business and technical stakeholder groups.

Superior knowledge and demonstrated experience in the use of computer databases/programs and office technologies (e.g., Microsoft Office, Power BI).

Magellan Aerospace, Corporate has an exciting new opportunity for a Junior Internal Auditor (Co-op Student). The successful incumbent will provide assistance on audit planning and execute financial and compliance audits. They will do so by acting in accordance with accepted professional standards in order to ensure compliance with policies, procedures and adherence to applicable laws and regulations.

Essential Responsibilities


Develop audit plans and programs (i.e. procedures, methodology, checklists and questionnaires)

Adjust to plans and programs as appropriate to reflect areas of concern raised by stakeholders.

Assist in the development, implementation and use of auditing tools and/or database (e.g. IDEA, advanced excel skills).

Provide analysis and make recommendations for improvement in audit procedures

Evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls in business processes and other related areas

Develop, in cooperation with management, recommendations to solve issues identified during the course of the audit (e.g. corrective or improvement action) that are realistic, creative, workable and meet client business objectives

Prepare written audit reports

Follow up to determine adequacy of corrective actions

Provide assistance to external auditors as requested

Assist in special projects as may be assigned

Assist in the development of presentations pertaining to audit and risk-related issues.


Position Requirements


Co-op student currently enrolled in University or College degree in accounting or related field

Previous co-op experience in the accounting / finance field preferred

External or internal audit experience is an asset

Knowledge of accounting/finance principles and computer systems

Understanding of audit-related practices, principles, processes, procedures and techniques

Knowledge of risk and control principles

Proficient in Microsoft Office

Ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with diverse people while remaining impartial and objective

Excellent verbal and written skills

Excellent problem solving and analytical skills

Solid organizational and time-management skills

Excellent team player while also being able to work independently

job_title_name: Risk Assurance Compliance and Analytics - Sustainability - Manager
job_description:
A career in our Sustainability practice, within Risk Assurance Compliance and Analytics services, will provide you with the opportunity to assist clients in developing analytics and technology solutions that help them detect, monitor, and predict risk. Using advanced technology, we’re able to focus on establishing the right controls, processes and structures for our clients to ensure that decisions are based on accurate information and assure that information provided to third parties is accurate, complete, and can be trusted. Our team helps organisations plan, source, deliver, finance and measure the wider impact of products and services. We’re helping to future proof businesses by making them more resilient and sustainable. You’ll focus on identifying and prioritising sustainability issues, setting goals that support alignment and integration of the sustainability vision into overall corporate strategy, and implementing processes, controls, systems, and dashboards to measure progress for consistent and accurate reporting.
Transition and physical risks and opportunities are resulting in significant changes in business, investment, and government policy across Canada and globally. In this role you will have the opportunity to work across a range of climate change projects with Canada’s largest financial institutions, companies, and public entities. A focus of this role will be to support transition risk/opportunity analysis within climate scenario analysis and broader decarbonisation work such as net zero strategies, pricing carbon, and climate-related topics such as nature/biodiversity.

As a Manager, you will play a critical role on projects related to decarbonisation, transition, and resilience for clients across Canada. While the focus of your work will be on climate change projects, you will also have an opportunity to support broader work in low carbon and sustainable finance, as well as broader ESG strategy, reporting and data.

This role may also include opportunities to support international or global projects within the PwC network.

As a Manager, you'll work as part of multidisciplinary teams to:


Apply analytical skills and specialist knowledge of climate change to some of the most exciting and leading decarbonisation, transition, and resilience projects in Canada.

Have an opportunity to lead on Canada’s most complex and impactful climate strategy, scenario analysis, emissions inventories, and decarbonisation plans.

Gain experience across a range sectors including financial services, telecommunications, energy, mining, industry, public sector, infrastructure, etc, and over time develop a focus in one or more of these.

Contribute effectively to complex, multi-disciplinary projects – often supporting several projects at a time.

Continue to develop your technical understanding of climate change and how it applies to business, investment, and government decision making; and support internal and external thought leadership on specialist issues within climate change.

Develop as a subject matter expert on one or more of decarbonisation, transition, resilience, or other topics within climate change

Manage and coach junior resources.

Support technical projects in areas such as climate scenario analysis projects.

Support clients and PwC colleagues to build their capacity in climate change.

Manage client consulting engagements over their life-cycle.

Contribute to proposals and other business development activities.


What you’ll bring to this role :


An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work

A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences, developing and coaching diverse teams, and ensuring diverse perspectives are heard

Professional experience in climate change consulting, finance, business, or government.

A background in one or more of climate science, climate finance, engineering, financial analysis, economics, natural resources, or nature/biodiversity.

Demonstrated experience in one of decarbonisation, transition, resilience, or a related climate change subject matter, such as knowledge of the key frameworks in one or more of those areas (e.g. ISO 14064, GHG Protocol, TCFD, SBTi, etc)

Experience with climate scenario assessment required

Commercial acumen and strong programme and project management skills

Critical thinking, intellectual curiosity and problem solving abilities

Ability to lead and work collaboratively in multi-disciplinary teams

Exceptional commitment to providing excellent client service, by building and maintaining productive relationships with both internal and external clients

Strong personal initiative, agility and resourcefulness

Excellent oral and verbal communication skills

Ideally based in the City of Toronto (although candidates from other markets are encouraged to apply)

At PwC Canada, our most valuable asset is our people and we grow stronger as we learn from one another. We’re committed to creating an equitable and inclusive community of solvers where everyone feels that they truly belong. We understand that experience comes in many forms and building trust in society and solving important problems is only possible if we reflect the mosaic of the society we live in.
We’re committed to providing accommodations throughout the application, interview, and employment process. If you require an accommodation to be at your best, please let us know during the application process.

job_description:

Purpose of the role:

Lightspeed is seeking a strong Financial Analyst with experience supporting business unit leaders to join our Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team. The ideal candidate is able to create and utilize data-driven analysis that holds the senior leaders of the business accountable to delivering budget targets. This candidate possesses effective communication skills, is self-motivated, is highly organized to meet deadlines, can extract insights from large and multiple data sets, can develop and maintain complex excel models and is passionate about growing the P&L. This is your chance to build a successful career within a fast-growing tech company where your work will have a direct and visible impact on the results.

Our Mission:

Lightspeed powers the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy.

Our one-stop commerce platform transforms and unifies digital and physical operations by enabling multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions and connection to supplier networks. With the Lightspeed commerce platform, merchants in retail and hospitality can build thriving businesses for the future.

We're passionate about enabling people to do their best work. We dream big and we're looking for people who do the same. With us, career milestones happen often and we celebrate every one. Come work with us and find out where your career will take you at Lightspeed!

Role:


Establish solid business partnerships with leaders across the business


Prepare, improve and streamline the budgeting, forecasting and long term planning process


Perform deep analysis and scorecard against budget/forecast monthly and quarterly


Responsible for the delivery of accurate and timely month-end variance and management reporting


Provide analytical support and financial guidance to help with various business decisions. This includes developing new analyses and improving reports and metrics to better support business partners' decision-making process


Ability to multitask and work quickly while being able to adapt to a rapidly evolving environment


Participate in various FP&A activities, including preparing presentations for the Senior Management team



And a little bit of....


Work on ad hoc projects as assigned; such as assessment of new business activities or change of process


Assist with special requests from the executive team


Contributing as part of the wider team to achieve organizational objectives even if this means doing things that aren't strictly within the scope of your role.



How you will know you are succeeding:


Quality - There are various ways to assess the quality of work completed. One such measure is the percentage of work that needs to be redone or is rejected, especially in financial modeling. The percentage of issues resolved over total inquiries from the business.


Efficiency - the amount of output you obtain for a given amount of effort without sacrificing quality.


Engagement - You care about your work and the company's performance, and you believe that your efforts matter. An engaged employee is motivated by more than a paycheck.


Learning ability - Ability to achieve expectations that are aligned with company goals, along with participation in online training programs to assess your aptitude to learn.


Teamwork - Ability to work in groups to solve complicated problems.


Consistency - Consistency at work entails adhering to the same set of norms and behaviors that result in high-quality work. One can increase their consistency by using time management techniques, setting production objectives, and finding areas where they can enhance their work ethic.


Creativity and Innovation - The feedback that emphasizes how you interact with others in the organization rather than just as an individual fosters creativity and intrinsic motivation. Employees that are inherently excited and joyful about what they do are said to have intrinsic drive. It has an impact on job-related passion and interests. Employees that are motivated are more likely to take chances and come up with innovative ideas for financial process improvements and EBITDA positive outcomes.



Experience:


2-3 years in progressive financial analysis experience


Bachelor's Degree in Commerce, Accounting or Finance


Expert knowledge in Excel is a must


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills/modeling


Proven track record in business partner or corporate FP&A role


Highly detail oriented and organized


Strong and effective verbal and written communication to interact with all levels of management


Demonstrated success working in a deadline driven and multi-task, fast-paced environment



What will help you succeed in this role?


Strong strategic / outside of the box thinking and analytical skills


Detail oriented, autonomous, and able to take initiative


Highly motivated and can work both as a team and independently

Our Vision
:

At the Toronto Catholic District School Board, we transform the world through witness, faith, innovation and action. Servant-leadership that is visionary, empowering and inclusive is a fundamental characteristic of our Board. We seek colleagues who demonstrate a powerful personal mission and commitment through action to these principles. We are committed to fairly and objectively recruiting and selecting leaders and staff who are excellent role models, visionary and innovative, student-focused, committed to diversity, inclusion and equity and are also collaborative in building a Catholic community.








TORONTO CATHOLIC DISTRICT SCHOOL BOARD:

The TCDSB is an inclusive learning community rooted in the love of Christ. We educate students to grow in grace and knowledge and to lead lives of faith, hope and charity. At Toronto Catholic, we have a long and distinguished history of providing excellence in Catholic education for the Toronto community. Catholic Social Teachings, the Ontario Catholic School Graduate Expectations and the Board’s Pastoral Plan are foundational to our exemplary approach to teaching and learning in the 21st century.

The TCDSB is proud to be a significant part of the fabric of publicly-funded Catholic education in the province of Ontario. We serve more than 90,000 students in more than 195 Catholic schools in the city of Toronto and represent close to 475 000 catholic school supporters.



CRITERIA FOR AN INTERVIEW:


3-year college diploma in Accounting and/or Finance and or an equivalent combination of relevant education and experience

Detail orientated with sound analytical skills

Strong communication and interpersonal skill

A valid Ontario driver's license is required, and employee must have access to a vehicle for travel to schools and other TCDSB sites

job_title_name: Business Management Specialist - TD Asset Management
job_description:
TD Description


Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.




Department Overview


TD Asset Management (TDAM), a member of TD Bank Financial Group, is a leading North American investment manager offering progressive investment solutions to both institutional and individual investors. For over two decades, the organization has established competitive market positions in active, quantitative, and passive portfolio management. As of September 30, 2022, TDAM and its affiliates manage over $398 billion in assets on behalf of pension, insurance, endowment/foundation, and corporate clients, as well as high-net worth clients and retail mutual funds.

In attaining this client commitment, TDAM has built one of Canada’s largest and most respected investment management and research teams with more than 220 Portfolio Managers, Associate Portfolio Managers, Traders and Analysts.





Job Description


The TDAM Marketing Team provides a wide range of marketing and communication support for Retail and Institutional advisors and investors.

The Business Management Specialist is a key role reporting to the Senior Manager of Initiatives and Operations in the TD Asset Management Marketing and Sales Enablement team. The Business Management Specialist provides integrated and aggregated support with a focus on supporting overall effectiveness of business process management, business governance and controls, project governance and operational effectiveness. The role requires strong strategic orientation along with outstanding attention to detail with an ownership mindset of administrative functions.
The Business Management Specialist primary responsibilities:


Plan, lead, develop and manage the integrated implementation of TDAM Marketing & Sales Enablement policies, processes, procedures and changes

Develop and maintain a comprehensive inventory of processes and controls with clearly defined owners and roles and responsibilities for each process and control

Work directly with Marketing, Risk Partner Groups, Compliance and Sales Enablement to foster marketing compliance

Lead and fulfill requests from control partners including action/remediation plans to address risk, governance and/or audit issues

Liaise with TDAM, TD Wealth and TD Enterprise control partners and advocate for reasonable changes

Collaborate with Marketing stakeholders to obtain in-depth knowledge of the operational risks and identify areas of focus and improvements

Ensure business operations are compliant with applicable internal and external requirements including demonstration of traceability, assess and identify key issues and escalate to appropriate levels and relevant stakeholders



Participate as a business management SME in project activities

Participate in the intake of applicable regulations, lead the Marketing impact assessment and the comprehensive mapping of associated controls to rules and regulations

Review end-to-end processes and controls and “connect the dots” across issues and control deficiencies across various Marketing/Sales Enablement functions in order to increase standardization of solutions, processes and controls

Act as SME for area of specialization with industry, enterprise, and business awareness; recognizing and anticipating emerging trends and; identifying issues and opportunities and recommending action to senior management in the business management space

Support Marketing onboarding/offboarding, premises and equipment requests

Act as lead for all Marketing Business Continuity Management activities


#LI-Hybrid




Job Requirements



Develop a deep knowledge of TDAM Marketing operations, controls and systems

Coordinate activities related to business solutioning and target state for business risk related initiatives

Ensure programs / policies / practices are well managed, meets business needs / priorities, and complies with internal / external requirements

Exercise discretion in managing communication / correspondence, information and all matters of confidentiality

Conduct analysis at the functional or enterprise level using results to draw conclusions, make recommendations, assess the effectiveness of programs, policies, or practices

Adhere to enterprise frameworks or methodologies that relate to activities across businesses and functions

Manage relationships within and across various business lines, corporate and/or control functions and ensure alignment with enterprise and/or regulatory requirements

Protect the interests of the organization – identify and manage risks, and escalate non-standard, high risk transactions / activities as necessary

Maintain a culture of risk management, governance and control, supported by processes in alignment with risk appetite

Participate as a member of the team, support a positive work environment and ensure timely communication

Keep current on emerging trends / developments and grow knowledge of the business, related tools and techniques

Keep others informed about the status / progress of projects

Contribute to a fair, positive and equitable environment

Act as a brand ambassador for your business area/function and the bank





Additional Information


Education & Experience


University education

7+ years relevant experience

Advanced knowledge of governance, control and risk management strategies and tactics

Advanced knowledge of process analysis, mapping, improvement and optimization


Skills


Ability to establish goals and objectives that support delivery execution

Experience in or knowledge of the advice distribution business

Strong leadership, persuasion and communication skills

Relevant experience in project/change/risk management

A sound knowledge of legal, regulatory, compliance requirements

Ability to assess the big picture while demonstrating attention to detail

Ability to contribute to strategic direction of the function and provide advice to the team and all levels of leadership

Experience in business solutioning for risk monitoring needs

Ability to work successfully as a member of a team and independently

Ability to exercise sound judgement in making decisions

Superior skills in analyzing, organizing and prioritizing work while meeting multiple deadlines

Ability to communicate effectively in both oral and written form

Ability to think critically and comfort with challenging the business

Experience in dealing with control groups

Strong knowledge of MS office suite





Inclusiveness


At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

CLIENT SERVICE ASSOCIATE, Successful Investor Wealth Management Inc.


We are an established wealth management and investment publishing firm with 25+ years’ experience in subscription marketing and independent portfolio management with assets under management verging on $1 billion and growing.


Successful Investor Wealth Management (‘SIWM’) is actively seeking a client service professional with strong relationship management skills who will provide high quality service to high-net-worth clientele and contribute to the continued growth of the organization.


Working in concert with the Portfolio Management team to optimize customer relationships the ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3 years of experience working as a Client Service Associate or similar role at a wealth management and/or asset management firm.


Under direct supervision, the Client Service Associate is responsible for supporting relationship management across the firm. Responsibilities include arranging annual client portfolio reviews on behalf of Portfolio Managers, calendar scheduling, assisting with inbound client care calls, preparing client reports, administering client data gathering and maintenance, and responding to administrative client queries.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Schedule client meetings.

Maintain calendars.

Provide materials for client meetings (e.g.: account opening paperwork, reports, annual review material, and other paperwork).

Quickly develop knowledge of a variety of forms and account procedures to assist clients in resolving their issues.

Promote Firm services by enhancing relationships with clients through timely and accurate responses to questions.

Troubleshoot client difficulties and questions.

Answer the phone in a friendly, warm manner while managing incoming calls and resolving issues and tasks.

Engage with clients in a professional manner while actively listening to their concerns.

Respond to all client inquiries, update client files as required, and prepare client presentation material.



Ask questions to clarify requests/concerns and take necessary actions to respond in a timely manner or escalate client requests to the appropriate parties within the organization.



Record customer information within our CRM database.

Develop expertise in the firm’s technology and software tools and platforms.

Assist with the ongoing maintenance and accuracy of the CRM system.

Management of client tasks and open items.

Oversees the tracking of all “work in progress” items and maintain the team’s record of open tasks.

Ensures notes and follow up tasks from client meetings are documented and stored appropriately.

Utilize the CRM tool to accurately record each call.



Other duties as required.




REQUIREMENTS (Qualifications, Experience & Skills)


Wealth management/financial services/brokerage experience required.

Bachelor’s degree.

Minimum of 3 years’ experience working as a Client Service Associate or similar role.

Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC) preferred.

A high degree of proficiency with technology including MS Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook), CRM systems, and can quickly learn additional software programs.

Demonstrate strong accuracy and thoroughness in all facets of daily work and possess superb organizational skills.

Able to interface and articulate well with all employees and clients in a highly professional, timely and friendly manner.

Exceptional phone conversation skills.

Able to perform efficiently in a fast-paced, changing environment, handling a wide variety of tasks.

Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and excellent follow-up skills.

Ability to be self-motivated and succeed in a team atmosphere.

Experience and knowledge to conduct client calls and answer questions.




Located near Yonge St. and Sheppard Ave. in North York, Toronto.



Pre-employment reference, credit and criminal background checks are required.

ASSOCIATE PORTFOLIO MANAGER

Successful Investor Wealth Management Inc.


We are an established wealth management and investment publishing firm with 25+ years’ experience in subscription marketing and independent portfolio management with assets under management verging on $1 billion and growing. Successful Investor Wealth Management (‘SIWM’) is actively seeking an Associate Portfolio Manager who will provide high quality support and contribute to the continued growth of the organization.




The role of the Associate Portfolio Manager is to assist the Portfolio Managers and the investment team to maximize our clients’ returns, subject to risk tolerance, temperament, and time horizon constraints. Under the oversight of the Portfolio Managers, discuss specific stock investments as they relate to the client’s unique personal circumstances.



This role will work with Portfolio Managers and the investment team to perform ongoing review and analysis of client portfolios as well as ensure client portfolios are managed using the SIWM investment strategy in light of the clients’ risk tolerance and investment objectives.




Under the guidance of a Portfolio Manager, the Associate Portfolio Manager will conduct ongoing wealth conversations with clients, developing a personal relationship and sustaining an ongoing understanding of client life goals, circumstances and wealth needs. They will consistently deliver the desired client experience during all client interactions and use strong knowledge of the Successful Investor Wealth Management recommended stocks and services, to ensure the client’s needs are well understood, documented and satisfied.



As an ideal candidate for this role, you have already earned your CFA designation and are looking to build upon your current experience toward a career in Portfolio Management. You possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills along with a strong drive to learn and help clients meet their financial goals.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Assist Portfolio Managers by preparing ‘pro-forma’ portfolios based on client-specific risk tolerances and knowledge of SIWM investment philosophy.

Assist Portfolio Managers in the management of client accounts, determining suitability of investments, and recommending investment transactions to meet clients’ goals, objectives and risk tolerance.

Assist Portfolio Managers in the answering of client inquiries, including ‘hand-holding’ during times of market volatility.

Assist Portfolio Managers in meeting with clients to discuss investment returns, changes in personal circumstances, updating wills.

Assist Portfolio Managers with suitability and KYC review.

Assist Portfolio Managers in monitoring and reviewing Corporate Action elections.

Assist Portfolio Managers in research of “non SIWM” universe stocks, usually on client request.

Assist Portfolio Managers in meeting with clients to discuss overall portfolio strategy and performance.

Assist Portfolio Managers with responding to client phone and email inquiries regarding their portfolio, returns, stock selection, sector allocation.

Attend and present at Investment Discovery meetings.

Assist Portfolio Managers with the ongoing maintenance and review and oversight of client portfolio requirements, including, but not limited to:

Electronic cash flow payments and receipts analysis.

Job Title





































Associate, Corporate Client Group - Finance






































Job Description






































What is the
opportunity?

In this role, you will be part of the Corporate Client Group – Finance (CCGF) team which acts as mid-market Corporate Banking for RBC’s Canadian Banking business unit and plays a key role in the realization of CCG objectives through the structuring, delivery and management of the bank debt of a targeted customer base. We target loan origination in the Canadian mid-market, including large Canadian subsidiaries of foreign multinationals, private and small cap public Canadian companies. We are also is responsible for meeting annually established targets for loan derived revenues and returns and providing advice to our partners on optimizing the use of lending in connection with broader RBC relationship goals.


What will you
do?


Part of a national team of CCGF underwriters committed to the delivery of quality credit products to RBC clients and targets.

Support CCG bankers to structure, deliver, close, and monitor syndicated and bi-lateral loan transactions.

Assist with preparation of marketing pitches to existing and potential clients for corporate loans (acquisition loans, bridge loans, term loans, revolving credit facilities).

Support CCGF team credit submissions, including research, analysis, financial modelling and due diligence as part of transaction processes. The role will allow candidates to use and develop complex financial modelling skills, credit structuring and documentation skills that are all critical elements of corporate and commercial lending.

Support CCGF team with transaction documentation and coordination with clients and legal counsel which includes interacting with CCG clients.

Assist with loan portfolio management, client strategies and related administrative duties.

Engage with RBC partners and functions including Group Risk Management, Private Banking, Wealth Management, Capital Markets, Treasury Management, Specialized Financing (Asset Based Lending, Leasing, Trade Finance, etc.), Personal Banking, and others.

Liaise with back office functions connected to, for example, closing and funding, wires, payments, settlements, etc.



What do you need to
succeed?

Must-
have


Undergraduate degree in business, economics, accounting, or finance with basic knowledge of credit, credit metrics, and credit structuring.

Strong quantitative, financial modeling, and analytical skills with an ability to analyze company financial statements. Strong skills with Excel, Word, PowerPoint and the ability to source data/research.

Capability to work through loan agreements and other legal documents, with minimal supervision and high attention to detail.

Professional oral and written communication skills are an absolute must.

Well organized and able to set priorities and devote appropriate attention to each assignment resulting in performing well under pressure, meeting time sensitive deadlines, prioritizing work and being able to work on multiple projects.



Nice-to-
have


Preference given to individuals with an MBA, CPA, or CFA.

Work experience in corporate lending or corporate finance.

Ability to commit to over and above regular work hours.



What’s in it for
you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.

Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.

Opportunities to do challenging work.

The opportunity






The Manager, Valuation is responsible for the execution of OTPP’s semi-annual private investment valuation processes, for the purpose of OTPP’s mid-year and year-end financial statement reporting. Private portfolio investments asset classes include private equity, infrastructure, natural resources, venture capital, real estate, and private credit. This position will also actively involve training and reviewing the work of junior staff.


Who you'll work with


Reporting to a Senior Manager, Valuations, you will work independently and with junior staff in the preparation of private investment valuations and other deliverables within the Finance, Valuation team.


What you'll do


1. Supporting the planning and execution of the mid-year and year-end valuation processes during peak periods.



Help prepare and be responsible for the review of “fair value” valuations prepared by OTPP’s Investment teams including the preparation of analysis and summary memorandums in respect thereof


Review the fair value valuations prepared by external valuation agents


Help develop recommendations to be used for the purposes of OTPP’s financial statements


Support the development, tracking and reporting of plans and timelines to ensure an effective and efficient valuation process


Assist in developing the standards for reviews and the corresponding processes to be followed by the staff involved in the valuation process


Assist with responding to queries/information requests from OTPP’s external auditors with respect to private investment valuations


Communicate noted issues with respect to the valuation process or specific investment valuations to management on a timely basis


Assist in the preparation of OTPP board reporting with respect to the results of the year end and mid-year private investment valuation process


Build rapport and work cross-functionally with members of other OTPP groups, including Risk Analytics, Tax, Financial and Management Reporting, Private Asset Operations, Strategy and Risk, and Data Management in sharing information generated and reviewed by the valuation team


Contribute to ad-hoc projects supporting the execution of the broader Finance division strategy



2. Assist with the interfacing with the Investment Division with respect to the valuations including:



Help coordinate processes and deliverables to facilitate the execution of a smooth mid-year and year-end valuation process


Help ensure outstanding service is provided to the Investment Division with respect to private investment valuations


Respond to inquiries and requests from the Investment Division including consultation on new transactions where required


Support the management of OTPP’s use of external advisors employed in the private investment process and the management of the corresponding relationships




Ensuring internal information required by external advisors is provided by both the Investment Division and Finance in accordance with established timelines


Monitoring and reporting on progress of external advisor deliverables


Critiquing external advisor reports in ensuring their findings are reflective of standard methodologies and are consistent with the definition of fair value


Review and incorporate external advisor recommendations/findings into OTPP’s conclusions


Communicate of issues noted to the managers, where vital, on a timely basis


Help ensure outstanding service is provided by external parties



3. Assist in training and reviewing the work of junior staff in peak valuation periods



Assist, develop and train junior staff with respect to valuation standards, practices and internal process requirements to ensure the execution of effective and efficient processes.



4. Help ensure OTPP’s valuation policies and practices remain standard methodology



Assist in the review of internal methodologies and processes for assigned investments with a view of continuous improvement in execution


Monitor external best practice standards (e.g. IPEV Valuation Guidelines) and practices


Support the annual review and update of OTPP’s private investment valuation policies including recommending changes based on changes in standard methodology valuation guidelines and practices


Help prepare any required OTPP board reporting with respect to any recommended policy changes



There is a moderate/high degree of decision making and discretion required in this role. Often required to manage multiple competing priorities



This position serves as a direct resource to the Senior Manager and is encouraged to make standard operational decisions. On complex issues, you are expected to have fully researched the issues, provide recommendations, and an implementation plan to the Senior Manager.



What you'll need



Relevant university degree


A professional accounting designation is an asset


A Chartered Business Valuator (“CBV”) designation or working towards CBV is preferred


A Chartered Financial Analyst (“CFA”) designation or working towards CFA in an asset


Valuation Knowledge – This position requires a solid understanding and application of the principles and complexities of private asset valuation.


Analytical Thinking and Financial Modelling Skills – Strong analytical thinking, variance analysis, and financial/cash flow modelling skills are important to the execution of the valuation review process. Having a comfort level in reviewing large and sophisticated financial models is important.


Organization Skills – OTPP’s valuation process involves the completion of an extensive number of valuation reviews and coordination across multiple departments and teams including within Finance. The position requires effective organizational skills to set priorities, coordinate tasks and meet deadlines.


Preparation of written memoranda supported by in-depth valuation analyses. Strong written communication skills are required to ensure Finance’s memoranda are written clearly and concisely, address the key valuation risks identified and adequately support Finance’s recommendation of fair value


Verbal Communication Skills – Interaction with internal management and various OTPP Investment Division teams for the purpose of completing the valuation review. The nature of the relationship with these parties requires a high degree of professionalism.


Experience (3-5 years) working with private investment valuations, which could include valuing and/or conducting due diligence in respect of private investments.


Previous experience in coaching, training and developing staff is desired


Experience interacting with senior management and other external advisors


Experience in data analytics/visualization tools such as PowerBI is an asset

Summary

The Assistant Controller shall be responsible for assisting the Controller with the management of overall financial operations of Chef Brandz Inc, and will provide accurate information to the Shareholders, including analysis, budgeting, forecasting and preparing financial reports. The Controller will direct and manage the company's accounting functions, including establishing and maintaining accounting principles, practices, and procedures, preparing financial statements and reporting to top management and externally. The Controller will also maintain the company's accounting systems and implement changes as required.

Core Competencies


Quality Orientation

Time Management

Creative and Innovative Thinking

Development and Continual Learning

Problem Solving

Accountability and Dependability

Research and Analysis

Decision Making and Judgement

Operating Equipment

Providing Consultation

Ethics and Integrity

Planning and Organizing

Mathematical Reasoning

Enforcing Laws, Rules and Regulations

Mediating and Negotiating

Coaching and Mentoring

Communication

Energy and Stress

Teamwork


Job Duties


Managing the accounting operations including the review of journal entries, payroll, accounts payable, accounts receivable and statutory reporting.

Establish and monitor internal controls to ensure that accounting activities are in accordance with established legal regulatory and company policies and procedures.

Budgeting and forecasting.

Prepare, analyze, and present monthly, quarterly and annual operating results for each department.

Work with Controller and operations to define, measure, analyze, improve, and control current processes which impact customer quality and influence internal operating efficiency.

Provide strategic analysis as required to drive improved decision making.

Work with external auditors, audit committee and Board of Directors.

Prepare and present financial information for quarterly and annual reports.

Assist with the management of foreign exchange transactions.

Aid Controller to manage research and development program for CCRA and accounting requirements.

Work with sales team on product pricing, costing and margins.

Responsible for the accuracy and timeliness of financial information.

Implement and manage internal controls with respect to financial policies, processes, and procedures.

Provide advice and guidance on all accounting matters including financial systems, record keeping, analysis, and reporting.

Assist Controller in setting the priorities within accounting group.

Coordinate the year-end audit and preparation of audited financial statements.

Coordinate all other customer and government audits.

Responsible for the preparation of monthly financial statements and external reporting to financial institutions, ensuring that all reporting requirements are met.

Responsible for all other financial reporting to various companies and agencies (TPC, Insurance, Stats Can, etc.).

Generate reports of performance against budgets.

Support new systems or project selections and implement them from a strategic finance and internal control perspective.

Ensure rapid and consistent collection of receivables by refining and implementing control mechanisms.

Assign and authorize cheques, purchase orders and invoices.

Work with Controller to promote and maintain positive corporate relations with the financial community.

With input from the CFO, work with the controller on the formulation of accounting policies, procedures, and controls.

Hiring, training, mentoring and supervising accounting staff.

Other related duties and required or assigned.


Requirements


University degree in Business/Accounting, with advanced degree or professional accounting designation (such as CA, CPA, CGA, CMA, and CMT) preferred.

Extensive experience and knowledge of all aspects of corporate accounting and financial management.

Thorough knowledge of all relevant Federal, Provincial and local requirements regarding financial records, pension, profit sharing, and the like is essential.

Proficient communication, interpersonal and organizational skills are vital to the role.

Experience overseeing audits performed by external audit firms.

Financial analysis, budgeting and some strategic planning experience.

Knowledge of accounting principles, practices and applications.

Knowledge of budget preparation and analysis techniques.

Advanced knowledge of MS Office and Excel.

Management and or supervisory experience.

Knowledge of publicly traded companies.

Good project management skills and the ability to motivate teams to produce quality work within tight timeframes.

Professional written and verbal communication skills.

Join Our Team!

SilverChef helps businesses in the hospitality industry meet their equipment-purchasing needs by offering rental and lease solutions through our network of relationships with equipment dealers. SilverChef is looking for a Dealer Relationship Manager to develop a growing territory that includes Eastern Toronto, extending north to Barrie and east to Ottawa as part of the Eastern Canada Sales Team. The ideal candidate will be based out of Richmond Hill, Markham, or Scarborough area.

This role requires someone with a keen passion for Business Development. You will be expected to manage an existing portfolio of business clients while also looking at growing your client base in the territory. You will be provided with hands-on training and be surrounded by a team supporting you in driving your territory’s growth. This opportunity is for someone with a sales background who has a proven record of growing a territory and managing a portfolio of accounts. The individual we are looking for will have a track record of establishing solid business relationships and is looking to build a long-term career with an awesome company!

About us:

Silver Chef is a hospitality finance company with a passionate and energetic team. We have been around for over 30 years and have international offices in Australia and New Zealand. This team is driven by a powerful sense of purpose, an encouraging culture, and opportunities to grow into specialized roles. We are also BCorp accredited and have an aggressive growth plan over the next few years.

Check out some of the benefits we offer:


Multi-year recipient of multiple Top Employer Awards

Competitive compensation package and incentive program

Laptop, cell phone and generous vehicle allowance



A market leading extended health benefits package, a health and wellness spending account, and 4 weeks of vacation a year

Work with purpose. Join an accredited B Corp and have a close relationship with Opportunity International - help us support people in developing countries achieve their dreams too

Paid volunteer days so that you can contribute back to our community

A commitment to ongoing training and development opportunities


More About the Role:

Reporting into the Vice President, Sales – Eastern Canada, this position involves a high level of business development and communication skills. You will be expected to achieve sales targets by increasing our brand’s reach within our existing client base, converting new sales leads for the region, and developing and maintaining mutually beneficial relationships with key internal and external stakeholders. Your business clients will require support, thus requiring an individual that has strong customer-service and account-management skills to meet the demands of this role.

Specifically, your role will include:


Generating new sales from existing dealers. Ensure all our existing partner relationships within the territory appreciate the value of SilverChef’s offering.

Encourage and train our dealer network to have regular conversations around equipment financing with their hospitality clients.

Identifying new opportunities in the marketplace

Managing deals within your sales pipeline

Lead generation, handling and managing the leads database using Salesforce

Managing expectations of dealers’ clients who require assistance with financing for their equipment purchases.

Manage existing dealer accounts. Deliver professional and timely responses to all Customer Experience issues in-line with agreed standards

Developing strong relationships with Dealers and end-users

Developing strong operational relationships with internal and external stakeholders

Communicating effectively with the team and regularly update them on any roadblocks or outcomes

Reporting and data analysis


Skills to Thrill


2+ years in sales preferred

High level of interpersonal and relationship building skills including the ability to liaise, advise and interact well with internal and external stakeholders

High quality planning, organisational skills, time management and problem-solving skills

Experience in Equipment Financing, Dealer Financing, or Hospitality equipment sales will be well regarded

Experience as a SME Commercial Commercial Account Manager or Advisor will be well regarded, but not required

Great verbal and written communication skills, including great presentation skills and the ability to persuade

Team player with energy, flexibility, and integrity

High attention to detail and high level of accuracy

Sound computer literacy skills. Salesforce knowledge and experience considered an asset.

Knowledge of Mandarin or Cantonese would be an asset but not a requirement.


If this sounds a like role that interests you, we would love to hear from you!
