Job Description:

Manager, FP&A

Jonas Software


Our business is one in which building relationships and working with others on the team are critical. The position requires a skilled verbal and written communicator with the confidence and polish to speak with senior executives, accountants, and colleagues.


You are driven to perform, results-oriented and willing to do what it takes. You have excellent interpersonal skills and are an enthusiastic energetic self-starter with a strong sense of customer focus. You are extremely organized and do not let details slip through the cracks. You are a strong listener and collaborative individual, who likes to put forward suggestions and ideas on how to improve the status quo.


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

As an important member of our Finance team you will:



Conduct sensitivity analysis to determine the impact of changes to underlying assumptions on the current fiscal year and budget and long-term strategic plan

Work with business managers to produce detailed three statement forecasts (Income Statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow) including modelling working capital and capital expenditure forecasts

Analyze and communicate trends to business managers to provide actionable insights

Challenge business assumptions to influence forecast accuracy

Monitor the impacts on financial lending covenants and work with senior management to develop any remediation plans necessary

Maintain daily, weekly and monthly cash flow forecast to satisfy covenant reporting

Prepare ad-hoc financial analysis and forecasts for the use in the development of financial business decisions such as customer or product line profitability



JOB QUALIFICATIONS:


CPA, CA designation

Minimum of 3 years of post Big 4 audit firm experience in a dedicated FP&A role with exposure to leverage/covenants

Strong analytical and financial modelling skills and use of technologies such as Power BI/Tableau

Experience analyzing financial forecasts/budgets and analyzing results to identify key trends, drivers, risks and opportunities

Strong understanding of financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statements) with proven track record of producing quarterly three statement forecasts for use with banks and other lenders

Advanced Microsoft Excel skills

Excellent administrative and organizational skills with ability to set priorities, adjust and respond professionally to changing priorities and ad hoc issues

Excellent communication (both oral and written) and interpersonal skills with a proven ability to interact with all levels of management




Business Unit:
Jonas Collection and Recovery - Canada


Scheduled Weekly Hours:
37.5


Number of Openings Available:
1


Worker Type:
Regular


More About Jonas Software:


Jonas Software is the leading provider of enterprise management software solutions to the Country and Golf Clubs, Foodservice, Construction, Fitness & Sports, Attractions, Salon & Spa, Education, Radiology/Laboratory Information Systems, and Product Licensing industries. Within these vertical markets, Jonas is made up of over 65 distinct brands, which are respected and leaders within their own domain.


Jonas’ vision is to be the branded global leader across the aforementioned vertical markets and to be recognized by customers and respective industry stakeholders as the trusted provider of ‘Software for Life’ and as an ambassador for technology, product innovation, quality, and customer service.


Jonas Software is the valued technology partner of over 60,000 customers worldwide in more than 30 countries. Jonas employs over 2,000 skilled individuals consisting of a cross-section of industry experts and technology professionals. Jonas is headquartered in Canada and also operates offices throughout North America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Australia New Zealand and Africa. Jonas is a 100% owned subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc., headquartered in Toronto and traded on the S&P/TSX 60.

We are looking for a skilled HR Officer who will recruit, support and develop talent through developing policies and managing procedures. You will be responsible for managing the employee lifecycle including talent management, compensation and employee benefits, training and development, compliance and workplace safety.



Support the development and implementation of HR initiatives & systems

Create, implement and provide counseling on policies and procedures

Be actively involved in recruitment by preparing job descriptions, and managing the employee lifecycle including hiring, onboarding and exit of employees

Develop training programs

Support Management in disciplinary and grievance issues

Maintain employee records, according to policy and legal requirements

Review employment and working conditions to ensure legal compliance

Manage WCB compliance and update compliance systems for all Canadian provinces

Ensure Health & Safety standards are being met or exceeded.



Requirements & Skills


Knowledge of HR & Payroll functions (pay & benefits, recruitment, training & development etc.)

Understanding labor laws and disciplinary procedures in both Ontario & Quebec

Proficient in MS Office, Advanced Excel

Outstanding organizational & time-management skills

JOB DESCRIPTION - ACCOUNTANTS PAYABLE

COORDINATOR

Reporting to: Controller

DAILY

Process Invoices:


Prepare an A/P coding form with the allocation of the expense to applicable jobs, post in Business Vision, attach all relevant back-up, check authorization, cut and mail cheques.



Accrue all invoices over $ 1,000 immediately.



Make sure all the invoices in the amount of over $ 100.00 are supported by appropriate approval email. Obtain explanations for differences if any, between invoices and approved amount.



Process administrative expense payments on a timely basis to avoid late payment charges.



Process employee’s mileage on a timely basis. Make sure that Company policies are being adhered to and notify the Controller of all variances/exceptions.



Post all the disbursements from bank accounts to the G/L.



Email transaction journal in the morning to Controller for review.



Review and maintain control over the A/P summary by making all necessary adjustments to keep the A/P summary “clean” and accurate.



Communicate with Accounts Receivable to invoice joint venture partners for the expenses relating to closed auction files, if any.



Ensure all vendors are paid on a timely basis.



Assist with Auction Accounting/Administration.



Perform other necessary accounting functions as required.


WEEKLY


Schedule all jobs and set up priority. Post invoices before Wednesday of the payment week, mileage and partners invoices before Wednesday of mileage payment week.



Prepare A/P aging summary with detailed explanation of activities for Controller to review for payment processing.



Prepare an A/P aging report with detailed explanation of items over 60 days.



Post all in house hours accordingly to various jobs as per timesheets from site supervisors.



Post all wire payments, bank charges and first data charges on Monday morning to balance the bank reconciliation report.


MONTHLY


Pay, process, allocate and post all employees’ credit card expense reports. Make sure that Company policies are being adhered to and notify the Controller of all discrepancies.



Assist in the month-end procedures – search of unrecorded liabilities and provide


Controller with the report and photocopies of all invoices over $ 1,000.00.


Check and file all returned cheques, update missing cheques summary.



Prepare G/L analysis reports for required G/L accounts.


YEARLY


Assist auditors with year-end audit work; including various analysis- credit card reconciliations, spending by various vendors etc.

Copper Core Ltd. is a Canadian owned designer and manufacturer of heat exchange products since 1978. Our products include radiators, air charge coolers, and oil and gas coolers for a variety of markets including: petroleum, mining, forestry, construction, agriculture, power generation, and transportation industries. We are located in Etobicoke, near Highway 27 and Albion Road. For more information, please visit www.coppercore.com.

Essential Qualifications:


CPA designation is required.

University Degree or College Diploma in Accounting, Finance, Commerce or Business Administration is required.

Minimum 5 years of financial accounting experience, including experience with payroll.

Experience in the manufacturing industry is an asset.

Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Ability to plan, organize and manage deadlines.

Strong technical and analytical skills, with attention to detail.

Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint), financial accounting and payroll software (QuickBooks).

Sound knowledge of relevant payroll legislation, current government programs, and general accounting practices and principles.

Motivated self-starter; able to work independently with minimal supervision.

Ability to manage confidential and sensitive employee data.


Main Duties and Responsibilities:


Complete full-cycle accounting of month-end and year-end processes, including journal entries, bank reconciliations, and general ledger analysis.

Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual financial reports, including balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements and trial balance.

Prepare and maintain daily transactional aspects of accounts payable/receivable, purchase orders, invoices, inventory, payroll, and cheque requisitions and bank statements.

Develop and maintain financial forecasts and budgets, and identify opportunities to improve financial and operational systems and cost effectiveness.

Prepare and complete the full-cycle biweekly payroll processing for approximately 50 employees.

Prepare and complete government remittances, ensuring filing deadlines are met.

Monitor cash flow of Canadian and U.S. bank accounts.

Prepare and complete payroll journal entries and online filing of WSIB, EHT, GST/HST, T4, and ROE.

Assist with vendor account inquires and resolve payment discrepancies.

Liaison with external accountants.

Adhere to the company’s policies and procedures, with attention to internal control.

Perform any other reasonable duties as required by management from time to time.

job_title_name: Digital Email Marketing Data Analyst (Revenue) - Hybrid
job_description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:

The Globe and Mail is a national icon and Canada’s most recognized media brand.

We’re also an international award winner for data visualization, design, and creative storytelling. A digital innovator with a global client list for our in-house AI-powered optimization, prediction and automation platform. And a place where Canadians come for the best journalism in the country.

We aim to reflect Canada in the stories we tell and in our workforce. The Globe is a proud partner of Pride At Work, Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion, and a signatory of the BlackNorth Initiative. We understand our staff have lives outside of the office and offer flexible work arrangements and support programs. We also provide training and mentorships to staff to ensure you’re able to grow and challenge yourself and your abilities.

No matter what your role at The Globe, you’ll be part of an organization dedicated to making a difference to Canada.


POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Globe and Mail is seeking a Digital Email Marketing Data Analyst to support our database marketing efforts in a very competitive landscape under the leadership of the Manager of Digital Email Marketing Analytics. You will contribute to various phases of digital marketing and CRM campaign management including pre-analysis, list generation, email campaign automation, campaign execution and post campaign reporting/analytics, supporting a comprehensive subscriber contact strategy. The position requires the automation and scheduling of scripted data workflows as well as a sound understanding and strict adherence to data privacy laws and legislation. Additionally, the role will act as an advocate for the protection of subscriber data and enhancement of the subscriber experience through increased engagement.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

•
Gather, document and translate business requirements from various business units into executable direct email marketing campaigns.

•
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to confirm requirements and provide recommendations for campaign design and execution.

•
Manage all facets of the email marketing process – developing and managing the execution of email marketing campaigns, audience segmentation, campaign optimization, customer profiling, A/B testing and preference management.

•
Build insights and KPI analytics for campaign performance, acquisitions, audience strategy and customer predictive models identifying areas of opportunity for future digital marketing optimizations utilizing SQL, Python and Tableau.

•
Create customer journeys and develop implementation plans for new program initiatives with a focus on automated campaigns and a personalized customer content utilizing data from disparate CEM data sources.

•
Develop email marketing campaign segmentation strategies based on customer and prospect type/persona data, transactional history and web/app customer behavioral data.

•
Create both ad hoc and recurring automation email campaigns utilizing Oracle SQL, Python and JavaScript by interacting with cloud-based email deployment systems and APIs.

•
Design and create optimized test and learn (target vs control, A/B) email campaigns that leverage previous campaign learnings.

•
Complete quality assurance audits to ensure email creative and campaign list SQL code accurately reflect business requirements and specifications - pinpoint actionable insights, efficiencies, and new opportunities.

•
Communicate insights to internal stakeholders in order to leverage the email-marketing channel.

•
Work with application development staff to develop database architectures, coding standards, and quality assurance policies and procedures. Ensure email marketing campaign data is accurate and email creative is error free.


QUALIFICATIONS:

•
Degree in Computer Science or a related analytical/database marketing field required.

•
2+ years of relevant experience with relational databases and programming languages used for analyzing/manipulating data and automating Oracle jobs (PL/SQL, SQL).

•
2+ years minimum experience in marketing analytics, business intelligence, data mining, statistics or quantitative analysis supporting customer acquisition and retention.

•
Advanced SQL skills are mandatory.

•
Passionate about marketing automation with hands-on experience using email-marketing platforms and email automation software

•
Tableau (or equivalent BI reporting tool) reporting and dashboard building experience would be beneficial.

•

Experience with big data platform (ie:
AWS, Snowflake, Metabase) an asset.

•
Experience with automation utilizing Python and/or JavaScript as well as API integrations an asset.

•
Ability to effectively communicate technical results and analysis to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

•
Understanding of the principles of relational databases and importance of data hygiene.

•
Excellent written, oral and presentation skills.

•
Ability to prioritize and meet strict deadlines.

•
Strong attention to detail.

•
Well organized with strong multi-tasking skills.

•
Collaborative team player who is willing to share knowledge and learnings with others in team.

•
Autonomous self-starter, comfortable working in a team environment with minimal direction


SALARY:
Commensurate with qualifications and experience


VACCINATION POLICY:

All offers of employment with The Globe and Mail are conditional upon the candidate being Fully Vaccinated. To be Fully Vaccinated is defined as someone who has received the full series of a vaccine or a combination of vaccines accepted by the Government of Canada (currently Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca, Janssen) and has received the last dose at least 14 days prior to their start date. To prove they are Fully Vaccinated, all new hires will be required to provide evidence by emailing a copy of their vaccine dose administration receipt(s) to Human Resources prior to their start date. Those seeking exemption based on one or more of the protected grounds in the Human Rights Code will need to provide their request for accommodation to Human Resources for approval. If the accommodation request is not approved and the candidate is not Fully Vaccinated, any offer of employment will be revoked.

THE GLOBE AND MAIL IS DEDICATED TO DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION IN THE WORKPLACE

The Globe and Mail is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. We believe this strengthens our business and our journalism. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, regardless of race, ethnicity, culture, gender, sexual orientation, religion, socio-economic status, age, and physical ability. As required by the Federal Contractors Program, The Globe also tracks the proportion of staff in the four Employment Equity categories (Women, Aboriginal Peoples, Persons with Disabilities, and Members of Visible Minorities) to ensure we are reflecting the areas in which we work.

The Globe and Mail offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

Limelight is looking for an
FP&A Analyst
to join out team! This a great opportunity to combine your finance and technical knowledge.

Our cloud financial planning, forecasting & reporting platform automates manual spreadsheet processes so businesses can spend more time on data insights. As we continue to scale, it's important to us to nurture the culture we have built where team members work closely together to solve problems, innovate, and get creative.

As an FP&A Analyst, you will work closely with key stakeholders in finance (CFO, VP, Director, Controller) to connect their strategic goals to FP&A model design. You must have a deep understanding of the FP&A planning/reporting process, knowledge of metrics that Finance leaders hold their business accountable to, and challenges at all levels within the FP&A function. Intimate knowledge of financial statements is a must.

As part of this role you will:


Work closely with clients' Finance leadership teams to uncover where improvements can be made within their FP&A processes and to understand what outcomes their strategy is targeting

Lead requirements-gathering sessions to extract the functional requirements

Translate functional requirements from design sessions to develop the model

Create and test reports within Limelight to support the delivery and implementation of the project


Candidate requirements:


Minimum 2 years experience in FP&A

Minimum 2 years of consulting experience

Experience with building planning, forecasting and reporting models

Strong finance and modeling background

Project management is an asset

Understanding of data governance principles and best practices

Skilled in communication with clients and team members

Focused on relationship building and client centricity

Having worked with ERP or other FP&A products is a value-add


Some reasons our team loves working here:


We emphasize a highly collaborative environment. Everyone builds things and collaborates across departments. The best solution can come from anywhere or anyone

We’re fierce defenders of healthy work-life flexibility

Respect, trust, and honesty. Personal and professional maturity is important to us, and we keep each other honest

We pay competitive salaries and have a flexible vacation

We provide great benefits: drug, dental, vision, life

We have an amazing team that will be eager to help you succeed in your role and grow and develop in your career

You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.


Job Description:


Our Canadian business segment is a leading provider of protection, health, asset management and wealth solutions, providing products and services that deliver value to over 6.6 million Clients. We are the largest provider of benefits and pensions in the workplace, and offer a wide range of products to individuals via retail channels. We are focused on helping Canadians achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives. Our key business units include: Individual Insurance & Wealth; Group Retirement Services and Sun Life Health.


The FP&A team supporting the Canadian business segment has a mandate that encompasses:


Delivery of the financial outlooks that support the 5 year strategic plan and the annual business plan

Dynamic planning and scenario modelling

Identification and optimization of key levers and initiatives to drive business growth

Synthesis of key competitive trends and potential impacts to our financial outlook



We are looking to revolutionize the way we approach dynamic planning and scenario modelling and the Manager FP&A is an opportunity to get in at the beginning of the journey and play a pivotal role.


What will you do?


Understand the business drivers and draw insights on levers to optimize the businesses

Support short-run scenario analysis and modelling requests using traditional tools such as Excel, Tableau, Essbase, etc.

Over a longer period, assist in the development of dynamic planning capabilities:


Collaborate with each Business Unit Finance team to document current state forecasting processes and understand pain points

Recommended process changes to improve short-term delivery and ensure readiness for longer-term automation

Build driver-based financial models for review and testing with business unit partners

Assist with sourcing potential vendors to determine the optimal technology to meet our collective objectives

Partner with key vendor(s) to build requirements and a roadmap for execution

Act as key liaison between vendor business unit finance teams through execution




What do you need to succeed?


Demonstrated FP&A Experience:


5-7 Years of financial modelling in the financial services industry (Insurance and Wealth Management preferred)

Leadership of process improvement or re-engineering initiatives in FP&A

Experience with implementation and use of FP&A platforms

Passion for business analysis, modelling and planning




Relationship management experience:


Strong track record of building solid relationships with business partners

Ability to understand business partner requirements and translate into simple solutions

Strong communication and facilitation skills

Comfortable delivering presentations and proposals to senior level audiences




Solid Technical Skills:


Bachelor’s Degree in IT, Finance, Business Management or comparable

MBA and/or CPA designation

Excellent problem solving and analytical skills

Excellent PC skills (MS Excel, Oracle, SAP, Essbase, Tableau) including experience in building reports




What's in it for you?


20 vacation days per year

Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential

Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US.

Named 2021 “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor

Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021

Flexible hybrid work model

Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives

A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture



#LI-Hybrid

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.


At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.


To learn more about CIBC, please visit
CIBC.com



Job Description


What you'll be doing


As a member of the Personal and Business Banking Team, you’ll build and grow a dedicated client portfolio through relationship management, financial services support, and exceptional client service. As a Financial Advisor, you’ll deliver on CIBC’s Imperial Service approach, acting as a single point of contact for your clients and helping them plan for today’s needs and tomorrow’s goals. You’ll make lasting connections and provide the right financial advice, helping them secure their futures, own homes, and set up businesses. You’re flexible to work our banking centre hours which may include evenings and weekends. To help deliver a great client experience, you’re flexible to work at multiple banking centres within a reasonable travel distance.


How you'll succeed



Client engagement - Focus on each client experience and connect on a personal level to make every interaction meaningful. Provide tailored advice and solutions in all areas of financial planning including day-to-day banking, investments, lending and estate planning. Cultivate your network to establish new client relationships.


Business development - Deeply understand your local market and potential client base to create sales plan that will convert leads into new clients. Use your strong relationship building and networking skills to create connections, generate opportunities, and deliver bottom line results. Leverage CIBC’s wide range of credit and investment solutions to provide a needs-based approach that will result in satisfied, loyal clients and increased referrals.


Community involvement - Heighten CIBC brand awareness in your community by attending local events and participating in marketing and outreach activities. Grow your network to create lasting connections that will generate future opportunities.



Who you are



You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.


You’re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You connect with others through respect and authenticity.


You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take initiative, go above and beyond, and deliver results.


You can demonstrate 1 – 3 years experience in providing financial advice to clients and establishing relationships while achieving performance targets.


You’re goal oriented. You’re motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make a difference.


You’re a certified professional (IIROC). You have current accreditation and good standing for IIROC licensing requirements; Canadian Securities Course (CSC) written within the past 3 years is required upon hire, Conduct and Practices Handbook Course (CPH), Wealth Management Essentials Course (WME).


You’re a certified professional (Quebec). You have current accreditation and good standing in AMF licensing; Successful completion of Canadian Investment Funds Course (CIFC) or the Canadian Securities Course (CSC) to support AMF (Autorité des Marchés Financiers) licensing, and Registered Retirement Consultant (RRC). It’s an asset if you’ve completed CSI/ICB Investment and Taxation Fundamentals Course - Quebec (0774) and CSI/ICB Legal & Ethical Aspects of Financial Planning Course (0790).


Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.



What CIBC offers


At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.



We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program


Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients


We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development



What you need to know



CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact
Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

provision of timely and accurate payroll services.


Responsibilities will include:


Managing effective and efficient payroll service provided to 40,000 TDSB employees


through supervisors and other payroll support staff who are responsible for the specific


payroll production areas, including timely and accurate implementation of collective


agreement provisions, terms and conditions, related policies, and procedures within TDSB;


Managing payroll related risk, develop, document, implement, and assess the controls and


systems used to ensure payroll activities are delivered in compliance with associated


regulations, legislation, collective Bargaining Agreement, and internal standards;


Providing mentorship, coaching and development to create a high-performing and service-


oriented team;


Providing advice and consultative support to senior management staff regarding department


operations; and


Leveraging technology to refine and continuously improve or automate payroll processes,


forms, and workflow to gain operational efficiencies.




Summary of Duties:
➢ Provide strategic leadership, guidance, and support to ensure accurate and timely

delivery of payroll processing services;
➢ Responsible for the management and direction of staff including planning, staff

scheduling, hiring, performance reviews, and staff development;
➢ Determine department goals and objectives and develop appropriate implementation

strategies, monitor progress and achievements;
➢ Provide direction, interpretation, and guidance on payroll technical matters (e.g., statutory

tax legislation, 4/5 cancellations, retiring allowance payments to RRSP’s, WSIB and
retroactive payments;

➢ Ensure timely and accurate payroll expenditure allocation and payroll liability accounts
reconciliations;

➢ Develop and manage payroll department budget; prepare reports for internal and
external use;

➢ Build and maintain collaborative relationships with Compensation Services, Employee
Services, and schools to ensure effective processes are in place to make timely
payments to employees;






➢ Negotiate and develop interdepartmental procedures on various issues such as return
from leaves, hiring forms with respect to pension requirements, issuing of ROE’s etc.;

➢ Anticipate problematic issues and take proactive steps to resolve them (e.g., ROE
production, changes in payment schedules, salary advances for late input, return from
leaves);

➢ Leverage technology to streamline internal processes and to identify areas of
improvement.

➢ Develop solutions that will increase efficiencies across various departments (e.g.,
automation of leave without pay, automation of sick leave and vacation across all groups
of employees, WSIB tracking module, electronic transmission of various deductions,
interfaces with external agencies)

➢ Co-ordinate systems needs and processing with Employee Services and Finance and
Operations;

➢ Define, document, and establish system requirements and priorities; ensuring effective
systems interfaces between production areas;

➢ Assist with recommendation for long term direction of HR/Payroll Application solutions;
➢ Collaborate and provide direction to HRIS team to implement system enhancements and

modifications to comply with collective agreements, grievance, arbitration settlements
and legislative changes;

➢ Develop policies and procedures to comply with collective agreements, statutes &
legislations;

➢ Ensure compliance with all relevant federal and provincial legislation, the Income Tax
Act, employment standards, WSIB, Collective Agreements, and related TDSB policies
and procedures;

➢ Chair and/or Co-Chair various committees and meetings;
➢ Act as a resource for TDSB at various grievance/arbitration hearings and provide

consultation as required to negotiators on various related collective agreement issues;
➢ Liaise with related professional associations (e.g., OASBO payroll committee and

Canadian Payroll Association) to work with agencies on direction and/or regulation
changes;

➢ Provide leadership in fostering equity and inclusiveness in the development and
implementation of programs and services; and

➢ Other duties as assigned.



Qualifications:
➢ Post-secondary degree in related discipline such as Business Administration including,

Accounting, Human Resources and Information Technology courses with five years’
progressively responsible experience managing payroll system for a large, multisite,
unionized employer, or an equivalent combination of education and experience;

➢ CPA/CPM (Canadian Payroll Association/Certified Payroll Manager) designation;
➢ Proven experience managing large complex SAP payroll, time and attendance and HR

software;
➢ In-depth knowledge of payroll operations management, tax regulations, employment and

labour legislation (e.g., Employment Standards, PIPEDA);
➢ Experience understanding and administering collective agreement provisions;
➢ Proven staff management experience with strong leadership, mentoring and team

building skills;
➢ Strong application development and excellent project management skills. Process

oriented and possess a continuous improvement mindset with demonstrated experience
in process improvements and delivering business efficiencies;

➢ Strong analytical, problem-solving, strategic thinking and planning skills. Ability to quickly
deliver solutions that meet the needs of a complex and fast-paced organization;






➢ Excellent organizational, time management skills and attention to details and accuracy.
Demonstrated experience managing multiple, competing tasks and priorities;

➢ Strong interpersonal skills, emotional intelligence, and proven ability to resolve conflicts
and problems;

➢ Strong written, oral, communication skills including report writing, presentation and group
facilitation skills;

➢ Proven ability in promoting equitable practices which value inclusiveness and diversity;
➢ Ability to develop a culture of high trust, collaboration, and engagement; and
➢ Advanced understanding of, and skills in the use of, financial information systems and

other applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, report writing, etc.).


Assets:

Job Summary

Reporting to the Manager, Accounting, the Financial Analyst is responsible to perform financial accounting, accounts payable and accounts receivable functions for the Societies. The individual must maintain the integrity of the accounting procedures and systems through constant maintenance, development, and implementation of improvements to enhance the value added to the Societies.

Financial Accounting:

· Prepare journal entries as required to update accounts

· Maintaining capital asset module and record depreciation and amortization expenses

· Investigate any discrepancies thoroughly that are identified ensuring proper corrective actions are taken to resolve these discrepancies

· Participate in Sage Intacct and other software

Job Qualifications

· Working towards a CPA designation or already acquired a CPA designation an asset

Experience:

· Minimum 3 years’ financial analyst/accounting experience

· Experience in a multi-level, not for profit organization is an asset

Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications:

· Strong technical skills in financial and accounting areas of practice, including GAAP

· Proven experience of accounting processes, procedures, controls and reporting including management of accounts payable, accounts receivable and general ledgers

· Understanding of accounting principles and concepts, and adept at utilization of financial and accounting systems

· Ability to work within a ‘hands-on’ accounting environment

· Excellent analytical, problem solving and organizing skills with close attention to detail and accuracy

· Ability to use discretion, judgment and tact in handling sensitive or confidential information or situations

· Excellent verbal, listening and written communication skills

· Expert knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Outlook and experience with accounting software. e.g., Sage Intacct

· Experience in Raiser’s Edge is an asset

· Maturity and experience managing multiple priorities

· Well organized and able to work independently and utilize sound judgement to perform all assigned duties with minimal supervision

· Able to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, clients and community agencies

· Experience working independently as well as within a team environment

· Excellent client service skills. Able to handle high volumes and multiple priorities in a professional, courteous manner while meeting strict deadlines

· Exhibit and work within Alzheimer’s Society competencies: Collaboration, Accountability, Respect and Excellence

Mobile Mortgage Specialist

Location: Guelph/ Markham/ Mississauga/ North York/ Toronto

Job Purpose:

As a Mobile Mortgage Specialist (Guelph/ Markham/ Mississauga/ North York/ Toronto) you will be responsible for maximizing the development of residential mortgage business from third party referral sources such as real estate agents, lawyers, financial planners, and centres of influence with the goal of bringing new customers to the Bank.


Is this role right for you?

You’re entrepreneurial, driven, and you love that every day is different. You’re willing to work variable hours including weekends and evenings and you’re available to meet clients at times that are convenient for them
Whether it’s conducting mortgage seminars or building a marketing program, you enjoy business development and getting out in the community
This role is 100% commission, which puts your future in your own hands

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role (Mobile Mortgage Specialist - Guelph/ Markham/ Mississauga/ North York/ Toronto)? – We’d love to work with you if:


You have strong sales management experience and have the ability to market yourself, the mortgage business, and Scotiabank effectively

You’re a relationship builder who is focused on providing a great client experience and growing relationships with existing Bank customers

You maintain current knowledge of mortgage lending policies and procedures, and understand the real estate market/property values/sales trends/competitor programs to be able to respond appropriately to business requirements

You have 1 to 2 years of industry-related experience and a deep understanding of your local market

You possess and maintain a driver’s license and have access to personal transportation


What’s in it for you?


Mobile Mortgage Specialists has a boutique feel where you’ll own your market and be fully supported by our Sales Leaders.

You’ll be given the tools you need to help your clients with the advice necessary for them to realize their home ownership goals.

You’ll have access to an industry-leading suite of mortgage products, including our iconic STEP product. You’ll be able to offer solutions for rental property financing, purchase-plus improvements, and customers who are business-for-self, high-net worth, or new to Canada.

Our underwriting model is very different, which means you’ll get to partner with a dedicated Home Financing Lending Manager who will provide one-touch service for underwriting, condition fulfillment, and deal escalation. Our model is efficient, fast, and rooted in common sense lending principles.

Unique lead generation programs, marketing and social selling programs, Salesforce CRM and COI loyalty program paid for and supported by the Bank.

Requisition ID: 170830

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.


Excited about
creating a safer financial world
by using your data, analytics, and modelling skills? –
Join us!


As the
Market Risk Measurement

(MRM)
team, we are an established leader in risk methodologies with many awards and several firsts in the Canadian banking sector: We prepare Scotiabank for the adoption of new regulatory and industry-wide initiatives and played a key role in Scotiabank becoming the first bank in Canada to receive regulatory approval for using Internal Model Methods (IMM) for Counterparty Credit Risk. We currently lead the Bank’s project to implement the Fundamental Review of the Trading Book (FRTB). As part of this, we have provided major contributions to discussion with regulators on changes that increase the financial stability of banking systems world-wide.


MRM is actively involved in the Bank’s Diversity & Inclusion (D&I) initiatives representing the diverse gender, cultural and ethnic backgrounds of our team. The more diverse we are, the more balanced our approach and models will be! The team is a key contributor to Women-in-Leadership activities – we take part in enterprise-wide D&I discussions, events, and Employee Resource Groups to enhance the representation and recognition of minority groups in the bank.



We are looking for people and talent that will help us drive these large-scale initiatives forward and work alongside our diverse team of quants, data scientists and developers and collaborate with our many stakeholders across Scotiabank.


Is this role right for you?

Do you love to apply your data, analytic, and modelling skills to solve relevant problems? Do you want to be part of the exciting endeavour of building out the next generation market risk framework to make a safer financial world? This role is ideal for a person with quantitative modeling background who is keen to help in bank-wide projects that require a high degree of communication and stake-holder management. This is also good starter role for someone with a strong quantitative background with proven interest in Finance, Economics, Derivatives, or Risk Management via reading and self-education.


As a member of the
Counterparty Credit Risk Measurement
team, you will work with the Bank’s Counterparty Credit Risk (CCR) systems, which includes measurement of Potential Future Exposure (PFE), IMM capital and xVA pricing. The team is at the forefront of new bank-wide initiatives related to CCR system- and model enhancements with exposure to many stakeholders from business and risk functions, including Machine Learning initiatives. You will drive the implementation of system changes, collaborate with front-office and credit-risk officers, support existing models. You will be a central part of the Counterparty Credit Risk cycle in the bank. You may also engage with regulators and Canadian Bankers Association (CBA) to ensure model development and CCR management are aligned with most recent industry developments, regulatory changes, and best-practices.



In this role, you will:


Take a hands-on role in the development and maintenance in one of the key PFE, IMM and XVA engines in the bank.

Interact with the business and the XVA desk on a daily basis on all CCR matters, as well as all other stakeholders in the organization.

Help in a number of Machine Learning based initiatives we have to improve the CCR engine in the bank, that measure XVA, as well as PFE and IMM capital.

Development and implementation of processes is typically completed in Python with close collaboration with stakeholders in IT to productionalize models.

Communicate with model users, IT, trading desks, risk teams, and business lines to enhance models and ensure correct use of models.

Become an active member of the team including our D&I initiatives and communities.



Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? - We'd love to work with you if you have:


Solid quantitative background and problem-solving skills with a keen interest in Finance, Economics, Derivatives, Risk management and Regulations.

Advanced degree in a mathematics, economics, or scientific discipline (e.g., Mathematics, Finance, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Biology, Economics, etc.). Master’s degrees or PhDs are a bonus.

Experience in Python programing or other programing will be important to support day-day activity.

Effective communication and specifically the ability to summarize complex ideas in simple terms; you enjoy working in collaborations. Experience in managing and pushing forward projects.



What’s in it for you?


The opportunity to join a forward-thinking company surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers.

A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development.

Internal development to support your growth and enhance your skills.

A competitive compensation and benefits package.

An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our customers.

We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!



This position is located Downtown, Toronto.

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Job Title





































Manager, FATCA/CRS Compliance (6 Month Contract)






































Job Description






































What is the opportunity?

The role of Manager, FATCA/CRS Compliance is to provide Second Line of Defense (2LOD) governance and oversight over RBC’s FATCA/CRS Compliance program. In addition, ensure that program and activities are aligned with RBC’s Enterprise Regulatory Compliance Management (RCM) Framework and supporting control standards and other projects as needed.


What will you do?


Support the Senior Manager in executing program governance activities including registration and de-registration of RBC entities, maintenance of RBC’s FATCA/CRS database, contact list, management of internal FATCA/CRS attestation program, and execution of monitoring program in accordance with the FATCA/CRS Control Standard.

Assist with the development, maintenance and management of RBC’s Enterprise FATCA/CRS governance program, such as updating, maintaining and managing RBC’s Enterprise FATCA/CRS Policy and Control Standards.

Prepare senior management reporting on the status of FATCA/CRS compliance.

Support the establishment of training and communication strategies to ensure policy requirements and updates are well-socialized and understood.

Monitor for emerging regulatory changes and ensure Compliance policies and standards are updated to remain appropriate and adequate.

Participate in collaborative stakeholdering discussions across the first and second lines of defence to ensure policy updates reflect regulatory expectations and prudent business practices.

Support the development of the program to align with expectations set out in RBC’s Regulatory Compliance Management Framework and control standards.

Work closely and cultivate strong relationships with key functional partners, Corporate Tax, tax operations and law group as required in order to execute global FATCA/CRS program.



What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


2 – 4 years of experience in FATCA and CRS

University degree or professional designation

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Experience at large, complex global financial institution or knowledge of relevant products

Experience of working in close partnership with stakeholders at various levels



Nice-to-have


Good understanding of global information reporting rules

Ability to work effectively in a matrix environment

Strong ability to plan and organize own workload, and attention to detail and accuracy.



What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

job_description:
TD Description


Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.




Department Overview

TD Securities (TDS) Delivery mandate is to deliver initiatives that enable business growth and compliance with global regulatory initiatives in an efficient and effective way while managing the risks associated with large scale programs.

Want to shape the future?

This is a strong community where you'll feel connected and challenged. You'll be busy, but never bored and your real passion for change will reap lasting rewards. There's a big appetite to raise the bar in this role. Change at TDS is evolving and influencing at a rapid pace and we're looking for visionaries, just like you to be this change.
TDS Delivery reflects a significant evolution of our approach to managing and delivering change in the dealer's largest cross functional initiatives. The TDS Delivery mandate is to help TDS meet is vision to be the #1 Dealer in Canada. This is achieved through three pillars:

Talent – attract, develop, and retain talent that can lead, facilitate, and manage change collaboratively with all partners.

Delivery Excellence – We deliver disciplined processes that produce strategic business and regulatory change to enable business growth and client value.

Passion for Change – Our delivery approach depends on the energy and enthusiasm of our dedicated teams who are committed to "make change happen!".


Are you embarking on a growing career in TDS delivery?

Do you lead and collaborate well with all working partners and understand how to align your day-to-day change activities with overall business objectives? If so, this is a great opportunity with a high potential career path in Delivery at TDS.




Job Description

Associate Vice Presidents (AVPs) at TD Bank Group contribute to the overall reputation of TD. As executives, AVPs help to set the ethical, organizational and performance standard for the teams they lead and exemplify how an effective performance and development culture functions day to day. An AVP is expected to guide his/her team, collaborating as appropriate with TD partners, to deliver excellent results in both the short and long term.

AVPs promote adherence to TDBG’s vision and purpose to be the better bank, and to enrich the lives of customers, communities, and colleagues. As part of the general management of their function, AVPs are accountable to deliver against TD's five shared commitments:

Think like a customer; provide legendary experiences and trusted advice

Act like an owner; lead with integrity to drive business results and contribute to communities

Execute with speed and impact; only take risks we can understand and manage

Innovate with purpose; simplify the way we work

Develop our colleagues; embrace diversity and respect one another


Job Description:


Accountable for the end-to-end delivery of the XVA & Counterparty Credit risk roadmap across all of TD Securities globally

Utilization of negotiation skills and ability to influence others to drive delivery.

Transform high level vision and complex concepts into solutions with detailed requirements and efficient execution design.

Manage end-to-end delivery across all impacted business and technology groups in support of new product launches through employing a streamlined change delivery model that maximizes efficiency, effectiveness, and scalability.

Accountable for key delivery decisions and aligning technology and business objectives into a shared delivery vision. Delivery decision includes assessment of multiple stakeholder impacts.

Facilitates the breaking down of Risk infrastructure Vision and Platform Roadmap into component parts that can be executed

Supports Executive Sponsor and Business Owner in structuring and securing approval for business case and funding.

Accountable for challenging program estimates and supporting the team in removing any roadblocks during the estimation process.

Establishes program governance structures for effective delivery orchestration, meeting TD's governance control objectives.

Responsible for executing the program/project across all domains to meet the stated success criteria and product(s) value realization, with explicit consideration to business process, change impacts and the transition from delivery to business as usual.

Accountable for establishing and executing processes and practices that support the appropriate project-level delivery framework (e.g. Rapid/ TD Agile: cycle measurements, daily scrums, retrospectives, sprint planning, testing, MVP mapping to releases); (e.g. PDLC: requirements package, change management plan, testing plan, control processes for scope/requirements change)

Establishes and manages resource plan, issues, risks and financial plans to support the roadmap.

Anticipates issues, trends and the potential impact and timely resolution of impediments, while effectively managing the program schedule (releases) and financials and ensuring continuing review and prioritization.

Coordinates with the respective enterprise control partners (e.g., EPDE, Strategic Sourcing Group, Legal, TRMIS, OCDO. etc.) to appropriately select, engage and manage external service providers as required.

Builds and leads a large diverse business team to effectively deliver productivity, quality and innovation.





Job Requirements


Job Requirements:


Outstanding record of project delivery success, both in results achieved and in use of professional methodology especially using Agile approach

Good understanding of TDs Counterparty Credit risk management and capital framework

Partnership with Business Owner(s) and Technology Owner to remove impediments and manage within TD's risk appetite

Indisputable knowledge of program/project delivery methodologies (including PDLC and TD Agile scaling frameworks)

Pro-active in developing and implementing strategies that significantly mitigate risk

Demonstrates superior interpersonal skills, conflict resolution, and negotiating skills

Strong working knowledge of project management techniques and tools including Microsoft Project, JIRA and Confluence

Ability to apply industry frameworks and techniques

Passion to succeed and results oriented

Resilient under pressure

Flexible with an innate ability to "course correct"

Demonstrated leadership ability

Flexible and able to quickly adapt to unfamiliar, ambiguous, or changing conditions

Adaptive communication skills

Ability to build and motivate teams

High threshold for dealing with ambiguity

Entrepreneurial mindset

Excellent analytical, problem solving, relationship management skills

Ability to work on multiple concurrent projects as and when required

Drive for continuous improvement

Ability to influence all parties while driving delivery forward


Specific Education Requirements:


University degree or equivalent

PMP, PMI-ACP, CSM or CSP designation preferred

Knit People is an all in one online payroll, HR, and health benefits service created for small to medium businesses and entrepreneurs. We help manage and automate administrative tasks so they have more time for meaningful work.

As our prospective Payroll Specialist, you will be working closely with the Accounting, Sales, and Product teams to improve Knit's processes and ensure that all of our clients have a fantastic customer experience!

Job Description


Provide support and troubleshooting to our clients

Manage the on-boarding of new clients

Organize projects across multiple departments to meet key deadlines

Become a platform expert able to teach others all the nitty gritty stuff

Responsible & fully accountable for the payroll & audit function of multiple clients.

Responsible for scheduling and running the assigned client payrolls by following standard operating procedures.

Maintains complete and accurate client profile notes as well as processing instructions for each client

Utilize all internal tools & defined processes to ensure optimal productivity, service excellence and make recommendations for best practices to customers

Initiate pre and post production calls with a clients

Collaborate in improving organization-wide processes to help us scale


Who will be successful in this role?


A life-long learner who prioritizes learning and development and wants to get better everyday

A strategic thinker and problem-solver who can overcome challenges, on-the-fly, in a thoughtful and meaningful way

A person of high integrity; who gets things done while also doing it the right way with a customer-first attitude

The Opportunity:
As part of Maple Leaf Food’s Finance team, the Manager of Accounts Payable is responsible for leading the Accounts Payable team and ensuring both Maple Leaf Foods & Greenleaf Foods develop and maintain strong relationships with vendors and internal stakeholders. This role reports directly to the Manager of Accounts Payable and Payroll and is part of the Finance Services leadership team.
Snapshot of a Day-in-the-Life:


Manage and oversee the Accounts Payable team, which includes the Processing and Issues Resolution functions

Develop and maintain strong vendor and internal relationships; engage with stakeholders to influence positions and reach decisions to ensure Finance principles are upheld

Propose team priorities and opportunities for the greatest strategic impact on the organization, taking into account industry and market trends


What You’ll Bring:

Being part of a high-performance, people-focused company that has an inspiring and unique vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, and a deep commitment to sustainable protein across North America.

An inclusive company culture and a work environment that keeps our people safe, rewards excellence, and empowers everyone to learn and contribute their best.

Learning and development opportunities, including workshops, ‘speaker series’ events, and resources that allow you to develop your skills and progress your career.

Comprehensive tuition reimbursement program that supports continuous learning and development of our team members through investment in eligible degrees, diplomas, professional certification, or trades programs.

Supporting our deep commitment to community impact, we offer up to two paid days annually to volunteer at a cause of your choice.

job_description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.






































































































Job Title





































Banking Advisor - Richmond Hill - Mandarin/Cantonese Language






































Job Description






































**As we have many branch locations across this market, we are hiring multiple candidates for this position. Apply today!**


What is the opportunity?

This unique position calls on your client-focused sales expertise and natural problem-solving skills to maximize each client interaction. Specifically, you help clients with their everyday banking, credit, and investment needs. As an RBC ambassador, you add value in the moments that matter most to clients and collaborate with RBC partners to help clients achieve their goals. Whether you’re demonstrating to a client how to use digital banking, on-boarding a new client, or referring a complex opportunity to a specialist, your expertise will contribute to creating meaningful and memorable client experiences to drive client satisfaction and loyalty.


What will you do?


Proactively engage with clients in all areas of the branch and in the community, uncovering banking needs, providing help and advice, as well as identifying sales and referral opportunities

Focus on client education and demonstration, leveraging technology to deliver a memorable client experience, drive sales, and retain business

Respond to client-initiated contact, assisting them with a full range of financial transactions

Actively listen and engage clients in conversation to further understand their individual needs

Proactively take ownership of resolving and preventing client banking problems

Cultivate and maintain relationships with partners to make the most of business opportunities and referrals



What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


Mutual Funds accreditation, or willingness to obtain it (i.e., Investment Funds in Canada or the Canadian Securities Course)

Demonstrated passion for putting clients first, as well as success in a hands-on, target-driven sales environment

Problem-solving and people skills, with the ability to build strong relationships and proactively connect with clients

Flexibility, eagerness to learn, strong personal ethics, and a hunger for success

Digital literacy across a broad range of devices (i.e., smartphones, tablets, laptops, etc.)



Nice-to-have


Track record in building rapport and maintaining client relationships within the financial or service industry



What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including competitive compensation, bonuses, and flexible benefits

Continued opportunities for career advancement

World-class sales training, coaching, and development opportunities

Support from a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high performing team, as well as world-class tools and training

Opportunity to achieve great success and grow your career with RBC



RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager
.

Reporting directly to the team lead, the Intermediate Cost Analyst will support senior staff and team leads in area of cost controlling, variance analysis, forecasting and reporting. A day in the life:


Support Lead and Senior Cost control staff

Initiate actions as required to meet commitments, projects, and client deadlines

Assuming responsibility for preparing and assessing the accuracy of all cost control reports

Assist in monitoring the performance of the job versus current forecast by analyzing actual data, reviewing project costs overruns/under runs and producing appropriate reporting for project management

Ensuring thorough regular periodic reassessment of project scope, cost and schedule for completeness, reflecting the best judgement of the project team and management

Evaluate current status of the project cost, provide most accurate total Project Forecast ensuring inclusion of all cost categories

Identify deliverables, assign budgets and check points to these deliverables, status progress against check / control points, calculate earned hours and progress

Engage with the discipline leads, project leads and management team to gather information required for earn value, cost and forecast reporting.

Report and graph updates of actual man-hours and costs invoiced, incurred, physical progress, forecast to complete, key and / or critical issues and scheduled achievements relative to the status of the project

Review invoices for correct collection of revenues

Update project information for actual invoices

Ensure contractual obligations are being met within assigned budgets

Apply controls to ensure that procedures are being adhered to; active in continuous improvement

Support management of change process, change orders and change logs

Support maintenance and development of cost control systems, tools and procedure.

Other duties as assigned.




KEY COMPETENCIES


Able to communicate, understand, express and apply basic technical, business or administrative concepts.

Superior organizational and time-management skills; ability to meet deadlines.

Decision and problem-solving ability.

Proven ability to multi-task and efficiently respond to changing priorities.

Accepts coaching, knowledge and support from more experienced staff.




MEASURES OF SUCCESS


Define and steward the commitment to Health and Safety on the projects

A career in Financial Markets at National Bank is to participate in the transformation to have a direct impact on the client. As an Loan Administration Advisor, you will support Directors and Managing Directors in the Covenant & Security aspect for corporate clients within the Credit Capital Markets (CCM) sector. More so, you will review financial statements, financial ratios and borrowing base calculations in addition to reviewing security documentation for corporate borrowers.

Join a team of 25+ colleagues in similar roles across Canada, reporting into the Manager, Loan Administration CCM in either Toronto/Montreal (whichever is applicable)

Your role:


Work in partnership with various internal and external stakeholders (line of business, clients, law firm, trustees) in syndicated and direct financing transactions.

Orient stakeholders by evaluating and identifying their needs and proposing appropriate solutions to support the implementation of activities considering the diversity of cases and bank’s operational limitations.

Interact with different sectors of the Bank, managers, and employees to interpret information and offer support and advice on grey area situations.

Respond to requests from clients, internal and external stakeholder or direct them appropriately to get a response.

Support the implementation at different stages of the loan cycle and ensure follow-up until full completion of the request.

Proactively report problematic situations and propose solutions to such problems to your section manager.

Work with minimal supervision but may require some interpretation of defined methods and procedures.


This position is divided in 4 main responsibilities:

Customer Service:

You will be expected to provide high quality and professional service (in person, electronically, and over the telephone) to maintain the satisfaction of internal and external parties.

Financial Covenants and Compliance:

You will be required to understand complex financial covenant and reporting requirements, with a view to monitor and follow as per executed legal documentation.

Security Documentation:

You will be required to control and monitor all security documentation and executed legal documents.

Risk Management:

Follow procedures set to identify risks associated with borrowers/client of Credit Capital Markets.

Undergrad or Graduate degree in a related field and 3-4 years of experience in Commercial or Capital Markets sector of a Financial Institution

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Job Title





































Manager, Sanctions Investigations & Scanning






































Job Description






































What is the opportunity?

As Manager, you review and decision alerts generated, as well investigate client files, to ensure the sanctions risk(s) relating to a specific sanctioned country are addressed. You directly mitigate RBC’s exposure to regulatory, legal, reputational and financial risks, and thoroughly review and accurately assess incidents in a fast paced and high pressure environment. Please note that your time allocation will be agile, based on operational requirements within the Global Economic Sanctions Investigation Team from week to week.


What will you do?


Mitigate RBC’s regulatory, legal, reputational, and financial risks by investigating clients that 1) may have been identified as Cuban Nationals and/or reside in a sanctioned country; and 2) may have a connection to a sanctioned country, individual and/or entity

Maintain an in-depth knowledge of Canadian, US, UK and EU sanctions regulations and stay abreast of changes to sanctions regulations

Day-to-day management of the country and investigation scanning queues in the Global Case Management (GCM) system

Assess potential sanctions risk(s), ensuring that clients are not engaging in prohibited activities through RBC accounts

Maintain accurate documentation of investigations and assessments of sanctions regulations per established procedures, including obtaining additional information from key stakeholders and clients and drafting Certification Letters

Act as a point of escalation to internal partners that require guidance/direction, including in the absence of the Senior Manager, Global Economic Sanctions Investigations

Identify clients who pose unacceptable sanctions risk(s) to RBC and engage the Senior Management in Global Economic Sanctions for further guidance

Provide support where required during vacations and on an exceptional basis to the Global Economic Sanctions Advisory Team, who provides advisory support on economic sanctions risks related to clients booked in RBC’s Wealth Management, Capital Markets, and Investor & Treasury Services units.



What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


4+ years of direct Financial Industry Compliance or legal experience, ideally including prior sanctions experience at a Canadian Financial Institution

Ability to review, understand, and apply complex regulations (critical thinking skills)

Highly developed organizational and time management skills with an ability to be agile to shifting priorities

Experience excelling in a fast paced, high pressure environment

Experience demonstrating strong written and oral communication skills

Undergraduate Bachelor’s Degree



Nice-to-have


ACAMS or ACSS Certification

Legal experience an asset

Proficient knowledge of US, EU, UK and Canadian sanctions regulations

Canadian Securities Course or equivalent is an asset



What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits

Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

VinFast is Vietnam’s leading manufacturer of premium automobiles and has achieved its initial goal of being #1 in all competing segments of domestic car retail in less than 2 years. VinFast Auto Canada Inc. an OEM distribution company with a Direct-to-Consumer business model, has an ambitious growth strategy planning rapid retail and aftersales facility expansion in Canada over the next 12 months. job_description:
Accounts Payable Specialist - Onsite



Accounts Payable


Codes, post, and review all vendor invoices, debit notes/credit notes, employees’ expenses into the system

Review, code, and post vendor invoices related to freight-out/in (ERB), domestic, imported cheese PO’S (Except EU and Domestic Cheese)

Downloads ERB Transport’s and other freight company’s invoices and other supporting documents from their website to support freight billings and matches with corresponding invoices.

Determines invoices for payments through AP aging report

Process all payments by cheques and ACH and Wire payments on all currencies

Send out payment details to vendors

Determines what bills are to be paid through the bank and which cheques are for pick up

Makes sure all government payments are settled on time (federal/provincial taxes, non-resident taxes, etc.)

Settles vendor’s inquiries and disputes

Reconciles vendor’s statements with vendor’s sub-ledger

Reconciles Estimated/Actual Cost Report vs. GL balance of Acct 2045

Runs monthly AP Aging Reports and reconciles with GL

Prepares USD requirements and schedule

Processes company’s credit application with vendors

Reconciles cheques daily to generate an outstanding cheque list.

Adjusts variances between estimated and actual cost.

Copies and files vendors’ invoices in their respective PO folders

Reconcile, process and replenish petty cash

Matches posted & approved invoices with cheques/ACH payment advise ready for signature

Stamps cheque stubs “PAID” and indicate the date cheques were mailed.

Stuffs envelopes with cheques and mails them

Prepares and post expenses accrual for the moth end/year end purpose

Files vendor’s invoices in respective vendor’s folders




General Accounting


Prepares expenses accrual and schedule

Copies and files vendors’ invoices in their respective PO folders

Adjusts FX US/Euro funds/payables using month-end rate and prepares journal entries

Post monthly recurring entries




Others


Prepares Bank Reconciliation when the accounting assistant is not available.

Backs up for daily bank deposits and bank errands when person in-charge is not available.

Assists as phone back up when primary and secondary persons are busy or not available

Backs up for some of accounting clerk functions when person is not available

Performs other functions which may be requested by the Senior Accountant and Finance Manager from time to time

Assists in the preparation of month-end and year-end schedules as requested by the Senior Accountant.

Assist during audit

Other accounting duties as requested by the Finance Manager




QUALIFICATIONS:


Completed advanced diploma in Accounting; Graduated /graduating with a degree in business specializing in Accounting preferred.

At least 5 years accounting experience, of which 4 years is in Accounts Payable

Has the ability to multi-task and should be detail-oriented

Has strong Microsoft Office skills and has operated an accounting software

Has potential to grow and assume a more responsible position in accounting in the future .

With pleasant voice and phone manners

Strong in oral and written communications

Valid driver’s license and a vehicle preferred
