Position Summary:
The Accounting Supervisor reports to the Controller and oversees part of the transactional Accounting team in a Corporate office. This position requires strong leadership skills along with accounting expertise and the ability to monitor the work of a fast-paced, deadline-driven finance team. The Supervisor oversees the coaching and counseling of department associates and ensures a high quality, productive work environment. Must be able to interact with senior company management and internal customers in a productive and professional manner.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
include the following.

· Oversees and supports the day to day operations of the transactional Accounting team servicing multiple business units.

· Supervises and supports the development of the transactional accounting team through quarterly goals setting for each team member and align said goals with departmental and company annual plans.

· Completes quarterly performance reviews; coaches; disciplines as need be; provides ongoing training/retraining; and monitors the work performance of each team member to ensure they are prepared to meet or exceed the standards for their position.

· Professionally addresses issues with employees and assists in the resolution of personnel issues.

· Completes the compilation and analysis of the full set of accounting statements, including cash flow statements, reconciling of balance sheet accounts, and maintenance of fixed asset sub-ledgers.

· Manages and reports daily cash and prepares cash forecast, monitors collection activities.

· Prepares annual budgets in collaboration with Operations and consolidates the departmental budget into one.

· Supports the annual accounting audit and preparation of the required paperwork.

· Processes HST filing, making sure input tax credits are calculated and claimed according to Legislative requirements.

· Oversees the billing of major cost-plus customers, completes final review of all supporting documents and prepares period end reports.

· Journalizes payroll registers in the general ledger, makes payroll remittances, and uploads payroll direct deposits to the bank.

· Participates in accounting projects, working closely with the Controller.

· Responsible for maintaining an accurate filing system for all accounting documents.

· Maintains a high degree of visibility and access to and builds strong professional working relationships with Operations.

· Designs and monitors the internal control environment the Controller. Ensures compliance with established Finance policies and procedures not only by the team members but also by internal customers.

· Builds a healthy working atmosphere where teamwork, communication, and a strong focus on professionalism are expected.

· Contributes to a healthy LEGACY cultural environment, based on LEGACY core values.

· Assists in other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

· Two to three years leadership and accounting responsibilities in a similar role

· Organizational, prioritization, and time management skills

· Confident individual who has a desire to develop and grow

· A demonstrated ability in developing strong relationships and team spirit, ensuring the team functions well

· Sound judgment and ability to maintain data integrity and accuracy

· Proven success in maintaining quality, service and working relationships in a high-paced, deadline driven setting

· Working knowledge of all aspects of the accounting cycle, up to reporting according to GAAP and Financial Reporting Techniques in both Canada and the US

· Possess strong assessment and decision-making skills; proven ability to influence and build relationships, both within the organization and with external sources

· Knowledge of Canadian CRA and US Internal Revenue Service Codes related to financial management and tax planning

· Knowledge of both Canadian and American federal, provincial and state laws and regulations related to financial management

· Actively promote and live LEGACY values

Job Summary:


The Securities Lending & Collateral Management (“SL&CM”) group is responsible for all collateral management functions across trading programs along with the maintenance of all securities lending activity on behalf of HOOPP. Collateral management is an essential function as HOOPP would be unable to implement desired investment strategies without depositing collateral with approved counterparties in accordance with industry standards and agreements. The group is responsible for ensuring all HOOPP assets are tracked and accounted for with approximately $40 billion of assets lodged across 120+ counterparties.


The Analyst, Securities Lending & Collateral Management must possess a strong knowledge of all investment products and strategies employed by HOOPP’s Investment Management team as well as a general understanding of functions outside of the department such as accounting, risk, valuation and performance in order to understand and validate the impact of Securities Lending and Collateral Management functions on downstream processes.


What you will do:



Share the responsibility with the SL&CM team in monitoring daily margin requirements for all active counterparties for Cleared and Uncleared Derivatives, Securities Lending, Repo and Futures activities. This includes issuing and answering margin calls to mitigate exposure risks. This may require further investigation and research in resolving any exposure discrepancies.


Actively monitor available securities to ensure collateral is called back when securities are sold throughout the day. This includes working closely with front office to ensure appropriate actions takes place to facilitate timely settlement.


Process cash and non-cash collateral and securities lending activities daily within prescribed time frames and ensure new and amended trades are communicated to HOOPP’s settlements team and the custodian throughout the day.


Ensure collateral and securities lending positions are recorded accurately in our investment book of record, this may include correcting positions and rebook trades accordingly when needed. Perform daily position reconciliations between external parties and HOOPP.


Prepare and issue securities lending invoices to counterparties and ensure all monthly fees and revenue are reconciled, collected, and paid on time.


Ensure any corporate actions related to securities received or deposited are processed and validated with external brokers for both collateral and securities lending positions.


Assist with the accurate and timely completion of important internal controls, specifically an intense monthly collateral reconciliation report.


Monitor all securities on deposit as collateral for proxy voting purposes. Proxy voting is a requirement of investment management at the direction of the board. Ensuring securities are called back prior to record date is the responsibility of the Analyst to ensure compliance with the policy.


Identify and implement process improvements where necessary to mitigate operational risk


When required, assist in the development, testing and daily maintenance of any new reporting requirements as they may arise.


Address ad hoc requests as needed in an efficient manner.



What you bring:




Minimum of 5 years’ experience in financial sector, preferably in capital markets


University degree in Business or related discipline


Completion or enrolment in a professional designation program is considered an asset (CFA, FRM, CIM).


Strong knowledge of capital market instruments including fixed income and equities gained through industry experience.


Strong knowledge of Securities Lending and Collateral management functions and related best practices


Strong knowledge of corporate actions and related market standards


Strong knowledge of derivative instruments such as swaps, FX forwards, options and futures gained through industry experience.


Strong analytical and problem solving skills


Attention to detail, accuracy, and completeness is very important


Ability to multitask efficiently while managing high volumes of work and meeting tight deadlines


Ability to work independently with minimal direction.


Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills


Willing to assume other responsibilities as required


Strong technical skills with advanced Excel skills, and programming knowledge would be an asset

hi, accounting assistant is needed asap, previous experience in book keeping, bank reconciliation, account receivables and payables, HST filing, must be attention to detail and intermediate level in excel.

Masonite is growing our Global Trade and Customs Team. The Global Trade and Customs Team is responsible for Masonite's trade policies, procedures, systems, special programs (supply chain security, Lacey, forced labor), broker/forwarder management and duty reduction programs.


Currently, we are looking for an import/export specialist to manage our operational trade activity in Canada. Our ideal candidate would be a skilled communicator who has experience delivering efficient and compliant trade activity in a manufacturing setting. This role is the primary face to the business in country and will work closely with other functions and departments within the organization such as Logistics, Sales, Sourcing, Finance, Engineering, Quality, Manufacturing and Legal to ensure reasonable care. This role will report to the Director, Global Trade and Customs


Duties & Responsibilities


Broker instruction, KPIs and management as well as broker invoice audit and approvals

Post entry and post exit reviews (systematic and manual shipment review)

Transactional support for CA imports and exports as well as primary trade contact for internal and external key stakeholders related to these transactions

Record keeping (standard and First Sale transactions)

Support the Trade Master Data team in the finalization of trade related master data applied in country

Project ideation and management (lane optimization, broker/forwarder optimization)

3rd party risk solicitation, assessment and corrective actions (forced labor/supply security)

Annual reconciliation support (gather facts from finance/tax, determine reconciliation needs, work with broker to complete, create book of evidence)

Develop appropriate documentation, training modules, and job aids to deliver training and instruction to internal and external parties involved with or affected by Customs and Trade issues.

In-depth review of complex legal regulatory documents to successfully address and respond to questions or issues identified by internal and external parties.

Complete special projects as needed including preparations of executive level presentations

Participate in the development and publishing of internal and external manuals related to import and export requirements.

Agency Engagement

Travel as needed (<10%)



Qualifications/Requirements


Bachelor’s Degree in related field of study or equivalent professional experience

Canadian Customs Broker License accreditation (“CSCB”) and/or Certified Customs Specialist designation (“CCS”), and prior hands-on experience in import operations (5-10 years).

BS / BA degree, or College Diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience.

High level of experience with free trade agreement programs such as NAFTA, Chile-Canada, and Korea-Canada agreements.

Thorough knowledge of the Canada Customs Act, and comprehensive understanding of regulations and procedures regarding CBSA clearance.

Experience dealing directly with CBSA, CFIA, Revenue Canada, and other Canadian government regulatory agency personnel.

Self-starter with the ability to manage several projects simultaneously and prioritize accordingly.

Knowledge of Special Import Measures Act (SIMA) governing Antidumping/Countervailing orders and investigations.

Solid understanding of all modes of transportation and traffic function

Proficiency in various MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).

Excellent inter-personal and communication skills

Strong trade fundamentals (classification (HTS/ECCN), country of origin, valuation, and free trade agreements

Strong analytical skills with regards to financial analysis, data manipulation, and the ability to create actionable information from data

Proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Visio

Ability to communicate clearly to technical and non-technical audiences

Capable of creating written reports, proposals, processes, and project documentation

Ability to deliver high quality results

Experience with Supply Chain Security programs such as Canada's Partners in Protection Program, US C-TPAT or European AEO is highly desired for this position.

Proficiency with French language considered helpful.

Job Description

Operations Representative - New Issues & Crpyto


This role is designated as "Hybrid" as part of Fidelity's Dynamic Working arrangement


Based in Toronto, Fidelity Clearing Canada (FCC) is the leading independent clearing broker and custodian in the Canadian market. We provide trade execution, clearing, custody and back-office support services to Canadian-based brokerage firms and registered Portfolio Managers. For more information about Fidelity Clearing Canada, please visit
https://clearingcanada.fidelity.com/
.


Business Overview:


The FCC settlements department ensures timely settlement and reporting of all trades processed through our books and records. The department as a whole is responsible for managing the settlement process of, CAD and USD trades through the main depositories, CDS and DTC, as well as international trade settlement through our foreign custodian and physical securities processing and handling.


The Opportunity:


Reporting to the Manager, Foreign Settlements, the Operations Representative - New Issues & Crypto is responsible for assisting FCC Client’s Syndication teams with the settlement of various new issue closings, which can be settled either electronically (via systems including the Canadian Depository for Securities (CDS), or the Depository Trust Company (DTC); or physically with certificated securities.


Settlements involves the delivery of securities and the corresponding payment. Securities are delivered against payment of money to fulfill contractual obligations, such as those arising under securities traders. The Operations Representative - New Issues & Crypto communicates with Fidelity Clearing Canada internal partners, our clients and counterparties. By working with these key stakeholders, we achieve accurate and timely processing while mitigating risk to all involved.


Key Accountabilities:



Compare and match trades that are posted in Dataphile vs. what appears in CDS and DTC.

Ensure that securities received as part of a new issue closing are properly segregated to settle pending trades for the new issue only.

Communicate with clients, counter parties and other FCC teams.

Inquire with counterparties as to the reason behind trades which are either unconfirmed or DK'd (Don't Know).

Respond timely to verbal or written client requests.

Settlement of new issue trades involving physical certificated positions.

Create and distribute reports to clients and management.



Experience and Education:



More than 1 year of related experience within settlements in the financial services industry

Experience working with physical securities.

Completion of post-secondary education, or equivalent experience



Skills and Knowledge:



Excellent MS Excel skills and proficient with the MS Office environment.

Strong customer service skills, with ability to build credibility and rapport to gain customer confidence.

Exceptional communication skills.

Comfortable to thrive in a fast paced, challenging, team-oriented environment.

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Job Description




Reporting to the Director, Investment Operations, the Manager, Pension Investment Technology designs and maintains the in-house IT structure of Pension Investment. The Manager determines needs and implements IT applications and innovative technology solutions to support the Pension Investment team. Leveraging IT and finance expertise and experience, the Manager solves long-standing issues with both interim, short-term solutions ensuring no interruptions to workflow, and permanent, long-term resolutions. The Manager provides flexible IT support as the Pension Investment team grows, technology needs change, and new needs arise, overhauling and implementing new applications to support investment work. The Manager implements IT governance and compliance to ensure best practices are followed.






Job Responsibilities




Below are the main job requirements and responsibilities for the Manager, Pension Investment Technology:



Leads the development and maintenance of IT operations and infrastructure for the Pension Investment team to support the unique trading and investment needs of the Front Office trading desks, Operations, risk teams, and all other Pension Plan users.




Drives and promotes new processes, systems, technology, and operations, and expanded capabilities for performance, with the flexibility to align to the unique requirements of the project teams. Integrates applications to ensure the best solution for the end user.





Proactively address challenges and long-standing issues through investigating incidents, understanding user needs, analysing problems, and determining short-term solutions so service remains uninterrupted. Leads research, testing, and analysis to identify themes and determine the best permanent solution to resolve the issue, long-term.





Consults with Director and peers to gather information, explore gaps in current services, gain new perspectives, consider best practices, and explore new strategies. Collaborates with senior level management to communicate needs and findings, negotiate business cases, and to influence the best courses of action.





Oversees vendor management for the design and implementation of IT infrastructures and networks. Approves designs of new installation or changes to current installation, submitted by IT providers, and collaborates with the providers during the implementation stage. Regularly assesses vendor services to determine what services are required to meet the needs of the Pension Investment team, and what services can be discontinued to control related costs.








Job Responsibilities (continued)




Coordinates multiple external groups to manage equipment, security and firewall issues, application purchases and support, and leverage findings from external IT consultants.




Acts as the contact for escalated IT support issues, including non-routine situations, identifying and coordinating the appropriate solution.





Implements IT governance and compliance to ensure rules and best practices are being followed. Minimizes risk to the Pension Investment team through increased automation.





Develops and executes technical roadmaps to ensure business continuity. Drives longer term planning, architecture, and design, for IT operations and infrastructure development.





Networks with industry professionals from external pension plan groups to remain up to date on industry trends and maintain a network of other IT professionals.








Qualifications




Education



Completed post-secondary, preferably in computer science or related subject OR a combination of equivalent professional experience and training




Experience



3 to 5 years of relevant functional in a finance environment, including experience with needs assessment, solution design, implementation, and ongoing support/evolution





1 to 3 years of experience working with high-profile clients





2 or more years’ experience managing people




Other Candidate Requirements



IT generalist knowledge of systems and programs





In-depth knowledge of general finance and pension investment applications, capital markets, and trading environment





Excellent team building and leadership skills and experience





Exemplary communication and coordination skills





Excellent decision maker who can quickly assess a situation and make the appropriate choice





Knowledge in Back Office processes, Trading, Clearing and Financial Markets is required (e.g., Bloomberg)

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


In EY Tax, you’ll have the opportunity to help the world’s leading multinational organizations meet complex tax obligations around the world. You’ll get a unique glimpse deep inside a company’s business and become a trusted advisor, working collaboratively on a team that influences major business decisions. Demand has made this a rapidly growing area, and the relationships we build here translate into big business in other areas, making this a true priority. You won’t find a tax culture like this anywhere else, so whether you’re looking for a long-term role in personal tax compliance, or are interested in progressing on to other areas, this is a great place to be.


The opportunity


As a Tax Technician, you'll be part of EY`s Global Compliance & Reporting practice, we are currently seeking Tax Technician in our Toronto office location. This position offers excellent opportunities for learning to the right candidate. We are seeking full-time candidates who can fulfill the following responsibilities and qualifications.

Your key responsibilities


As a Tax Technician, you'll work with the team to manage administrative tasks. In addition, you'll:

Prepare supporting documents and working papers

Collate and e-file submissions of tax returns

Develop direct contacts with clients, acting as a liaison between client contacts and internal teams

Provide clients with quality, timely and responsive services and work products


Skills and attributes for success


The ability to effectively manage multiple tasks in a fast paced and high volume environment with keen attention to client needs

The ability to coordinate and manage a large team of staff to meet target due dates

The ability to manage time spent against budget, and work alongside team members to ensure the timely completion of work deliverables

The ability to be proactive, use own initiative, and work independently, as well as part of the team

The ability to demonstrate sound judgment regarding confidential and sensitive matters

The ability to adapt quickly to changes and propose solutions as needed

Excellent organization skills and attention to detail

Good communication skills



To qualify for the role you must have


College diploma in accounting, finance or tax, or equivalent

Previous related tax experience would be an asset

Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools

The flexibility to work additional hours


Ideally, you’ll also have


Fluent in written and verbal English

A commitment to learning and using our tax technology and processes


What we look for

We’re interested in strong team players who support their colleagues in reaching their goals while also considering their own workload and development. We’re looking for people with a genuine passion for tax, and the future of tax, and are inspired to help the world’s leading multinational organizations meet complex tax obligations around the world. If you have the confidence to speak up and influence a team that affects big businesses worldwide, this role is for you.


What we offer

At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:


Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry

Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career

The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you



Diversity and Inclusion at EY


Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.


EY Way of Work and your health and safety


EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.


EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

ACCOUNTABILITIES


Role Responsibilities


Responsible for investigating, resolving and escalating collateral disputes that exceed internal tolerance levels or regulatory thresholds in accordance with established dispute resolution procedures. This activity includes reconciling portfolio valuation differences with the Bank’s counterparties and providing detailed analysis of the cause of a dispute to appropriate areas in accordance with established procedures.

Responsible for pro-active reconciliation. This activity includes working with Valuation Product Control (VPC) in investigating and reconciling portfolio mark-to-market (MtM) differences with identified counterparties and escalating differences in accordance with established procedures.

With assistance from VPC, follow through and complete investigations for trades that have been identified as having valuation differences that have breached prescribed tolerance levels, as set out in the Bank’s Policies and Procedures (P&Ps) as well as in the Capital Markets Financing Guideline (CFMG) for OTC Derivatives and Repo/ Reverse Repo Financing Guideline.

Reconcile collateral positions in the Calypso collateral management database against BMO’s book-of-record systems such as ICI and IBUK to ensure accuracy.

Analyze and produce collateral management reports for key client groups on a daily, weekly, monthly and on ad hoc basis.

Understand regulatory compliance in regards to Dodd Frank Act (DFA) and Europe Market Infrastructure Regulation (EMIR)

Understand regulatory and compliance requirements as prescribed for CMG, such as Financing Guidelines and the Bank’s Policies and Procedures, and provide recommendations and implement actions to ensure adherence, as required.

Adhere to project industry standards, best practices and requirements and ensure they are followed and assessed against current practices and policies.

Mitigate audit exposures and maintain awareness of regulatory impacts of change initiatives.

Review policy and procedure (P&P) updates for potential impacts that require assessment of changes introduced. This includes CMG operating procedures, the Bank’s P&Ps and Financing Guidelines.



Risk & Control


Identify potential risk situations within the scope of work (e.g., risk assessments), make recommendations and/or escalate to the manager, where appropriate, and ensure contingency plans exist.

Understand risks inherent in area(s) of expertise and take appropriate actions, including accuracy and safeguarding of all documentation and any other requirements to ensure operational integrity is maintained within the business.

Follow security and safeguarding procedures as outlined in CMG procedures, the Bank’s P&Ps and in Financing Guidelines, and apply appropriate due diligence in accordance with Bank policy for the prevention of loss due to such things as fraud or defalcation.

Contribute to the management of risk and minimize losses through monitoring and controlling various reports and taking appropriate action, ensuring compliance requirements, audits and verifications are completed in accordance with Bank P&Ps, e.g. Financing Guidelines and BMO Portfolio Reconciliation Policies and Procedures.



Reconciliation Operations


Represent CMG Reconciliation Team during change impact analysis and business requirements gathering, implementation planning and support, and issue escalation. This may include working with relevant stakeholders to ensure policies and procedures are followed to meet regulatory compliance.

Provide assistance to review new and/or revised CMG Reconciliation Team projects and initiatives, and liaise with other business units such as VPC, back office, Line of Business (LOB), Regulatory Transformation Office (RTO),, Credit Risk, and the Derivatives Legal Group (DLG) and external systems providers to ensure business interests are represented and understood.

Review, assess and recommend business readiness situations for new product introductions and feasibility of internal and external systems.

Provide coaching and cross training to other staff from time to time.

May coordinate and/or implement test plans, test cases, training strategy development, training plans, parallel test strategy and plans, test documentation/ test specifications.

Assist in partnering with Calypso Technology to ensure system application design specifications developed by Calypso Technology meet the business unit expectations/ requirements, and participate in the negotiation of solutions. This includes defining and documenting user requirements, partnering with project teams as needed, to create manuals, training material/or job aids.



Product & Process Management

This role may also have specific functional accountability, or area of specialization, in process management:


Act as SME to translate business objectives into plans that can be implemented for small initiatives, including process redesign to compliment the change management/ product support strategy for CMG Reconciliation Team, adhering to and maintaining established standards and practices; represent technical business needs and requirements in the introduction of new/ revised processes and systems.

Identify any process or systems related issues or opportunities for improvement that may exist in CMG and provide solutions to meet these challenges and initiatives, where necessary.

Act as one of the central point of contact for problem escalation from CMG Ops team and other relevant areas.

Participate in external and internal audits, as required.



Business Performance Management


Coordinate the issuance and tracking of issues and/or reconciliation logs and system and process enhancements raised with internal and external system providers.

Support the delivery of exceptional counterparty service that builds trust through responsive, accurate, consistent, knowledgeable and available services and support.

Align individual performance goals to team and organizational goals.

Demonstrate behaviours that are consistent with “Being BMO” model and aligned with BMO values.



CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS

Internal:


Partner with managers from internal and external departments for the delivery of key accountabilities

Business stakeholders, (i.e. Front Office, Relationship Manager)

Valuation Product Control (VPC)

Back-office

Portfolio Management (PM) and Credit Risk

Derivatives Legal Group (DLG)

Technology functions (i.e. Calypso Technology, EI)

Internal business partners such as CMG Ops to consult / advise / service in the delivery of key accountabilities


External:


Suppliers and service providers, i.e. TriOptima, IBM Algo, Calypso

Regulators, auditors and counterparties



SCOPE AND IMPACT

This job has direct or indirect impact on the following:


Mitigation of credit risk that can potentially amount to large financial losses that may also result in regulatory penalties.

Mitigation of potential fraud and operational risks by other departments that can potentially amount to large financial losses and other penalties imposed by regulators.

Bank business and financial performance by ensuring that changes and solutions are cost-effective, timely and efficient.

Bank financial performance by responding on a timely basis to changing operating conditions so as to mitigate financial penalties and costs.

Mitigation of costs / impacts associated with human errors by supporting the proper coaching and training of others.



KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

Knowledge:


University degree (e.g. Bachelor of Arts - preference for Math or Science)

3 to 5 years of related work experience

Industry related training is preferred

Good knowledge of OTC derivatives and swaps is beneficial but not required

Experience with collateral management processes is beneficial but not required

Familiar with established process analysis and improvement tools is an asset, i.e. Algo collateral system / Calypso collateral management database

Experience with OTC derivatives products, operations and market practices as relates to collateral management is an asset

Strong or advanced level of knowledge in MS Excel (macros, Vlookup function, VBA etc.) and MS Access is required.



Skills:


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with ability to analyze a component or components of a process to optimize system functionality

Strong decision-making skills

Persistence and flexibility for resolving ambiguities

Strong prioritization skills

Strong customer service and relationship management skills

Strong conflict management/ resolution skills

Strong teamwork and team leadership skills

Strong written and oral communication skills, with the capability to present and articulate complex concepts

Strong multitasking skills covering a wide range of challenges which are independent and distinct

Ability to translate business requirements into system solutions according to Bank standards

Ability to document requirements, acceptance test plans, conversion and implementation plans

Ability to support CMG during business recovery situations



WORKING CONDITIONS

This job operates within normal office conditions with minimal exposure to health and safety risks. There may be a requirement to periodically work extra hours and/or weekends as dictated by the business.

May be required to work on statutory holidays and within differing time zones as dictated by the business.

Resolver operates as a hybrid workforce with the option to work at home, in the office, or a mix of both.

As a
Revenue Operations (Rev Ops) Analyst
, you will play an essential role in ensuring Resolver’s Sales team can meet their revenue goals. You will compile and analyze a variety of sales and market data as well as provide valuable feedback and actionable insights to help Resolver sell more effectively.

If you have a deep understanding of Tableau, enjoy analyzing and modelling data, AND have experience within a B2B sales function, this could be the opportunity for you!

About Resolver:

Resolver is a high-growth SaaS company whose intuitive, no-code platform gives our customers a clear picture of their risks so they can make quick and effective decisions. The global pandemic has certainly taught us that the ability to manage uncertainty is the challenge of our generation. At Resolver we are transforming risk management to risk intelligence so organizations can protect people and assets and deliver on their purpose.

We are ambitious in both our mission and our culture. As a scale-up, we have the innovative, non-hierarchical approach of a start-up blended with the stability and financial security of an enterprise. Resolver has also been named one of Canada’s Great Places to Work five years in a row!

So, what does that really mean for you? Let the hiring manager tell you:

Hi, I’m Lisa, Director of Sales Enablement and Operations.

The role of the Revenue Operations (Rev Ops) team is to support Resolver’s impressive growth by ensuring that the Sales team has everything they need to need to do their job; efficient processes, well designed systems, useful data, and accurate reporting. As the Rev Ops Analyst, you will support this by working with the Sales leaders to analyze sales data, past and present, identifying trends and providing insights and recommendations to improve future sales.

Is “how can I help” your mantra? Does digging through data to find patterns and anomalies bring a smile to your face? Is using data to solve problems, increase efficiency and drive results your idea of a great day? If you answered yes to these questions than this may just be the perfect opportunity for you!


Your Day to Day – let’s break it down!

Data Analysis (40%)


Measures of Success:
Data from vari
ous sources are analyzed, compared
and trends and patterns are identified


Review and analyze data, both past and present, across multiple sales tools

Create detailed business analysis that outline opportunities for improvement and supporting solutions

Act as a data resource to Sales Leaders (you'll work super closely with our VP of Sales) as they look to design business processes, best practices, and metrics across the sales organization

Responsible for creating new and improving existing business models and processes that support strategic business decisions

Explain trends across data sources, potential opportunities for growth or improvement, and data caveats

Understand and document the full lifecycle of data and our common data framework so that data can be integrated, modeled for easy analysis, and analyzed for insights


Data Modelling (40%)


Measures of Success:
Sales leaders feel confident in the data displayed and can use it to make business decisions that drive the sales team forward


Create data models that are accurate, easy to use, understandable and scalable

Use previous sales data and market trends to develop forecasts and projection

Understand the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) of the sales team and use data modelling to ensure we are meeting those KPIs in an efficient manner

Model data to both confirm and challenge suggested changes made inside the sales organization as it relates to processes, compensation, budget etc.

Collaborate with sales leaders to build customized reports and dashboards using data to tell a story

Work with business leaders and team members to understand business processes and go forward strategies with strategic vision of how reporting and dashboards can support initiatives


Presentations and Reporting (20%)


Measures of Success:
The larger organization has insight into the sales team KPI achievement and how we measure success
Prepare reports and presentations for executives and other company leaders including:


Data on sales trends, KPI’s and market performance,

Advice on increasing revenue and eliminating weaknesses within the sales ecosystem


People who Excel (Your Background):


Previous data analysis experience is a must, so is proven experience supporting a sales team

Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and tasks

Possesses financial acumen and understand the KPIs of growing a successful sales organization

Proven ability to elicit and confirm requirements from stakeholders

Highly organized and demonstrate strong attention to detail, ensuring tasks are completed thoroughly and accurately

Ambitious and uses initiative to look for ways to contribute to the overall success of the sales team

Love solving problems with data and can identify patterns and diagnose root causes

Naturally curious; asks lots of questions with a goal to better understand others, their point of view and to learn from them


What we’ll give you in return:

Resolver is one of Canada's Great Workplaces. Culture isn't just something we write about (although we do), we live our values and challenge each other to be our best selves. We invest in Resolverites who will grow with us. Here’s how we do it:


Health and Wellness Benefits:
100% paid by us for health and dental from day one. And our vision care is every 12 months! We also offer a wellness/fitness reimbursement, that can go towards things like gym memberships, yoga classes, soccer membership fees or a bike.

Professional development:
we have an external learning budget to help you grow and develop. We host a learning workshop about every 6 weeks on topics like Time Management, Self-Awareness and Giving Feedback; we also have e-learning to meet the needs of our remote team. We offer a Career Development Program to help you identify and build your skillsets for internal growth opportunities and beyond. We also have a Coaching Program for all our managers. We know how important it is to have a good boss, so we invest in their development.

Vacation:
it's open, which means we don't worry about an accrual clock. On average, we see most folks enjoying between 3-4 weeks off a year.

Parental leave:
Best-in-class top-up for new parents - 100% for 15 weeks new parents and 5 additional weeks of pregnancy leave for birth mothers.

Flexibility & trust –
While we are remote for now, we enable our team to create a work environment that will set them up for success. We hire adults and we trust you to manage your outcomes. Day-to-day, everyone is given the option to decide whether they want to work remote or in-office depending on the needs of their role.

Back in the Office
– If you choose to come into the office once we’re back, you will have access to snacks and beverages and in-office games like Switch, chess and ping-pong. We will be offering up lots of opportunity for team socials too, including the folks who are remote!


Interested?

If you want to work in a highly collaborative environment and are committed to making a difference, click here to get the process rolling.

We truly appreciate all interest and will happily reply to qualified candidates.

About TRCA:

With more than 60 years of experience, Toronto and Region Conservation Authority (TRCA) is one of 36 Conservation Authorities in Ontario, created to safeguard and enhance the health and well-being of watershed communities through the protection and restoration of the natural environment and the ecological services the environment provides.

TRCA works to protect the integrity and health of the rivers and creeks in the jurisdiction, develop a system of green and natural spaces that sustains local ecosystems, and advance sustainable practices that improve people’s lives within our growing region.


How you will contribute as part of the TRCA team:



Post and maintain control over unapproved invoices.

Create vendor profile in accounting software for new vendors and maintain existing vendor information, ensure validity of billing vendor information including confirmation of valid HST registration number with online CRA site.

Create payment requisition for invoices from purchase order.

Ensure supplier invoices are scanned in PDF format and filed in electronic folders.

Route invoices for coding and/or approval

Receive approved invoices and verify authorization.

Quality Assurance/Quality Control on all general ledger codes

Match vendor payment vouchers with electronic source documents

Save accounting software generated cheque images to electronic network folder.

Process petty cash claims from locations (approx. 6 per year), review appropriateness account of codes and that all authorizations are in place.

Process utility billings for all locations (approx. 22 locations), review bills, code and submit for approval.


What will you need to succeed:

Education (degree/diploma/certifications)


2-3-year Post Secondary in Business or Commerce

Experience


1-2 years of experience

Knowledge/Skill/Ability


Knowledge of financial systems, management controls, processes and tools

Compliance with internal and external regulations regarding transactional services

Strong attention to detail

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Compliance with regulations regarding transactional services

Proven time management skills

Computer literacy


What TRCA has to offer you:

As part of a progressive team you will have the opportunity to make a positive impact to preserving and protecting nature, while maintaining a balance between the natural environment and built environment. Working with experts within our field, you will join a team of colleagues that are committed to TRCA’s core values of integrity, collaboration, accountability, respect, and excellence (icare).


You will be part of a diverse and inclusive organization that:



Makes a positive difference in the communities we serve.

Fosters high performance and collaborative teams.

Provides continuous learning and development opportunities.

Offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits program (including Defined Benefit Pension Plan – OMERS/OTPP).

Pregnancy & Parental Leave Top-Up Program.

Provides unique TRCA Perks.

Provides flexible work arrangements.

Offers potential for career growth and advancement.

To apply to this posting, click on the “Apply” icon. Please submit your resume and cover letter prior to midnight on February 24, 2023.

While the Toronto and Region Conservation Authority (TRCA) thanks all applicants for their interest, only those under consideration will be contacted for interviews. Please be advised that successful incumbent(s) may be required to undergo a vulnerable sector screening and/or driver’s abstract check as a part of the final step in the hiring process.

TRCA is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace. Department Overview

The TD Wealth Compliance Department provides compliance advisory and second line oversight of TD Wealth businesses, including: TD Waterhouse Canada (an IIROC registrant that includes Private Investment Advice, Financial Planning, and Direct Investing), Private Investment Counsel (an OSC registrant), TD Asset Management (an OSC registrant), TD Investment Services (an MFDA registrant), Private Trust, and Private Banking. Key functions within the unit include the Chief Compliance Officers and their teams for each business line, Surveillance, Regulatory Investigations & Client Complaint Resolution, Regulatory Change Management, and registrations. A multi-disciplinary team of compliance professionals supports these activities. Given the range of businesses supported, and the breadth of applicable regulations, the day-to-day work of the group is both interesting and complex, requiring compliance and wealth management subject matter expertise. The team has an immediate need for a Senior Manager, Regulatory Change Management to lead key regulatory change initiatives for the TD Wealth businesses.



Job Description

Reporting to the VP, Compliance, Global Wealth & Insurance, the AVP will lead in the execution of the TD Wealth Compliance regulatory change management strategy & delivery.

With 1st Line Business – provide guidance and challenge to the 1st line's ongoing development of regulatory compliance and conduct risk management program and culture to strengthen its ability to detect and mitigate compliance risk across all Wealth businesses

With Legal and Risk Management– provide trusted, objective advice to help the business manage regulatory change and address regulatory risks. Provide practical guidance on business and operational elements, based on depth of expertise, to assist in arriving at actionable solutions

With HR – coordination with respect to training, investigations, and disciplinary matters

Lead relationships with regulators and industry associations to support business priorities

With Compliance executive members, support, lead, set the Compliance culture, people development and training


Accountabilities adhere to the TD Compliance Department Mandate, follow the executive mandate for the role and are executed in accordance with key Compliance Program elements and processes established in the Enterprise Regulatory Compliance Management (RCM) Framework. These include:

Lead TD' strategic engagement and relationship management with Wealth and non-Wealth regulators with support from the CCOs for TDW, PIC and TDAM, and industry associations on regulatory changes, trends, emerging risks, and business priorities.

Oversee, and manage regulatory risk across Wealth business lines by providing executive ownership of Compliance assessments of Wealth's risk management environment as well as Wealth Self-assessment and Compliance's policy development & maintenance to ensure adherence and alignment to Enterprise standards as well as timely, effective, and efficient issues identification, management reporting to ACoB, ERMC, Wealth Risk Committee and Wealth and Compliance business leaders

Responsible for Wealth Compliance's conduct risk oversight program, providing trusted, independent, and objective guidance and challenge to the business lines and WSS on identifying and managing compliance and conduct risk and industry best practices

Provide executive leadership to drive efficiency and effectiveness improvements in Wealth Compliance by accelerating technology enablement, business process improvement and the use of collaboration tools, enhanced data analytics, automation and machine learning to advance the Wealth Compliance programs leveraging TD expertise

Lead enhancement of the Compliance program to effectively respond to changing/increasing Compliance oversight mandate and ensure alignment with the evolving Enterprise RCM Program and Standards

As determined by CSET, provide Department Self-Assessment (CSA) annually to support the CCO Opinion which assesses effectiveness based on the degree of maturity in implementing, executing and evidencing each key element and process of the Enterprise Regulatory Compliance Management Framework

Assess the governance, procedures and reporting that support and facilitate the execution of the GCOF elements and processes and fulfillment of the TD Compliance Department's mandate

Provide trusted, independent and objective guidance and strategic insights to Wealth Group Head and other Wealth business leaders on identifying and managing various business risks with particular focus on industry trends, compliance risk and conduct risk

Act as a thought leader across Compliance in addressing significant challenges and issues

Develop and maintain robust relationships between Senior Business Management across TD.





Job Requirements


Key capabilities


Deep regulatory, industry and TD Wealth and Compliance operational knowledge

Ability to assess compliance and other risks to prioritize issues and properly balance competing risks and priorities

Strong Control/Risk Management mindset

Forward looking and able to drive and implement change

Data fluency & leveraging technology to drive productivity and effectiveness improvements

Strong people leader which facilitates the Carrying out TD's People Strategies to attract, retain, develop and engage a highly qualified team

Ability to manage large number of complex issues and priorities effectively at the same time, and juggle priorities as demands warrant.



Key leadership behaviors


Influences change both internally and externally, maintaining a strong connection to TD's vision and purpose

Model TD's shared commitments and guiding principles

Exemplifies excellent judgement and has well established credibility and trust with stakeholders (internally and externally)

Work collaboratively with others as we innovate and simplify 'how we work'

Leads both strategically and operationally, with an enterprise lens

Ability to provide actionable advice to assist the business in achieving business goals in a compliant manner while providing effective challenge to business leaders in order to meet TD Enterprise business objectives within TD's Risk Appetite.





Additional Information



University or College degree and minimum five years of relevant business, Compliance, Legal or risk management experience preferred

Law degree (JD or LLB) preferred. Relevant training and industry certifications, e.g., Canadian Securities Course, are desirable

Regulatory experience and experience in compliance or risk management programs is highly-desirable, with preference for candidates who can demonstrate development of program elements and/or implementation of regulatory change management

Demonstrated excellence in business presentation skills including verbally, in writing, and in management report generation required

Experience in retail wealth management or securities compliance is considered an asset

Experience in Project Management discipline is considered an asset.





Inclusiveness

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

S&P Market Intelligence


The Role:
Derivatives Valuation Analyst


The Team:
Portfolio Valuations

S&P Global’s Portfolio Valuations team is an independent post-trade valuation service that uses consensus data and proprietary pricing models to provide fair values for OTC derivatives and a range of liquid and illiquid securities. The service is designated to fulfill policy requirements of investors, regulators, and business managers for independent calculation of Net Asset Value, sensitivities, and risk measures. The team services over 400+ direct institutional customers around the world, including banks, hedge funds, asset managers, auditors, and fund admins, thus enhancing market transparency and reducing financial risks.


The Impact:

We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic individual with an interest in derivative pricing to be part of a team of analysts that support the daily valuation of portfolios of derivative positions.

Portfolio Valuations analysts work with clients during trials, implementation, production, and challenge processes; they also oversee various data capture and review procedures in support of the global valuation business, while working with other team members around the globe to further develop S&P’s Portfolio Valuations services.


What’s in it for you:

Client facing role and exposure to global customer base
Exposure and coordination with global team based in New York, Toronto, London, Noida, Tokyo, and Singapore
Opportunity to grow in both qualitative and quantitative skillsets amidst a growing team
Exposure to different financial derivatives products ranging all asset classes including Credit, Rates, Equity, FX, Commodity, and Structured Products


Responsibilities:

Organizing and running daily and monthly valuation processes for clients; this will require hands-on responsibility for some clients
Ensuring that data capture and cleaning processes are run, refined and automated
Handling simple and complex price challenges and resolving them to the satisfaction of the client
Building and maintaining client relationships, so that clients are aware of Portfolio Valuations’ new and existing valuation capabilities and increase their use of these services
Contributing to the design and testing of valuation systems and product enhancements


What We’re Looking For:

University Degree (minimum Bachelor) in a quantitative discipline, including but not limited to financial engineering, quantitative finance, or finance
Understanding of financial markets, knowledge of and exposure to OTC products
Proven analytical, problem-solving, and quantitative skills. Ability to work under pressure and to meet tight deadlines
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to interact professionally with clients, teams, and senior members of the organizations
Team player attitude is vital for the role. This includes giving and receiving constructive feedback, as well as proactively working together as a team to meet common goals
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Proficiency in Excel, SQL, VBA, and other programming languages advantageous


NOTE:
This role is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States.

Flexible Working
We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can.


Grade/Level ( relevant for internal applicants only ):
8

Toronto

In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan.
This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, please click here .

3+ years of technical experience in Sales Operations in a fast-paced, high-growth environment

5+ years admin experience with Salesforce and/or Hubspot

Exceptional ability to manage internal client relationships, leveraging strong consultative skills

Creative problem solver with a strong work ethic and the ability to work independently or in a fast-paced team environment

.

.

job_description:
TD Description


Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.




Department Overview


Environment, Social & Governance Credit Risk Management (ESG-CRM) under Non-Financial Risk Management (NFRM) is responsible for the identification, assessment, remediation and reporting of climate risk within TDBG's credit portfolio. The group is accountable for ensuring that the risks associated with climate change are incorporated into the broader assessment of how TD's credit products and exposures fit within TD's Risk Appetite. ESG-CRM provides strategic guidance, advice and independent challenge to support TD in achieving its climate objectives in the broader context of meeting its strategic objectives.




Job Description


Reporting to the Senior Manager, ESG-CRM, the Credit Risk Manager will support the development of portfolio level analysis and risk controls to support the effective management of climate risk within TD's Retail and Non-Retail lending portfolios across the Banks' global footprint. The successful candidate will work in a fast-paced and results-oriented environment for an emerging high-profile area of focus and will be part of a learning culture where ongoing development is encouraged.

Key accountabilities include:


Lead the day-to-day execution of ESG scenario analysis for the credit portfolio, working closely with partners across ESG-Risk, the Businesses, Model Development and Loss Forecasting

Leverage credit, modelling, data analysis expertise to develop insights and further the Bank's understanding of the implication of climate scenario analysis on the credit portfolio

Support the development of climate credit risk action plans: identifying existing controls and gap analysis, recommending potential gap mitigation activities, and quantifying the impact of potential risks and solutions

Represent credit risk in climate-related workshops and engage senior management on key decision-making as appropriate

Support ad-hoc deliverables related to climate risk management on TD's credit portfolio





Job Requirements



Analytical skills: ability to analyze data/ information, to effectively challenge, and to make proper recommendation

Strategic thinking: convergent and divergent thinking; think outside the box; ability to connect the dots

Strong communication skills: clear articulation of the risks identified; facilitate effective discussion on complex issues

Adaptivity: ability to remain organized and manage through multiple deliverables

Relationship management skills: know how to work with both Business and Technology partners

Organizational awareness: acumen to understand roles, relationships, and structures within the organization


Additional Information


Credit risk experience and/or stress testing/modelling/loss forecasting experience is preferred

ESG experience or experience in other risk areas are considered assets





Inclusiveness


At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Group Description

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.





Role Summary



This position is responsible for tracking, recording and preparation of the Divisions financial status.


**The successful candidate for this role will work at our new Magna EV battery enclosures facility located in Brampton, ON**





Key Responsibilities




Safeguard all financial documents and keep all financial matters private and confidential.

Develop and maintain good procedures and systems for all required financial tracking.

Protect the assets of the company by continual review and awareness of internal control issues, with appropriate recommendations for improvements.


Maintain accurate tracking of all Engineering changes and spending, by keeping the FEC settlement current and reconciling the F6 schedule.

Analyze Cost Center Reports for MOH analysis.

Accurate tracking of all capital commitments and spending by keeping the fixed asset database current.

Capital Packages

Review and maintain standard as directed by group office.

MCS upload and monthly updates.


Responsible for performing regular fixed asset audits as required by Magna Financial Policies.

Maintenance of standard cost tracking and allocation system by collecting and analyzing operation data, and establishing standard or expected costs.

Establish policies and procedures to ensure accurate tracking of material, labour and overhead costs in the plant.

Understand all plant processes and be able to forecast and explain trends and variances.

Study any proposed changes to plant operations, analyze for cost / benefit implications, and make recommendations.

Be actively involved in managing and analyzing material cycle counts and physical inventory.

Track and explain all plant scrap costs.

job_description:
TD Description


Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.




Department Overview


At TD Canada Trust, we are the frontline of TD Bank. We strive to build deep and long- lasting relationships with our customers. By understanding their needs and providing personalized financial solutions, our purpose is to help our customers and small businesses achieve their financial goals.

We are looking for brand champions, relationship builders, and leading professionals with an understanding of market and economic trends that can build legendary customer experiences.

Join TD Canada Trust and think like a customer, act like an owner, innovate with purpose and execute with an impact.




Job Description


Are you passionate about connecting personally with customers to assist them in achieving their financial goals? Do you love exploring and understanding investment options that best suit customers' financial needs? Then join us as a
Personal Banker / Personal Financial Services Trainee
and demonstrate your subject matter expertise in providing sound financial planning advice to promote customer loyalty and investment returns.

In this role, you are expected to:


Play a key role in advising customers of high level financial solutions from a range of available investment and credit banking solutions

By asking thoughtful financial questions, engage with customers and create positive experiences to retain and deepen relationships

Increase customer financial confidence by providing personalized financial advice, answering customer questions, and addressing their concerns; raising matters as appropriate to team members or partners while maintaining confidentiality and accuracy

Act as a point of contact for the frontline staff in handling customer problems

Maintain professional space in common areas as per marketing and regulatory guidelines

Work closely with existing and prospective customers to provide financial reviews, discuss portfolio updates and suggest additional personalized solutions based on their financial goals

Stay knowledgeable about emerging issues, evolving regulations and industry codes of conduct as well as participate in process improvement opportunities to protect the interests of the organization

Strive to achieve and improve service level agreements and productivity targets

Ensure documents are prepared consistent with relevant regulations and in a way properly reflecting business intentions

Participate fully as a team member, help build a positive and diverse work environment, willingly assist and mentor others in the completion of work activities, and address communication issues efficiently





Job Requirements



High school diploma with over 1 year of relevant experience

Completion of IFIC or CSC Course

CFSA must be completed, if hired

Post-Secondary or Undergraduate degree in related field is an asset

Sound knowledge of advanced investing and credit processes, banking solutions and concepts in order to provide personalized advice to customers in a fast-paced work environment

Proficiency in software tools including MS Office, and internet application

Tactful communicator able to exchange ideas and customer information in a concise and logical way

A self-initiator with strong organizational, planning and time management skills

job_title_name: Vpa, actuaire en tarification, assurance automobile commerciale
job_description:
10 février 2023
Industries Banques, Assurances, Services financiers
Catégories Actuariat, Banque, Assurance, Services financiers,
Toronto, ON • Temps plein
Résumé du poste

Zurich Canada est actuellement à la recherche d’une vice-présidente adjointe ou d’un vice-président adjoint, actuaire à la tarification pour l’assurance automobile commerciale. Avec l’objectif de faire croître le portefeuille d’affaires de l’assurance automobile commerciale et de contribuer à la réussite continue de Zurich Canada, ce poste vous donnera l’occasion, en tant que vice-présidente adjointe ou vice-président adjoint, actuaire à la tarification pour l’assurance automobile commerciale, de gérer la transformation du secteur de l’assurance automobile, en mettant l’accent sur la mise à jour de l’algorithme de tarification du modèle et des outils de tarification. La ou le candidat travaillera en étroite collaboration avec nos partenaires internes et avec la ou le responsable de la tarification pour fournir une analyse actuarielle grâce à son expertise, aux données internes et externes afin d’augmenter le niveau de segmentation de l’algorithme de tarification et la facilité d’utilisation des outils de tarification. La ou le candidat devra communiquer clairement les pratiques exemplaires, les nouvelles idées et les exigences à un large public, y compris les spécifications détaillées au service informatique pour le processus de tarification.

Imaginez travailler pour une entreprise qui se soucie réellement de ses employés, de ses clients, de ses partenaires et des communautés qu’elle sert.

Imaginez travailler pour une entreprise guidée par des valeurs qui a l’ambition et le désir d’être le meilleur fournisseur d’assurance mondial et celui qui a le plus d’impact dans le monde.

Chez Zurich, plus de 55 000 employés répartis dans environ 200 pays et territoires se concentrent tous sur l’aide aux personnes et aux entreprises pour protéger ce qui compte vraiment le plus pour elles. Nous sommes une entreprise guidée par des valeurs qui est fière du travail qu’elle accomplit chaque jour, et nous avons l’ambition d’être le meilleur assureur au monde.


Ce que vous ferez :

Qualifications professionnelles

Pour ce qui est de la tarification

Diriger le processus de transformation des écosystèmes de l’assurance automobile commerciale en mettant l’accent sur l’examen approfondi de l’algorithme de tarification et sa mise en œuvre dans les outils de tarification.

Diriger les interactions et agir en tant qu’expert en matière de tarification pour l’assurance automobile commerciale avec un large éventail de parties prenantes internes et externes.

Bonne compréhension du cadre réglementaire de l’assurance automobile. En mesure de mettre en œuvre différentes stratégies pour différents produits et cadres réglementaires.

Connaissance et expérience de l’analyse des facteurs ayant un impact sur le coût des sinistres et les primes, et soutien des efforts visant à améliorer la tarification.

Conception de rapports et d’analyses pour surveiller la performance du volume d’affaires.

Sous une supervision minimale, gérer les marges bénéficiaires pour les nouvelles affaires et les renouvellements.

Coordonner, préparer et effectuer des analyses actuarielles pour soutenir les décisions relatives aux changements de taux, y compris des analyses de tendances, des analyses de réassurance et des analyses des réserves de pertes et de dépenses, en ce qui concerne l’adéquation des prix et l’orientation stratégique.

Mesurer l’efficacité des stratégies de changement de prix et de taux.

Soutenir les souscripteurs en contact direct avec le marché et la souscription de produit pour ce qui est des décisions de tarification.

Fournir une consultation et une expertise technique sur les modèles actuariels et les questions de risque.

Diriger la conception, le test et la maintenance de nouveaux modèles et outils de tarification.

Se tenir au courant des conditions réglementaires et du marché et appliquer ces connaissances à la tarification.

Fournir des directives et des exigences détaillées au service informatique pour les algorithmes de tarification actuels et futurs et les besoins en données.


Ce que vous offrez :


Exigé :

Apprenti en assurance certifié par Zurich, y compris un diplôme d’associé ou un baccalauréat

ET

8 ans ou plus d’expérience dans le domaine de l’actuariat, plus le titre de FCAS ou certification internationale équivalente

OU

13 ans ou plus d’expérience dans le domaine de l’actuariat, plus le titre de ACAS

OU

Certification internationale équivalente


Préféré :

Expérience dans plusieurs secteurs fonctionnels de tarification dans différences provinces. Connaissances et compétences reflétant celles qu’un spécialiste chevronné, avec une expérience pertinente dans la tarification de l’assurance commerciale pour les flottes et les polices à tarification individuelles.

Solides compétences en communication verbale et écrite


Ce que nous offrons :

Un régime de santé et d’avantages sociaux complet avec différents niveaux de couverture pour répondre à vos besoins particuliers

Une rémunération globale compétitive

Une occasion de travailler dans le monde excitant de l’assurance, avec de nombreux plans de carrière et la possibilité de croître — nous encourageons la mobilité interne et sommes fiers de vous aider à atteindre vos objectifs de carrière et à réaliser vos aspirations.

Nous vous offrons également la possibilité de travailler pour :

Une entreprise qui accorde la priorité aux personnes, en mettant l’accent sur la diversité et l’inclusion — nous vous encourageons à vous montrer sous votre vrai jour au travail.

Une entreprise qui valorise votre contribution, et s’efforce de faire en sorte que ses employés sont en position d’avoir un impact.

Une culture de collaboration où la diversité est valorisée.

Une entreprise mondiale avec une histoire riche et ancienn

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.


At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.


To learn more about CIBC, please visit
CIBC.com



Job Description


What You'll Be Doing

As a member of the Personal and Business Banking team, you’ll leverage your banking and mortgage experience to help clients achieve their home ownership dreams. As a Mobile Mortgage Advisor, you’ll have the flexibility to meet with your clients where and when it’s convenient for them. You’ll make lasting connections and provide expert mortgage advice and product solutions that enables clients to secure their futures and own their homes.


You can effectively perform all work activities remotely, and will only be required to be on-site on an occasional basis. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.


How you’ll succeed



Client engagement - Focus on the client experience and connect on a personal level to make every interaction meaningful. Have the flexibility to support your clients’ lifestyles and meet them on their schedule. Work with Banking Centre teams to build relationships and provide clients with personalized mortgage advice and comprehensive financial planning support.

Business development - Understand your local market and potential client base and create a sales plan that will convert leads into new CIBC clients. Use your strong relationship building and networking skills to build connections, generate opportunities, and deliver bottom line results.

Community involvement - Grow your network and create lasting connections with other internal businesses and external realtors who will refer potential clients and opportunities back to you.



Who you are



You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.

You’re goal oriented. You’re motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make a difference.

You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

You’re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.

Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.



What CIBC offers


At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.


We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.



What you need to know



CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact

job_title_name: Deal Advisory - Manager Commercial Due Diligence
job_description:
Overview:
At KPMG, you’ll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.


Our Deal Advisory professionals help buyers, sellers, private equity investors and lenders in developing and executing on their value strategies.


We offer start-to-finish support in the acquisition process, including input on strategy, early identification of risk areas, coordination and execution of due diligence investigations (financial and commercial) and input and advice on contract terms geared to reduce risks. We also get involved in assisting our clients with a host of services surrounding closing the transaction and post-deal integration.



The opportunity:

Our
Deal Advisory, Commercial Due Diligence
team in
Toronto
