Lead client deliverables, applying your wide variety of transactions

Review the regulatory landscape and assess the strengths and weaknesses of competitors

Assist clients with building detailed business models including market forecasts, competitor share forecasts, evaluating synergy and cost saving opportunities, and product/service improvements.

Draft detailed professional reports and assist in preparing pitch documents e.g., proposals and presentations.

Perform financial analysis, review on target projects and formulate deal rationale and strategy.

Apply standard commercial due diligence (CDD) techniques and methods in analysis.


At times, business needs arise, and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal workday or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this.

Financial and commercial experience with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Assist in leading commercial due diligence projects and ability to add sector insights into client deliverables and proposals.

Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, Access and Word.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. The opportunity


We currently have career opportunities for Senior Consultants and Managers in our Capital Markets (CM) consulting team. Our team works to build a better world by transforming businesses through the potential of our people, technology, and innovation. Emerging technologies are transforming all lines of business and requires our customers to embrace these new technological capabilities and see them as new competitive advantages.


We work collaboratively with some of the top executives in financial institutions of all sizes and scales, helping them create and realize the best solutions for the future of their business. Each project is different, so you’ll need to be able to excel in ambiguous situations and confidently navigate ever-changing circumstances. We’ll look to you to be a self-starter, have the ability to translate complex information into simple terms, manage teams, and deliver long-term solutions with confidence. On this team, you’ll have the unique opportunity to imagine the future as well as create it, where you can craft ideas and implement them for our clients.


Your key responsibilities


As a part of the CM practice, you will advise clients and team with client information, data, and technology professionals, and/or third-party strategic alliances to deliver strategic technology-enabled transformations and major digital implementations. You will manage and deliver on client engagements, build client relationships, and support team development. This will include generating new business opportunities by developing ideas and solutions to present to internal and external clients.

Agile, growth-oriented mindsets. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. High-performance tech leaders. A strong track record of management of large teams delivering strategic technology-enabled transformations and major digital implementations. Great communicators. It is recommended to be bilingual (French/ English) to work in the Montreal office

Curiosity and purpose. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world, and who are committed to integrity in every environment

Integrity and inclusivity. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust

EY | Building a better working world

job_description:
Overview


At KPMG, you'll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.

Our Real Estate Advisory and Appraisal team undertakes valuation assignments on all types of assets across Canada and the US. We value real estate for many functions including litigation, expropriation, general purpose, and advisory functions. We also complete real estate portfolio reviews for both National and Global groups.

We provide real estate valuation services to public and private companies ranging from large multi-national companies to owner operated businesses across a broad range of asset types such as office buildings, retail malls, industrial buildings, apartment buildings, hotels, and retirement homes. Our professionals combine their knowledge of relevant valuation standards with their technical understanding across a wide range of sectors to quickly understand the nature of each property and identify key factors impacting the value of the asset being appraised.

Learn more about KPMG's Valuations practice here and explore careers in Deal Advisory here.


The opportunity:


Are you a talented individual with a proven track record on achieving client service excellence by delivering timely, high-quality products?

Our Real Property Appraisal Valuations team in Toronto is looking for a professional like you with the skills and drive to make a real difference.

As an Administrative Assistant and Technician, you will be encouraged to use your initiative, develop your knowledge in real property valuations and provide research support, working alongside a team of professionals. If you have advanced technical skills, an energetic an engaging personality, exemplify professional and service excellence, this role may be for you.


What you will do





You will provide full and confidential administrative support including proactive management of executive calendars and contact database

Take ownership for research activities and survey creation, managing and coordinating with the team

Proactively develop knowledge of our external clients (i.e., market intelligence) to enable high quality client deliverables and focus on proactively enhancing service excellence

Coordinate, prepare, edit and/or proofread documents such as correspondence, presentations, and reports using various software

Work on projects and activities that support the organization's strategic direction

Develop an expertise and knowledge of the business and the firm's practices, policies, and procedures

Ensure required risk management / compliance information is received by the Engagement Team, and proactively follow up with the Engagement Team as required

Proactively initiate the preparation of billings to ensure all services are billed on a timely basis

Plan and coordinate cost-effective travel arrangements and itineraries using Concur

Coordinate meetings, conference calls, video conferences, net meetings, and events, organize materials and take minutes

Assist in the preparation and submission of time and expense reports


What you bring to the role





4+ years senior level administration experience with an ability to be proactive and anticipate outcomes

Proven ability to prioritize and adapt to changing demands, deadlines, and a confidence to ask questions

Ability to deal with sensitive materials with a high degree of tact, discretion,

Exceptional organization, time management and communication (verbal & written) skills

Attention to detail with an aptitude for proofreading, editing, and preparing final documents

Discretion in handling confidential information

Self-starter, with a sense of humour and ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment

Experience working with large database/systems

Advanced skills with MS Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook; experience with client databases (SAP) a definite asset

The Company
AudienceView is one of the largest global ticketing companies with clients in North America and the UK. Started 20 years ago with a passion for an industry and a belief that there’s got to be a better way. We've grown and changed over the years, but we still believe there's always a better way. Through innovative technology, popular consumer brands and unique support tools, we’ve created an ecosystem that helps businesses manage their events, seamlessly. We live and focus on four core values:



We are people first.

We are innovative.

We are results driven.

We are transparent.

AudienceView is made up of people who believe wholeheartedly in the power and magic of live events. If you feel the same way, you’re in the right place. Come transform live entertainment with us.

Job Description


Assist with maintaining models for key operating metrics (Churn & Annual Recurring Revenue growth) and help analyze trends by consolidating input from both internal and external sources

Assist with Financial Modelling & be an expert user of cloud-based forecasting tool by automating reporting components and streamlining the monthly reporting process

Assist in the development of the annual budget by working closely with key business partners to capture and consolidate the financial impact of various business initiatives and priorities

Perform monthly budget to actuals variance analysis and provide in-depth commentary, flagging risks and opportunities within each cost & revenue line item

Support the development and implementation of dashboards/KPI’s, utilizing power BI, to include in financial reporting to leadership

Help build and maintain presentation materials for executive, board and/or investor presentations

Develop insightful, value-added analysis driving financial results through fact based decision making

Facilitate and evaluate project cost tracking for each product platform

Assist with special projects and provide back up to other finance and accounting responsibilities

Qualifications


Bachelor of Business Administration degree with a specialization in Finance or Accounting

Obtained professional designation (CPA)

Minimum of 3-5 years of accounting/analysis experience, with a focus on;

1. Strong technical accounting knowledge
2. Financial analysis experience
3. SAAS industry experience is considered an asset


Superior interpersonal and oral/written communication skills including the ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization

Exceptional work ethic, self-motivated and detail-oriented

Strong technical Skills in Excel and experience with Power BI is considered an asset

Why work at AudienceView


We’re a global leader in live events technology. As the essential partner to get live events discovered, attended and remembered, we help our clients sell more tickets every single day.

We’re passionate about live entertainment. AudienceView believes in the power of live events and its purpose is to ignite that passion in people around the world.

We have amazing clients. Our exciting roster of clients includes sports, live music and performing arts organizations

Our employees love us. We offer excellent benefits, competitive salaries, flexible hours, remote work opportunities and more!

We're a remote first company. Our remote culture allows our employees to have the flexibility to work anywhere in Canada, USA, UK, and Chile.

Diversity and inclusion are paramount to building our culture. The data is abundantly clear that diverse teams are more successful because they offer different perspectives, increased innovation, faster problem-solving and higher employee engagement among other benefits.

Flexible work schedule: AudienceView empowers permanent employees to take off alternating Fridays by condensing their two-week schedule into 9 days. Flexible, uncapped vacation and sick policy. Employees need time away from work to recharge.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at AudienceView. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Job Title





































Credit Support Associate - Meadowvale






































Job Description






































What is the opportunity?

In this role you will primarily be taking incoming calls from the branch network, the Advice Centre and Mortgage Specialists teams from across the country. You will answer questions about the various Credit policies and/or advice on credit structuring for in flight applications, as well as procedural, navigational and application support with Casper and Linx systems. You will also function as a credit specialist, facilitating business with partners and clients. You will assess and adjudicate applications coming from the Mortgage Specialist or Branch channels based on business needs.


Please note
: This is a hybrid opportunity, for applicants within commuting distance to the Meadowvale Centre location.


What will you do?


Provide high quality telephone service

Act as the first point of contact and expert in the interpretation of credit policies and guidelines for individuals

Assist and guide our partners so that they can submit quality credit applications to the Credit Adjudication teams

Assists clients with System and Tool navigation and integrates resources and materials into conversations to support advice and recommendations

Demonstrates commitment to First Call Resolution by taking ownership & accountability of caller problems at the first point of contact and by applying appropriate RBC processes, procedures and policies

Exercise agility to maintain a good balance between customer service and business risk

Maintain his/her knowledge of credit policies and procedures using all the tools available to you

Evolve in a dynamic environment, with frequent changes, and where teamwork is the privileged

Ensure submissions include sound credit judgment and adherence to policy and procedures

Provide complete verification of credit applications and required documentation



What do you need?

Must have:


2+ years of Credit/Lending experience

Be committed, organized, effective and accountable

Have basic knowledge about RBC credit policies while possessing excellent fast learning skills

Developed analytical spirit as well as a strong team spirit

Have the capacity to take on other responsibilities

Have proven problem solving skills

Ability to adapt to a constantly changing workplace and work shifts within the business hours of 7am - 8pm Monday to Saturday



Nice to have:


Knowledge of Casper and Linx systems.

Previous experience in a contact center environment

Bilingual in French and English



What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program

Leaders who support your development

Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

Opportunity to take on progressively greater accountability

Job Summary:
This position is responsible for managing the company’s seat inventory and pricing across its network for optimal revenue generation. This position reports to the Manager, Revenue Management – Inventory Optimization.
Duties & Responsibilities:


Implement Porter’s seat inventory management strategy and tactics for assigned markets and align day to day inventory controls on the basis of the adopted strategy


Analyze passenger demand using the RMS and other tools in order to determine and implement optimal seat inventory allocation strategy


Perform reporting and detailed analysis of KPIs, track performance versus goals, find revenue opportunities to close revenue leakage holes


Identify yield maximization opportunities and recalibrate the RM System to achieve best possible results


Monitor and analyze competitor fare initiatives and day-to-day pricing/seat inventory adjustments to ensure competitiveness.


Liaise with internal group department to ensure support is provided when required on a timely manner


Support all commercial and/or applicable operational initiatives to successful completion


Ensure data and revenue integrity are paramount in all day-to-day processes, databases and dashboards.


Active participation in Porter’s Safety Management System (SMS) including, reporting hazards and incidents encountered in daily operation; understand comply and promote the Company Safety Policy


Ensure Company Values are ingrained in day-to-day operations


Other duties as assigned

Behavioural Competencies:



Concern for Safety:
Identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others.



Teamwork:
Working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals.



Passenger/Customer Service:
Providing service excellence to internal and/or external customers (passengers).



Initiative:
Dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise.



Results Focus:
Focusing efforts on achieving high quality results consistent with the organization’s standards.



Fostering Communication:
Listening and communicating openly, honestly, and respectfully with different audiences, promoting dialogue and building consensus.

Qualifications:

University degree with a focus in Business, Economics, Marketing, Finance, Network Planning, Strategic Planning, Operational Research, Mathematics or Engineering is required. MBA or M.Sc in the above fields is a plus


Previous airline pricing and revenue management experience is an asset.


Experience/general knowledge of Revenue Management Systems, Network Planning, Distribution, Interline Partnerships or Loyalty Analytics is an asset.


Understanding of Connecting, direct and nonstop traffic type and they impact on revenue performances is an asset


Working knowledge of industry revenue management systems is a plus


Familiarity with GDS systems, Navitaire and ATPCO is an asset


Advanced proficiency in MS Office (focus on Excel) is mandatory


Knowledge of VBA is an asset


Proficiency with database management tools ( like SQL etc) is an asset


Familiarity with data modeling tools (PowerQuery, Tableau etc..) is an asset


Strong quantitative and analytical skills


Strong organizational skills with demonstrated ability to meet deadlines in high pressure environment


Independently performs analysis aimed to suggest problems solution or the optimization of revenue opportunities


Ability to work remotely in an efficient environment

Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination

Company Description:



Since 2006, Porter Airlines has been elevating the experience of economy air travel for every passenger, providing genuine hospitality with style, care and charm. Porter’s fleet of Embraer E195-E2 and De Havilland Dash 8-400 aircraft serves a North American network from Eastern Canada. Headquartered in Toronto, Porter is an Official 4 Star Airline® in the World Airline Star Rating®. Visit www.flyporter.com or follow @porterairlines on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.

Job Description

Reporting to the Senior Manager Accounts Receivable, Collections & Payment Processing, the Collections Supervisor is directly responsible for managing the day-to-day collections and credit departments located at Head Office and Moncton and is responsible for the collection results of our external collection agency. Primarily this role involves being proactive in preventing delinquent and bad debt receivables while maintaining current.

Responsibilities


Manage overdue, delinquent accounts and facilitate the solicitation of payments from customers when due, suggesting payment options and negotiating payment plans as appropriate with supervisor DOA approval of payment plans up to $100k

Responsible for making important financial decisions about business credit lines and effective actions to collect on past-due accounts when escalated to the supervisor from the collections team.

Keep the risk of financial loss to Purolator at a minimum and be able to determine and or recommend the legal action to be taken regarding outstanding debt or if the debt should be referred to a third-party collection agency

Responsible for departmental KPIs to ensure that the targets defined by the organization are achieved.

Provide technical, advisory, and moral support to the department to ensure both positive customer and team member experiences.

Directly supervises and coordinates the activities of consumer debt collectors to ensure the collection of accounts.

Develops and implements correspondence prototypes and telephone techniques for effective collection of accounts.

Trains new debt collectors in collection policies, procedures, and activities and interacts effectively with all levels of staff, customers, debtors, and vendors.

Responsible for achieving department goals and objectives daily, weekly, and monthly including continuous reporting, tracking top critical and delinquent accounts and providing weekly collection actions to the Senior Manager, Director, and VP.

Provides leadership for the team and provides coverage when needed.

Coordinates new hire training and conducts ongoing training with staff to correct or improve performance trends.

Conducts weekly audits on collectors ensuring that they adhere to policies and procedures while keeping in compliance.

Responsible for the distribution of Reminder letters, Overdue notices

Performs other miscellaneous duties as needed and as assigned
Qualifications

Completion of vocational and business courses commonly taught at the high school level

Must have previous Collection experience and demonstrated Customer facing experience.

Over 3 years and including 4 years (generally progressive experience)

Must have a working knowledge of several functional areas within Purolator such as SAP Billing, Invoicing, Shipment Channels, Service Directory, Account Setups, Contracts, Reweigh, Pricing, EDI Invoicing, and Qlikview dashboards.

Knowledge of AR processes and procedures and a good understanding of Purolator's T&C's, Delegation of authority, and billing rules for adherence/compliance to defending revenue billed.

Intimate knowledge and experience in a variety of Purolator systems namely, SAP, CLI, OBPP, Mavro, Qlikview, BI, Invoice Display, Synergize, ESO, Info Hub Viewer, and Pin Lookup.

Developed proficiency in Microsoft Office software

An independent critical thinker, with the decision-making ability to lead a team of collectors in-house and satellite.

Ability to multi-task and analyze complex aging situations with minimal direction.

Leadership supervision training with a focused development of soft skills (coaching, communication, and building relationships).

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel & Outlook with the ability to perform complex formulas in excel and create pivot tables and formulas.

job_title_name: Project Coordinator, Construction Services, Property Management
job_description:
JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.

JLL is currently seeking a dynamic individual for the role of Project Coordinator to provide reliable, timely, and professional support to the Project Team, assisting with the day-to-day project coordination activities. The position entails working with a diverse group of internal and external stakeholders at all levels of the organization, and the successful candidate will require the independent judgment to plan, prioritize, and organize a diverse workload.


Responsibilities:

Prepare project management reports and meeting minutes
Manage all project documentation including contracts, budgets, and schedules
Maintain best practices templates on SharePoint site
Administrative duties to include but not limited to copying, travel arrangements, expense report preparation, organizing lunches, WebEx meetings, etc.
Manage accounts receivables according to the guidelines and requirements set by the Regional Operations Manager or project team
Ensure that all accounts receivables are maintained at a level not to exceed planned working capital charge as set by corporate finance, the project team and/or the Regional Operations Manager
Assist local team in meeting targeting financial numbers on a Regional and National level as determined on a yearly basis by the Management Executive Committee
Responsible for smaller marketing functions including presentations, responses to proposals and research
Proactively manage project-related issues on account or assignment
Demonstrate proficiency in the use and application of all project management technology as required for assigned projects
All other duties and tasks assigned.

Desired Experience and Education
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, Business, Architecture, Engineering, or Construction Management
A minimum of five (5) years’ experience
Accounting experience or previous real estate support roles for brokers or project managers
Knowledge of construction or commercial real estate industry a plus
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with executive level internal & external clients
Organizational & detailed-oriented with the ability to prioritize and manage differing needs of the business
Ability to multi-task, and to work as part of team and independently
Knowledge of computer programs (Excel, Word, and Power Point)
Ability to solve difficult problems with effective & alternate solutions, ability to anticipate hidden or potential problems
Ability to make decisions in a timely manner, able to make quick decisions or provide recommendations
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!

Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth:

JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health.

About JLL –

We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

job_title_name: Finance & Risk Business Integration Data Analyst
job_description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.






































































































Job Title





































Finance & Risk Business Integration Data Analyst






































Job Description







































Elicit, analyze and understand business and data requirements to develop complete business solutions.

Build a Balance sheet view and or other reports from CORE/RFCL using centralized feeds, Risk Finance Compute Layer – an interface generate Super user views of balance sheet products.

Apply scripting/programming skills to assemble various types of source data (unstructured, semi-structured, and structured) into well prepared data sets with multiple levels of granularities.

Analyze large data sets and summarize findings and draw conclusions, presenting actionable business recommendations in a simplified manner.

Work closely with Agile teams to ensure proper implementation of business solutions.

Perform data profiling using SQL to validate data analysis and identify/resolve data issues.

Work on existing monthly quarterly BAU reporting and co-ordination of work with other groups within SDMO.

Develop analytical solutions by applying machine learning techniques and making recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.

Work with finance and risk report owner to adopt their reports to the centralized data platform.



Must-have


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Mathematics, Management Information System or Statistics.

Minimum of two (2) years of experience with big data or data analytics solutions preferably in the financial services industry.

Intermediate SQL skills and ability to write and understand complex SQL queries.

Advanced Excel Skills to analyze large data sets using pivot tables and pivot reporting.

Experience with creating and managing Tableau reporting.

Understanding and usage of SQL keywords, data types, constraints, pivots, sub queries, logical and comparison operators, and advanced joins (inner, outer) and unions.



Nice-to-have


Knowledge of CORE, OTIS, PDS, ERDL, EDW and/or EODc.

Experience with assembling, slicing/dicing and analysis of large data set.

Experience with Datameer or any other BI tool (DataIQ / Dremio etc.)

Experience with financial risk management, credit risk, accounting or corporate finance.



What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation.

Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.

Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team opportunities to do challenging work.

The FRIDA – BI Data Analyst is a problem solver who can act as a bridge between Business, IT and Governance teams to translate requirements, complex.

WORK ILLUSTRATION:


The Asset Investment Analyst is responsible for supporting the development, management and continuous improvement of processes and systems that are cross-functional in nature. The incumbent supports the standards and materials engineers and technologists in the development of standards and specifications. Working within the Standards & Procurement area, the incumbent participates in short- and long-range strategic planning and supports the preparation of engineering, technical, or business reports and studies, and demonstrates effective project management and process efficiencies.



The incumbent is expected to behave ethically and follow the established code of business conduct, policies and internal control procedures, laws and regulations governing Toronto Hydro.



Toronto Hydro has implemented a mandatory vaccination requirement for all its employees. Proof of full vaccination will be required upon receiving a conditional offer of employment. Toronto Hydro will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability or any other ground protected by the Ontario Human Rights Code.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


Actively supports the team in preparation of technical specifications, standards and studies, investigation and evaluation of new technologies.


Compares alternatives based on cost/benefit considerations, customer needs, safety, statistical analysis and engineering principles, and recommends the optimum solution.


Provides timely support and consultation, demonstrates effective project management and process efficiencies; reviews, develops and/or presents business proposals, plans, designs, processes, operational procedures and practices.


Engages with internal and external stakeholders to analyze different technical perspectives on proposed initiatives, including standards revisions and equipment approvals.


Supports engineers in preparation of technical training documents and equipment roll-out.


Liaises with internal stakeholders and external vendors to coordinate testing and training for new products and equipment.


Stay current with industry best practices in business, process methodologies and technologies and recommend solutions to positively impact business results; conduct research on industry and market trends.


Supports development and drafting of construction standards using MicroStation




REQUIREMENTS:


Undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering.


Three (3) to five (5) years of experience in data mining including programming, process optimization, analysis for business projects, identification of areas for improvement and development of new initiatives.


Project management designation considered an asset.


Knowledge of electricity distribution engineering, construction, safety rules, regulations.


Knowledge of and experience with distribution products and equipment preferred.


Knowledge of business case development, business process re-engineering techniques and process optimization.


Fully proficient in use of Microsoft Office including MS Excel, Access, Visio, and other Project Management tools.


Awareness of project management processes, principles and methodologies.


Ability to synthesize, evaluate and integrate information from multiple sources, and to provide recommendations for continuous improvement.


Ability to work collaboratively on inter-departmental teams and across organizational boundaries.


Solid understanding of business issues and challenges, and demonstrates tact and diplomacy specifically in a customer engagement/stakeholder management environment.


Excellent analytical, technical, and business solution development skills, including the proven ability to function effectively in a dynamic environment within a multi-disciplinary team setting.


Ability to develop dependable feedback systems and tracking.


Strong facilitation, presentation, and report writing skills.




Toronto Hydro has introduced a Hybrid Work Arrangement. This position allows for remote work up to three days per week, based on business needs. Employees will be required to come onsite on those days when they are involved in activities that they or their leader feel are better conducted in person. You are expected to live in Ontario and within reasonable commuting distance of the office.

job_title_name: Manager Global Economic Sanctions Client Screening
job_description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.






































































































Job Title





































Manager Global Economic Sanctions Client Screening






































Job Description






































What is the opportunity?

Reporting to the Director of Global Economic Sanctions Screening Governance, the Senior Manager Global Economic Sanctions Advisory contributes to the management of the global sanctions program and acts a subject matter expert by providing direction and guidance on sanctions regulatory requirements as it pertains to client and payments screening functionality and list management practices across the enterprise. Responsible for sanctions List Management implementation and maintenance activities, including the identification of new list requirements, and for the assessment of Control List Filter (CLF) and Low Volume Scanning (LVS) alerts referred to GES for review. Responsibilities also include the execution of ongoing (monthly or other frequency) regulatory reporting to Canadian regulators or industry regulatory bodies.


What will you do?


Have an understanding of relevant provisions in the sanctions regulations (Canada, US, UK and the EU) to appropriately assess sanctions risk from a global perspective as it relates to list management, Canadian regulatory reporting and also to have an understanding of any additional jurisdictional-based list management and regulatory reporting obligations with respect to frozen assets;

Responsible to collaborate with RBC’s global AML Compliance teams and businesses to provide support and address sanctions related inquiries in a timely manner, with a global view where required, for list management, name screening alert adjudication and Canadian regulatory reporting;

Responsible to adjudicate name screening alerts referred to the Global Economic Sanctions team, in a timely and accurate manner;

Responsible for filing monthly regulatory reports with Canadian regulators in an accurate and timely manner, as well as for maintaining documentation related to frozen assets oversight activities;

Responsible for analyzing new sanctions lists and for updates to the RBC enterprise sanctions lists standards and jurisdictional based local sanctions list standards; including engagement with relevant IT contacts and execution of all documentation update requirements;

Responsible to review and investigate escalations received by RBC’s global Business Units related to list management and sanctions screening hits and to provide direction and support, where required;

Maintain relevant procedural documentation



What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


1-2 years proven Financial Industry Compliance Experience, ideally including sanctions experience.

Excels in a high paced, high pressured environment

Strong capability to work with Microsoft suite of products including Excel, Word, PowerPoint

Experience with data analysis and investigations

Undergraduate Degree



Nice-to-have


ACAMS certification


What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. Job Title: Part-Time Bookkeeper

Location: Toronto In person

Hours: 3 days a week, 8 hours per day

We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented bookkeeper to join our team on a part-time basis. The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records and ensuring the timely completion of various bookkeeping tasks. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to join a fast-paced and dynamic work environment with the possibility of a full-time position being offered within 3-6 months. Financial analysis, report writing and analytical skills are a plus.

Responsibilities:


Recording financial transactions and maintaining accurate records

Reconciling bank statements and managing accounts payable and receivable

Generating financial reports, such as income statements and balance sheets

Assisting with the preparation of tax returns and other financial reporting requirements

Maintaining an organized and efficient filing system

Supporting the accounting team with various ad-hoc tasks as needed


Requirements:


Recommended 3-4 years of experience in accounting and bookkeeping

Strong understanding of accounting principles and bookkeeping practices

Proficiency in QuickBooks or similar accounting software

Excellent attention to detail and strong organizational skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Good communication skills, both written and verbal

Strong command of Microsoft Excel


This is a part-time position, working 3 days a week for 8 hours per day. We offer a competitive salary and a supportive work environment. If you are a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for bookkeeping, we would love to hear from you.

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience. We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Part-time hours: 24 per week

Salary: From $17.00 per hour

Benefits:


Casual dress

Company events

On-site parking

French not required

8 hour shift

MUST HAVE AT LEAST 2 YEARS EXPERIENCE in QuickBooks and Bookkeeping,

*-A self-motivated, individual who is responsible, dependable with strong work ethics and trust worthy
- Experience in Quick Books Accounting Software and payroll processing
*- Solid understanding of Employment Guidelines and payroll policies
- Performing standard administrative functions such as sorting incoming mail, creating invoices, posting payments, preparing subsidy applications, bank deposits and account reconciliations
- Refreshing and maintaining office filing systems
- Journal entries, receivable and payable monitoring and processing, reconciliations, monthly expense claims
- Answering phone queries*
-Also to act as an administrative assistant for the daily operations and the needs of the business.
